Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Belfast_resident_12
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on a recommendation from a relative who had stayed there twice. Room and general hotel decor stylish and clean. Staff very helpful. Location near to park, good range of restaurants and métro. On direct RER line from CDG airport. Appreciated having free wifi, (room TV also had keyboard, mouse and internet connection).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Oliver L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The value for money is ok (price a bit high), The place is very clean, The service and location are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in almost every way”
Reviews.Author: sommarcatta
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights in a prestige double room. The room is small as mentioned before. You can´t swing a cat or a dog but that shouldnt be the purpose of anyones trip to wonderful Paris! The welcoming and behaviour from the staff was perfect. They always greeted you with big smiles. The bathroom was very clean and fresh. They provided new towels every day. Bathroom ameneties are only a very small shower gel and schampoo, bring your own! Hairdryer is put in the closet. The prestigerooms provide a combined applecomputer and tv. Free internet and Wi Fi. The channels however are mostly french speeking. I do expect comfortable beds in a prestige room which was not the case here. They were terribly hard with just a blanket surrounded by two single sheets. During the night you will wake up with just the blanket closest to you body and face. Not the nicest of things since they probably don´t wash them between every guest... The room are definately not soundproofed! You will wake up every time your neghbours will close their doors and talk in the hallway. On the other hand you won´t here much from the street. The hotel is tucked away on a one way street with not much traffic or people passing at night. To get to all the excitement you just have to walk one block and you will find all the nice restaurants, cafes, bars to satisfy anyones needs. We walked everywhere and never needed to use public transportation. We did some nice shopping on Rue de Rivoli. And then I talk about shopping for everyones wallet. At the end of the long road towards the Seine, you´ll find some departmentstores. There is one called BHV. They have spread their departments in different buildings but nice clothes to nice prices. On the same street there are two H&M, Mango, Zara and a C&A. If you continue onwards toward the Opera on avenue de l´Opera there is some good shopping here too. Look for CAMAIEU, Monoprix, Benetton, Diesel, Desigual,Levi´s. The last night we spent watching a show a Paradis Latin whitch was fun and a good alternative to the much more expensive shows at Moulin Rouge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dory92064
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon is a wonderful small boutique hotel located in the 6th district on a very small street. Location is perfect for exploring Paris. Walking distance to many attractions, close to many good restaurants and cafes and close to the Odeon metro stop. The staff is very gracious and helpful. The room was very large for Paris and had a terrace. Very comfortable bed and linen. Would definitely stay again. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel but dining area looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “3 star Hotel by Luxemburg Gardens & Odeon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sophie_c_l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon last summer (July 2011). Our room was on first floor with tiny patio that looked out to the courtyard. I think its called SUPERIOR DOUBLE ROOM WITH TERRACE and shower on their website. The room itself was average in size, possibly even decent by Paris standards, but it had a dark red stripy wallcovering which seemed to darken the room quite a bit, as there is not much light from the courtyard.. The hotel is kind of basic in terms of services, but is in a really nice location, very close to Luxembourg gardens and Odeon Theather. This arrondisment is quiet and quaint, we liked it. As for the hotel, we might try stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: jpetrickmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon recently and found everything to be ideal. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful, the breakfast was generous, with excellent bread and croissants, and the room was spotless, with a comfortable bed. Best of all was the location, near to all Left Bank attractions, but on a quiet and attractive street near the Odeon theater and the Luxembourg Gardens. Transportation to and from the airport was also very easy, as it was a short walk to the RER station.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Akrep81
Reviews.Content: It's a simple hotel. If you like simple places, you may enjoy your stay. It's in an unassuming building with a small reception area with not many amenities. The members of staff are helpful and pleasant. The rooms are very simple too. They are smallish in size. There's a TV in the room but didn't work properly, it looked like it was from 1991. The rooms are a bit noisy. We could hear our neighbours and people walking in the corridor so I can't say I slept well at nights. Also I don't mind simple decor and furniture but this place didn't have much personality. The location is great of course!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Louise L
Reviews.Content: Jardin de L'Odeon is a very nice and comfortable hotel! The hotel provides extremely good service, given to its guests by kind, attentive and very professional personell. Location is 'perfect' if you want to visit the most famous and interesting places in the central of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Holly_M_99
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in an area where there's "Paris life" right on the doorstep - without paying high bills. This hotel, between the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens and the lively Blvd St Germain, was perfect. We got a special offer on the room rate so it was fairly reasonable, and the room was lovely - not huge but well furnished, spotlessly clean and with a gorgeous power shower. It was also beautifully quiet - even the on-street room we had was silent in the evenings and mornings. We took the hotel breakfast 2 of our 3 mornings; at 10 euros pp we thought it was a bit pricey - until we ate out one morning. Gulp! Paris food prices are quite frightening these days (eg, 6 euros for a cafe latte). So we highly recommend the hotel breakfast as it was delicious, including fresh pressed orange juice and beautiful crockery, which is always a nice touch. And finally, many others have commented and we concur - the hotel staff are lovely: so friendly and helpful, they really made us feel welcome, and nothing was ever any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spectator
Reviews.Content: This is a well furnished hotel, with small rooms and large bathrooms. I have stayed at this hotel a number of times as it is very well done and in the 6th arr, St Germain, close to the Luxembourg Gardens. The RER from Charles De Gaulle Airport stops at the Luxembourg Garden and the metro lines 4 and 10 stop at the Odeon which is a short walk down to Blvd St Germain and not at the actual Odeon which is essentially across the street from the hotel. The faults with the hotel are few: small rooms and not enough closet space. Prices of all hotels in the 6th arr are higher than they would be in other less desirable locations and this hotel is not an exception. Breakfast is overpriced, no worse so than at any hotel. If all you desire is a croissant and coffee, there are any number of places, even a Starbucks nearby which are 1/4 the price of a hotel breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, even better location”
Reviews.Author: Sugar1981
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon on a trip to Europe and are still talking about the hotel. Although I would have preferred initially to find a hotel room with more space, I quickly got over the size of the room due to the location. We literally walked all over Paris everyday from this location. The St. Germain area is incredible and easily accessible by foot or taxi to mostly everything you would ever want to see. The restaurants in the neighborhood were friendly and had excellent service. We even spotted Princess Charlotte of Monaco at a little Italian restaurant only a few blocks from the hotel, which made my fiance's trip! The staff at the hotel went above and beyond to ensure that we always knew where we were going and that we were comfortable. I would definitely consider staying here again in the future and recommending it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleanliness, friendly and quite comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that's more than OK but not quite wow. Better than average, and great as a business hotel (especially if you manage to get a good rate) with a wonderful location and very friendly staff. It's not, though, a hotel for romance since the rooms are a little bit tired (very clean, well maintained, but just feel a generation or two older than current minimalist boutique hotels, well-designed modern capsule/chain hotels). Beds are comfy but - in Parisian style - take up most of the modest floor space ;) Staff are invariably friendly and helpful at all hours. Street rooms are great and although there's some "bustle" they're not noisy and they have the benefit of being able to open windows, hang out and look at l'Odeon. The rooms get a bit stuffy and the aircon is more 'blowing' than 'climate control', but that could have been a winter setting? Top marks for free, effective wifi in the rooms. So although I'm not gushing about the wonders of this hotel I do like it (just don't "love" it!), and this is my second stay here. For business it's my default hotel (especially since it's an easy hop from Gare du Nord), but it wouldn't be necessarily my first choice for a romantic weekend or if I had the kids with me too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cestrian56
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a superb location being at the centre of the left bank area, and a short walk from the Luxembourg Gardens and RER station. The lobby is very stylish and the reception staff extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast room includes an external garden area which is nice to look out on compared to the usual dark cellar breakfast rooms in Paris hotels. We had a deluxe bedroom with a lovely terrace but the room was let down by the small bathroom which lacked a proper shower (you have to hold the shower hose whist sitting in the bath).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: scubafan27
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is really a wonderful place to stay in Paris. Well located on a quaint little street in St. Germain, the hotel is the definition of boutique. It is small, and the rooms are small too, but everything is perfectly maintained. The rooms are clean and very well decorated. The bathrooms are very small but the shower is great and enclosed. The breakfast is served off the lobby and is delicious. In particular, the woman who serves the breakfast is as nice as can be. There are so many great shops, cafes and restaurants so close to the hotel. It's very well located for the Metro and so many sites are within walking distance. The rooms were heavily discounted for my stay last winter, which made this hotel an incredible value. I would come back to stay at Jardin de L'Odeon in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Paris break”
Reviews.Author: wonderlanded
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on the Left Bank in Paris and this was my first stay at Jardin de l'Odeon, and it was a comfortable and enjoyable stay and a brilliant location for seeing Paris. It's close to great restaurants and shops and to a convenient Metro line. Rooms aren't huge -- but then, it's Paris so people shouldn't be expecting enormous hotel rooms! Rooms are nicely decorated and our room, overlooking the street was quiet at night and the windows did manage to muffle the sound of construction across the street, which would only be a temporary issue. There were only two pillows in the room and when we asked for more (I was six months pregnant at the time) we were informed that there were no more pillows in the hotel, which seemed strange. However, the next morning we had more pillows delivered so staff do take the time to listen to what their customers need.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stephen A
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and pleasant staff. Despite a problem with our reservation, the staff went out of their way to find us rooms and welcome us to their hotel. The rooms were small but comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel is in very easy walking distance of lots of great restaurants, sightseeing and shopping. Overall, we had a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Saint Germain des Pres/Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: We had never visited Paris before, but we could not have been happier with the hotel Jardin de l'Odeon. Room was just as promised in the reservation, top floor (6th) with a balcony, stylish decor, friendly and very helpful staff. Location was ideal for walking to Saint Germain or Ile de Cite, catching the Metro, and discovering intimate neighborhoods surrounding the Sorbonne and the Pantheon. Very close to everything we wanted to do, with several outstanding restaurants within walking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: lar2sharm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not only lovely but the staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. It's about a two block walk to Jardin du Luxembourg and about 4 blocks to St. Germain. We had a quiet room overlooking a beautiful courtyard and the location made it easy to get anywhere we wanted to go. We really appreciated being able to take the RER to and from the airport as the hotel is just a few blocks from the Luxembourg Metro. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBoy2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over New Year's, and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience. While the rooms were a little small (but that's to be expected in Paris), they were very clean and well kept. The bathroom was clean and the water pressure in the shower was great! Also, the hotel staffs their front desk 24/7, and they ask you to give them the key when you're out and about - which means you have no chance of losing it! Not having to keep track of a key was a very convenient touch! And, they speak great English and are fluent in many other languages. So, there was never any worry of a language barrier! The location was perfect! There are tons of great cafes, shops and everything we did was in walking distance. There's even a Starbuck's close by for those American visitors who are craving an American coffee (no need though as the French coffee is much better!). If you prefer to take the metro, the Odeon metro line is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Also, the RER (from CDG airport) stops at Luxembourg Gardens, which is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The friendly service and wonderful recommendations were awesome, and we highly recommend this hotel to all Paris visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiday5_11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 night for New Years, wonderful Hotel, exceptional staff. The Hotel is located in a quiet area but central to everything . We would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foisgras11
Reviews.Content: For a Left Bank stay, has a fantastic location close to Odean Metro on a quiet street. Clean and well designed in a contemporary way. Room was fine (bathroom was a bit tight). Breakfast was very good. The staff (Anka and Luis) were extremely nice and very helpful in terms of sights, restaurants, etc. We booked months ahead of our stay and took advantage of a great 3 night package inc. breakfast--fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: DebTravelsSD
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Jardin de l'Odeon (Paris) November 14, 2011 Excellent location on a side street but you still felt safe walking at night. We booked a junior suite which was large enough for three of us and includes wi-fi. Bathroom was large with a full size tub with a hand-held shower and partial glass door; wife didn't care for this. The front desk (literally) staff was multilingual and very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. We loved the price, the location and the Staff. We highly recommend this hotel and will ourselves return. Thank you Jennifer for finding this Jewel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a great location”
Reviews.Author: knievel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one week while on vacation in Paris. We wanted to stay in the left bank and are very pleased to confirm the positive reviews we read on TA. The location is very convenient, on a quiet back-street about 3-4 minutes walk from the Odeon metro stop (two metro lines), 6-7 minutes walk from the Luxembourg stop on the RER, and 10 minutes walk from the St. Michel stop on the metro/RER. Travel by RER to/from either CDG or Orly Airport is simple and straightforward. Many of the most popular sites in Paris are within 10-30 minutes walk (eg, Notre Dame, the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, etc.) and others are a short metro ride. You can travel to Versailles in less than one hour from the St. Michel RER. We did not have the hotel breakfast ourselves, but they do offer a buffet-style breakfast for an additional €12 which is in-line with nearby restaurants. We typically paid between €8-14 each for breakfast in the area. Neo Café on Blvd. St. Germain was one of the better options. There are many choices for all meals at various prices within short walking distance, ranging from French to other international cuisines (eg, Italian, Vietnamese, Moroccan, Mexican, and others). Our best dinner may have been Vietnamese at Muraile de Jade on Rue de l'Ancienne Comédie. The hotel has about 40 rooms over five floors with an elevator. Our room was on the 4th floor in the front with a flower box in the large, street-facing windows. It was not roomy, but the size is very much in line with typical European hotels. Everything was clean and efficient, and there was plenty of room for our two suitcases including a week’s worth of autumn clothes. There was also a desk, a small refrigerator, and a safe in the good-sized closet. I was pleasantly surprised to find a thermostat in the room so heating/cooling was easily controlled, ensuring that we were comfortable throughout. We didn’t notice any noise from either inside or outside the hotel, even with ongoing construction/cleaning on the building across the street. The bathroom was in proportion, but perfectly adequate and equally functional with a hand-held shower and partial glass door. We got better practiced at keeping the floor dry as the week went on. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The front desk staff spoke multiple languages and were very pleasant and helpful, especially when we were hoping to print out the tickets to the Palace of Versailles which we purchased on our phone. We recommend buying them online before arriving in Versailles. All in all, the hotel is very competitively priced, intelligently appointed, and professionally run. We highly recommend it. It would be tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mtraveler93
Reviews.Content: Very clean place. Quite spacious rooms. Peaceful and calming atmosphere too. No in house food but during the day time they have service. But there are cafe's just 5 mins walk up. Very close to Odeon Station. Staff are very helpful and go out of the way to provide information. After hours you have to go down to get water or anything, it's great if you are not passed out or dehydrated from all the vin. Not all rooms have fridges so you need to check before you reserve if you would like one. But on the whole, it is a great place for the price and great location. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: mariitta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon with friends the first weekend of Dedember. We were all extremely happy with this hotel. Rooms were small, as most rooms in Paris but clean and had everything we needed. Specially as we had a room with a terrace. We have stayed in many other hotels in Saint Germain area but this was defenitely the best value for money. The very friendly staff was a big bonus for the hotel. We will all be back.

Reviews.Title: “For location, friendly staff and cleanliness alone this hotel is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: PascalS22
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit Jardin de L’Odeon. Odeon and the Saint Germain area is an ideal area to base your visit to Paris. Although a little touristy, its part of an upmarket area where you feel safe walking through the streets at night. There are many restaurants and bars filled with people nearby. Although the hotel is located centrally, close to many of the restaurants/bars, its tucked away in a quiet street where you will be able to have a quiet nights sleep. Like the hotel itself, the rooms are on the small side, but standard for Paris hotels and overall very comfortable and clean. Getting to this hotel is very easy from the Gard du Nord (Eurostar stop). Odeon is on a direct line from the Gard du Nord and takes approx 30-40mins to the hotel. It’s a short walk from Odeon station to the hotel (approx 400 meters). TIPS: - The hotel provides free wifi - Le Comptoire bistro/restaurant is just down the road and a must for foodies, but be prepared to wait in line for lunch and dinner as they don’t always take bookings. - Do your restaurant research before going and book early where possible. There are a lot of tourist traps in the area. Be sceptical of any restaurants with English/Japanese/etc menus displayed at the front - The hotel is next door to a local theatre, check what’s on during your visit and pre-book - Make use of the great bakeries in the area for breakfast The hotel lobby is rather quirky with a range of statues and odd décor. Not sure what to make of the large photo behind of the concierge desk of a woman posing on top of a safe in the wardrobe of a room within the hotel...strange but cheerful! Considering the location, friendly staff and cleanliness alone this hotel is a great find. We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Room 51”
Reviews.Author: Irina H
Reviews.Content: We were very much satisfied with the quality of the hotel. The stuff was very helpful and friendly, the lady serving the breakfast, Irina, was fluent in several languages and always were attentive. The only thing I felt was not quite comfortable is that the TV was stangly placed in our room, internet was free, some basic TV channels, unfortunately no films available. The room was small but very cosy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. It is situated close to everything. I would also recommend the restaurant Polidor, which is situated in 2 min walk from the hotel with a simple, honest, french food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great area of Paris, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Marchimp
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay, staff were helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Small but only as described on the website, so no surprises and the bathroom was actually bigger than expected for Paris. Great location for sightseeing, we have previously stayed in the Marais and it was nice to be in a different, quieter area, quiet street but with everything you want a stones throw away. Luxembourg gardens are beautiful too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service! Excellent location.....”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. My daughter and I loved the location and the entire staff was extremely gracious and full of helpful suggestions. The rooms are very clean and every part of Paris is easily accessible from the hotel. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location ! Computer in room !”
Reviews.Author: kellyrila
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Prestige double room in Nov2011. Hotel staff are very helpful, friendly and with fluent english. Room is newly renovated, quite spacious in parisien standard. There's a computer/tv on the working desk which u can go to internet/skype..etc for free. Bathroom is clean and new, however, the bathtub size is too 'high' to "step out" for a 162cm height women like me. Shower temp is difficult to adjust and too hot most of the time. Mattress I have to say its NOT comfortable just like NO SUPPORT, not sure which kind of mattress it is. Just can't sleep well for all 3 nights which is quite disappointed. Location is excellent in Odeon, walkable distance to St Germain and many other major attractions in paris. There're a few michele restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice accommodations. Terrific value.”
Reviews.Author: teampickles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property in September and got a great rate. Was a bit worried about noise due to the great location, but it was tucked away just enough that we slept soundly. Can't say enough about this location - nearby bustling area with shops, restaurants, nightlife and brisk walk to Notre Dame. Would definitely recommend & stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WarmweatherHeather
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently went to Paris for a girls trip and decided to stay here after much research and the positive trip advisor reviews. The hotel was in a perfect location on a quiet side street that was a two minute walk from the odeon metro station, and about 5 great restaurants. You are also an easy walk to Notre Dame Cathedral and Rue St Germain. The thing that impressed me the most before we even arrived was how incredibly helpful the staff was. I emailed the hotel in advance to confirm our arrival and was told by Anke that the metro from the airport was under repair. She arranged for a private car to transport us to the hotel. Had she not informed us of this, we would have had a negative start to our first trip to Paris as we were unfamiliar with the transportation system. Anke continued to be incredibly helpful for the duration of our trip. This is an older hotel so as others commented the rooms are not American super sized. For me this was not a big deal as I had researched and anticipated that this was the case. We booked the 2 floor three person room that had two bathrooms, my friend from London met us in Paris and the three of us shared the room and we didn't have any problems with the amount of space. I would recommend this hotel for any upcoming stay and I plan to stay there again for my next trip. On a side note, we found the French people to be incredibly nice and helpful. I had heard rumors about them being rude we did not encounter that. So if you are considering going and are concerned about the people, we found that if we tried to speak as much French as we new and were polite to them, they were very accommodating and helpful to us. I loved Paris and the two day trips we took to the country side and will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: flg1945
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I shared their mini-suite. It was perfect. The staff was cordial and welcoming. The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuchMumbai
Reviews.Content: after reading about the hotel on tripadvisor i was pleasantly surprised to be in this charming hotel, staff was superb specially Anke and Mr.Cherief.I had a very early flight so in the morning Mr. Cherief made small breakfast which was not a part of his duty.I was very happy to be in this hotel, I will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0276
Reviews.Content: We found a 50% discount rate at 130 Euro. I still find this expensive for this hotel, which is nice, quaint, clean, but small and very noisy in the morning. Staff are nice and friendly and the location is ideal, but in Paris there are good hotels for much cheaper. I found this hotel nice, but really not worth the 50% discount rate, never mind the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great position , quiet, clean, air conditioning that worked and a friendly helpful team”
Reviews.Author: MikeOgilvie
Reviews.Content: Nice small airy hotel in a great position a few minutes from the Seine and also jsut under Luxembourg gardens - highy recommended from me - superb value for money

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate L
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and great location from which to explore Paris. The staff were extremely helpful and advised us on arrival about transport strike action planned for the day we were leaving, arranged for a private transfer to ensure we didn't miss our flight. Rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated, apple tv/computer system very convenient and loved the small but well set up bathroom and full size bath.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite 6th district hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghawk777
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris once a year and have sampled a number of hotels in the 6th district. This is so far my favorite in the 3-star good value (for Paris) category. The staff is friendly and attentive, the hotel has charm but feels modern and updated, there is free wi-fi in every room, the breakfast area is on the ground floor and linked to the inner courtyard, the rooms are typically Parisian (i.e. smallish) but feel very up-to-date and very clean. Location is perfect, not on a main street. Even though my wife and I only stayed there twice for one-night in October (travelling in other areas meanwhile), they were totally welcoming as if we were there for a long stay. Though the building across the street was being repainted (oct 2011), it wasn't an issue on weekends and besides, who wants to spend too much time in the room during work hours. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. One little thing is that the invoice from the hotel says St. Sulpice which makes it a little confusing with other hotels with a similar name.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Leslie C
Reviews.Content: We were overall very please, our room was extrememly small, faced a reno across the street hich was a little disappointing (Oct 2011) but the flowers were still in the window box and we spent so little time in the room. The front desk staff were very good, spoke English, very good at helping us with directions and advice. There was always a warm welcome when we arrived back at the hotel after a long day out seeing the sights Location of the hotel is great with lots of little restaurants close by. Not far from major landmarks and transit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwen_Indy
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Boutique Hotel in a perfect "old" Paris location. We were extremely happy with the location and the facilities. While we know a little French, the staff spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff- highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked the hotel online with the special fall rate, requesting two twin beds. We got the very last room at that rate, and since all of Paris was booked up, we crossed our fingers they would honor our twin-bed request. Well, not only did they honor our request, but the staff went above and beyond to help us feel at home during our 6 day trip. They truly exemplified hospitality- from arranging shuttles to the airport, to giving us menu suggestions (complete with menu printouts), to calling to ask if we would like them to bring us some ice (we are Americans, afterall!). I found the staff to be incredibly lovely, gracious, and accommodating. Plus, this hotel is in the PRIME district for tourists. I thought we'd take the metro more than we did, but we didn't have a need- we walked to the Notre Dame, Louvre, Saint Chappell, Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, etc. When we were ready to take the metro, it was just a couple of blocks away. Tons of cafes with delicious and affordable eats within a couple of blocks, and very safe. My mom loved that there was air-conditioning as well, and the location is on a quiet side street- very little street noise. My only complaint is that the pillows really left something to be desired. My mom and I both had a very difficult time falling asleep each night as the pillows were hard and very thin. Coupled with the hard mattress, we both had neck pain. I'd suggest bringing some sort of pillow if you have room to pack it! I absolutely loved Paris and will definitely stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, especially for RER to CDG”
Reviews.Author: Isle-to-Isle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a bit pricier than our normal travel budget but rooms were going FAST in Paris (even a month ahead of our visit, and for a Monday night), and we grabbed what we could. Was it all I would hope for $350/night? Not really, but it was Paris in September. That said, the hotel did have a lot going for it: great location, the staff was VERY friendly and helpful (and English-speaking), and it’s just a short walk to Cluny La Sorbonne RER station where you can get to Charles de Gaulle EASILY for just 9+ Euros (and in only 45 minutes). So we probably saved enough in cab fare to pay the extra room costs! The staff also happily printed our boarding passes for us. Some have commented about rooms not being that large or modern, but our room had been completely updated and was very modern/clean (but not large – it’s Paris, right?) We were on the main level, and the room was actually accessed by going through the breakfast room, which we thought was odd, but it also had direct garden access and a private patio which was quite nice and light. (And easy to get to breakfast! Although unfortunately breakfast is an additional cost.) We only stayed in Paris one night and the sole purpose was to get our flight home, and this was a great place for that -- easy to walk around the neighborhood, felt safe, and super easy to get that RER train in the morning. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cdn T
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based upon location and the reviews we read on trip advisor. We were not disappointed! This was our first trip to Paris and we asked the front desk staff MANY questions. They answered each and every question and was extremely helpful. The hotel is within walking distance to most major attractions and very close to the Odeon Metro station. If you are a runner, bring your running shoes.... the Luxembourg Gardens are just a block away and you'll be able to run around the park with all the locals. We would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mbenveniste
Reviews.Content: We recently had a very pleasant stay at Jardin de L'Odean. The rooms are small--but in line with most in Europe. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. Room service was prompt and courteous. Our shower was the hand held type, within the bath tub, so if this is an issue for you, be sure to ask. The personnel at the desk were always very helpful. The location is excellent, you can walk anywhere you need to be!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located and quintessentially Parisian”
Reviews.Author: Moreymints
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful, boutique hotel in August. It was our first time in Paris and we were not disappointed. The rooms were clean, tasteful, quiet and adequately sized with nice views of the street over the charming window flower boxes. We travelled with two kids and whilst there was no connecting room, our rooms were right opposite to each other. The staff were more than helpful, the continental breakfasts were delicious and the location was fantastic. The nearby Luxemberg Gardens are absolutely breathtaking, there are plenty of restaurants (check out the beef bourgignon at the restaurant directly opposite), shops, bars and museums nearby and a handy metro station close by. If...no...WHEN we return to Paris, we will most definitely be staying at Hotel Jardin L'Odeon again. Our only complaint is that we didn't get to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: DKVogel0810
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Paris at the Odeon Metro station and didn't know where to go from here. The street the hotel was on wasn't on the map. I called the Hotel and the woman who answered said she would come get me. I said that was great but if she could give me landmarks I could find it. As you exit the metro you will see a Starbucks straight ahead. Go right toward the HSBC bank take that street north until you go past two streets (on the left is a lot of stairs into a plain area) the street will be on your right. I hope this makes sense. It is truly right around the corner from the Odeon theater. It is easy to find. Lots of great restaurants in the area. The hotel brought us breakfast to our room. It was very typical Parisian. The front desk staff were exceptional. They have baggage storage in the basement. It was a great little hotel. The room was small but bathroom was large. I would stay here again and recommend it to others. It is very close to the Latin Quarter. We walked to Notre Dame and surrounding areas. Very close to metro as well. We stayed in a room facing the courtyard so it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jordo280
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, well located, and reasonably priced. The room however was small for lack of a better word. So small in fact that there wasn't enough room for 2 suitcases to fit on the floor. Given the option, we would have happily paid for an upgrade, however the option wasn't available. Consider yourself forewarned. The hotel also offers no frills. The concierge service is a joke. Do not expect to get any good info on shopping, dinning or touring recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tarheel2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon in mid-September and found it to be charming, comfortable, very clean and highly convenient. Check in took only a minute and we were up to our room on the 6th floor (a prestige double). While we didn't have a terrace per se, but our large windows opened out to the courtyard and at night we enjoyed sitting near them and having a nightcap. It also was great to have the iMac computer and internet in the room; we used it daily for weather reports and restaurant reviews (thanks TripAdvisor!). Speaking of restaurants, La Cambuse across the street is great for a casual dinner; also, La Cremerie Polidor is quite an experience - very busy and filled with locals. Also, you must take a picnic to the Luxembourg Garden - so beautiful and relaxing. Back to the hotel... spacious, modern bathrooms, hair dryer and a safe to keep extra cash and documents - everything we needed and more. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet and convenient all in one.”
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. Clean. Had a problem with them wanting to park our touring cycles on the street when we had been assured there was a secure place but settled with a bit of assertiveness. They helped us make our tour bookings and very helpful. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: stafford01
Reviews.Content: Staff, location, room, cleanliness, breakfast, value for money and general atmosphere was excellent. This little 3 star hotel is a gem. Reception staff were so helpful in organising day trips, whether they be booked excursions or transport on the RER or Metro. All staff spoke excellent English and were so friendly and natural. Our room with a significant balcony was large for a Parisian hotel, but we did choose one of the two largest rooms on the top floor. Breakfast was simple (not cooked) but with ample choices. Our long flight home left in the evening and we were given a single room to use for the day at no extra cost. We really appreciated this. It's very central on the Left Bank within walking distance of many sights. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I was able to nab a bargain rate for a classic (standard) double room at the Jardin by booking many months in advance on their website. I emailed the hotel ahead of time to request a room facing the courtyard rather than the street. Almost immediately, I received a polite reply acknowledging my request, and indeed, when I arrived, I was assigned a charming room on the third floor (the equivalent of the fourth floor in the U.S.) facing the peaceful courtyard. The room was compact but very comfortable, pleasantly decorated and well maintained. The bathroom was even more compact than the bedroom, but sparkling clean and highly functional. Closet and drawer space in the bedroom were limited, but the room had much-appreciated amenities like a mini-fridge, a safe, and reliable wi-fi access. A previous reviewer complained about the beds being too firm for comfort, but I found the bed and pillows extremely comfortable and conducive to sound sleep. There was no street noise in my room; in fact, when I kept my window open, I woke up to the sound of birdsong and water flowing into the fountain in the terrace below. I did occasionally hear doors slamming and people talking in the hallway, but the noise never occurred frequently enough or late enough to disturb my peaceful cocoon. The reception staff was extremely courteous, helpful and welcoming, as were the breakfast-room and housekeeping staff. The lobby and terrace were small but charming spaces for relaxing and reading. I couldn’t have been happier with my 3-night stay at the Jardin, and only wish I could have stayed much longer at this welcoming, comfortable hotel in a terrific location that is central but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location - Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Loves-Paris
Reviews.Content: The proximity to l'Odeon, Jardins du Luxembourg, and all things Left Bank really cannot be beat. This is a nice choice for several days in the heart of Paris. The rooms are stylish, breakfast is completely sufficient, and staff is very friendly and helpful. Our first room was a two-floor Junior Suite with a view over the courtyard ~ was not as we expected (dark, small bathroom, steep stairs, lack of good view). So we requested something street-side and met with success with our Premier Deluxe: balcony with view over l'Odeon, comfortable beds, robes and slippers, roomy bath. TV with internet access was a nice plus - very convenient for email and reviewing museum schedules and mass transit plans.

Reviews.Title: “it was wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Viviane B
Reviews.Content: when I will come back to Paris we will stay in "Le jardin de l'odeon" The personal was really verry friendly and helpfull and we had a verry beautiful room with terras.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with Parisian charm!”
Reviews.Author: LizCincinnatiOH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during a 3 day stay in Paris. We enjoyed the friendly service in the hotel and the convenient proximity to prominent sites in Paris. We walked almost everywhere, and we always felt safe. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “such helpful staff Would recommend this hotel ,Great location in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: christine e
Reviews.Content: Bring a detailed map of paris as some of the tourist maps dont have all the streets marked and its easy to get confused.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Sue
Reviews.Content: Most definitely a great place to stay to soak up a bit more than just the usual touristy spots in Paris. The hotel is situated about 4 minutes walk to the gorgeous Jardin du Luxembourg (stunning gardens), 10 mins walk to Notre Dame, Le Pantheon, and more restaurants and coffee shops than you will ever be able to visit within a week or two. The area feels safe to wander at night, yet quiet and it only takes a couple of minutes to get away from the busy Boulevard St Michel to the hotel on foot. You're not more than a few minutes walk to a hop on hop off bus stop, and if you want to avoid all of that, there's a bunch of quiet little cafes and restaurants tucked around the surrounding streets. The hotel is about 1 minute walk from Odeon Theatre d' le Europe, so you may be able to catch a show, if not the courtyard outside the hotel has an outdoor cafe on it . The hotel itself is small, but friendly, clean, recently renovated and has character. There's a bar fridge with room for whatever you want to buy in the nearby supermarket, aircon, the bathroom was new, and if your French is a bit ropey (or non-existent) the staff speak English, and are very helpful. We paid about £100 a night for a twin double room in August, which was a pretty good price. The hallways outside the room and the lift are small, but then that's Europe for you.. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Emma31915
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July and we were very pleased with the hotel. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room itself was small which we were expecting but it really had everything we needed. The free wifi and apple mac came in very handy. Shower was excellent. The price we paid was reasonable for Paris and the location is very convenient, right beside the bustling Saint Germain and a short walk to a metro station. Hotel is within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Luxembourg Gardens... There was construction across the road but it didn't really affect our stay. We were disappointed we didn't have a balcony in our room (we booked a prestige room and paid more hoping we might have a balcony) but it didn't matter too much in the end because we didn't spend that much time in the room anyway. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, central”
Reviews.Author: Ferdiniere
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, very central position, quiet, modern. Reception was perfect, room not very large but reasonable and well equipped. Breakfast OK

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, well located, a small jewel in the 6th district”
Reviews.Author: alkuino
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel 4 years ago (room 55 on the 5th floor) when I could not stay in the Michelet Odeon which is within walking distance. It was a good choice. Its decor is Art Deco style (which I like) and very friendly staff. The rooms are comfortable, although small, but with modern bath and all very clean. We were in a room 02, ground floor overlooking the inner garden and has a small terrace, I guess in the spring and fall will be very nice. It is very close to the metro station of Luxembourg that communion both Charles de Gaulle airport and Orly (5-7 min walk). It is surrounded by restaurants and places to grab a good wine, all at 5 min: Gourmet - Le Comptoir, Les Papilles - 12 min, Polidor - excellent champagne / wine bar like The Cremerie extensive selection of wines, both 5 min. Saint Germain market to buy food, wine and cheese at 6 min, the restaurant mini-solo Regis Huitrerie oysters oysters and a seafood platter with good wine next to the market. For the pastry breakfast at Rue de Buci Paul, a former pastry in which a little $ 5 you have a well prepared hot drink (tea, coffee, chocolate) and an excellent croassant freshly made with butter and jam, also have tortillas, salads and other dishes. The hotel allows you to store your luggage if your flight leaves later than 12 am, Polidor - excellent champagne / wine bar like The Cremerie extensive selection of wines, both at 5 min. Saint Germain market to buy food, wine and cheese at 6 min, the restaurant mini-solo Regis Huitrerie oysters oysters and a seafood platter with good wine next to the market. For the pastry breakfast at Rue de Buci Paul, a former pastry in which a little $ 5 you have a well prepared hot drink (tea, coffee, chocolate) and an excellent croassant freshly made with butter and jam, also have tortillas, salads and other dishes. The hotel allows you to store your luggage if your flight leaves later than 12 am, when you chek out.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff and great location and I would return”
Reviews.Author: Finoula
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I like the group (I have stayed in the Grand Hommes previously) and this one had rooms with outside space plus it was also close to St. Germain (there was also a fairly good offer as it was August). I was somewhat upset when they informed me, just before I was due to stay, that there would be workmen in and that there would be no hot water between 9-6 each day. I still think this was unacceptable as I had booked and paid months earlier - however I was brought a bottle of Champagne to my room on arrival as an apology which was nice of them and I can honestly say that the lack of hot water didn't affect me, I just got up early and usually returned after 6pm anyway. Every single member of staff I dealt with was lovely - sweet and helpful and very friendly and their management should be rightly proud of them. I had breakfast on one day and it was fine - I just don't really 'do' breakfast, but it is good value at 12 euros as I paid 5.50 for just a coffee and you get coffee, juice, breads, croissant, cheese, yoghurt, cereal, ham and salami - and all in a very nice environment. Room was small - they always are in Paris - but had all the things you expect (and I had my terrace too) and it was spotless. The Odeon is steps away and just a bit further the Luxembourg Gardens - and the other way is St Germain and walking distance to Notre Damme etc. One negative for me is that it's noisy especially in the morning (the cleaners are loud from 8am) but most hotels seem to be just as bad in my experience. I was a woman on my own and felt very happy in the hotel - safe and welcome. Oh and the bed, pillows and bedding are very comfortable! I wanted to give 4 and a half but can't so - because of smiley, sweet staff - I give it 5.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, site and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ryan R
Reviews.Content: We loved our stays at Jardin de L'Odeon. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. The location just can't be beat, away from major street traffic, yet across the street from the Odeon Theatre and 5 minute walks to the Odeon Theatre, the Luxembourg Gardens, the Pantheon, etc. Very easy access to bus routes and the metro. The RER from the airport stops 3 minutes away and bus routes to anything are across the street. We traveled with a toddler and had a great suite with two rooms. She (and we) loved having a separate space for her as well as our own private balcony for take home dinners. We will gladly stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “summer rates.... not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: phil5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the beginning of August and booked a superior room at a very attractive price.We have been upgraded to the duplex room upon arrival, so it became a real bargain. Apart of this deal, we have been frequently staying in hotels of the area for years, and this one is one of the best (in its category). The staff here is not "on duty" but clearly at your service. Nice and larger than usal lobby, charming breakfast room on ground level. Location is very convenient and very very quiet (on the good side of Boulevard Saint Germain) not the overcrowded one. good to know : This hotel as a great variety of rooms so book on their website to get all the choices and rates displayed. Good restaurants nearby (stay on the same side of the Boulevard) preferred place "La petite Cour" rue Mabillon, short walk but ask for directions as it s quite hard to find (open daily for lunch and dinner).

Reviews.Title: “Happy to be back!”
Reviews.Author: PauleJanie
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this charming hotel before. We decided to chose it for a big family reunion: our 50th wedding anniversary. We were 12 including our children, spouses and grandchildren. We could not have chosen better: the hotel and staff were incredibly accomodating and helpful in every way. The location was marvelous and a joy to stroll through. I will come back to this hotel, with great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinejane
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon is very charming and in a great location. You can take the train from CDG, get off at Luxembourg Gardens and walk just a few minutes. The hotel is next to the Odeon Theatre. There are countless bistros and shops all around, a metro stop just a few minutes away and a nice walk to the major museums and sights eg Musee D'orsay, the Louvre. Notre Dame etc. The front desk staff are very efficient and helpful, the lobby has a Mac for guests 'use, coffee and cold drinks are available all day and there is a lovely small courtyard with tables for breakfast. My room faced the courtyard so was quiet and the hotel is very clean and nicely decorated in an art deco style.. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: parent
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in charming area, without any vista views but in a wonderful area (as is most of Paris). Other reviews have described this well,and your contentment depends on what you expect. For those who are concerned about small rooms, Yes ours was small—you can walk around the sides of the bed, but just with body width. Tiny bathroom and shower, but that seems par for the location. More importantly, everything was clean. Wireless was free and strong. We appreciated the room was equipped with a pc and good sized monitor. Air conditioning worked well and is adjustable. Faced out on to nondescript building across street, but could see Odeon. Luggage if you arrive before checking in, or depart after checkout- Yes, you can carry your luggage down to a small storage room; judging by the amount there, lots of guest do that. There are no bellmen- this is a small hotel. There is a small elevator, into which we were nonetheless able to squeeze our 3 rollers and two thin bodies, but we heard that some hotels lack elevators. Sound- street is quiet with little car traffic, but some construction that started late enough not to disturb us. We liked the red flowers at each window. Concierge- not really a concierge. The person at an entry table, retrieves keys, provides Paris maps, handles check-in, gives directions, etc., and someone emerges from a back area if more than two people are waiting. They will sell you vouchers, for example for the bateau tours or Follies Bergere tours and are quite pleasant, but if you ask which among the boats have the most entertaining tour, the two desk people we asked, who are locals not familiar with tourist sights, did not know information beyond what is in the tour advertisements, and did not recommend local cafes other than to give directions to the general area. Similar for various types of admission tickets for Versailles or purchasing Eurostar. You will be happier if you do your Trip Advisor research, or bring a guide book. Rather than get on the Metro at Odeon, we usually walked 8-10 minutes to the St Michel station, which includes multiple lines, including regional. Wanting to soak up the Paris atmosphere and rising late, we did not eat breakfast at the hotel (small room off lobby) so cannot comment on that. In the area, you pass multiple statues, and non-tourist storefronts. We found Les Editeurs, a café within two blocks that is frequented by locals and had good omelet’s and other food. The interior décor is bookshelves along the walls. A restaurant across the square always had a line. A nearby green crepe cart, recommended by the desk person, makes delicious desert crepes as you watch. There is also a café in front of the Odeon theatre, which is 200 steps from the hotel door. To snack at Jardin du Luxembourg or just to see the colorful view in the window, try Gerard Mulot (on Du Seine a few blocks away) which has the typical wonderful croissants, chocolate that makes a nice hostess gift, many tasty items (including some salads, all carry out) and a rude (at least to Americans) staff of the sort that I had seen in Paris years ago but not experienced recently, except at this patisserie. If you want to grab a quick baked item on the way to some sight (not the leisurely cafe experience where your vill is not delivered unless you ask) you will pass some, and there is a good one on a side street near St Michel metro. On the same block as Jardin de L'Odeon,if you find it too full, there were 2 similar looking hotels, both of which seemed fine. Our priorities were location with atmosphere, in walking distance of many sights, and clean rooms, rather than view of the river or sights, larger room, and extensive hotel services. Our goals were met in our 3-night stay, and we would be happy to stay at Jardin de L’Odeon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with the best staff!”
Reviews.Author: PaulGK
Reviews.Content: The staff is tremendous! Good value and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: rayondesoleil1976
Reviews.Content: I have literally only returned from a fantastic stay in Paris. Travelling by myself I chose my hotel very carefully. I was looking for a hotel that was well situated, comfortable and affordable for a solo traveller. (We usually have to pay double, don't we!) I came across this doing a google search for a hotel in the Saint Germain des Pres area and after cross referencing it with TripAdvisor i decided to book it. Booking ahead there was a very attractive reduction in the room rate. Not knowing the hotel I know this could have been a bit of a risk but it turned out very well for me. I was put into Room 58 which I found to be an excellent room. Hotel rooms in paris are not renowned for their spaciousness but I found this room very pleasant with every facility in it I could need - including an iMac which doubled as a TV and media centre - great fun and very useful in the evenings when I returned to the room. (Free wi-fi and intenet access on the iMac) The only thing that maybe took away from it was a few shelves would not have gone amiss for storing clothes/cosmetics etc but it was not a disaster! There was a closet with hangers that served their purpose. There was also a safe deposit box in the room. The hotel staff was professional, polite and friendly - even the morning I returned to the hotel three times in quick succession in order to retrieve/replace items I had forgotten about! They also spoke good English and were very patient with a hesitant speaker of French! The location of the hotel was excellent. near the Latin Quarter and Boulevard St Germain des Pres - so no end to things to do, places to visit or bars and cafes for meals in the evening. i also felt very safe here. The hotel was in a quiet street that was nearby everything - including the Odeon Metro stop and useful bus routes. The breakfast was good and wasn't that much more expensive than some of the breakfast deals in the area. There was a good selection of cold meats, cereals, yoghurts, cheese etc. There was even 'toast' available. I would not hesitate to recomment this to other travellers - especially single travellers.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a little Paris get away.”
Reviews.Author: vuvuzela
Reviews.Content: My sister and I wanted to go to Paris for a three day get away. I don't know paris really well, so when it came to deciding on an area to stay I was quite overwhelmed. This hotel was the ideal spot. It is tiny (as most hotels in Paris are!), but it was spotless and our room was perfect to dump our bags and hit the streets to look at all the sites and shop. If you are looking for luxury, this is not for you. But if you're looking for a central spot to sight see and wander it is super comfortable and neat. The area actually turned out really well. We caught the metro from Orly and wanted a couple of blocks to the hotel ( 5 mins walk). It seemed really close to all the popular tourist sites, but at the same time the hotel is in a quite street, so you don't end up feeling like you're in a tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, excellent overall”
Reviews.Author: Ochel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a double room on the 6th floor. Rooms are a bit larger than the Parisian norm, but still on the small side. Our room ('prestige double') was tastefully done and well furnished in a usable manner. The bathroom was excellent as well. Our room also had a PC used for entertainment purposes & surfing. Free wireless also a welcome addition. Staff was extremely helpful, polite and friendly (in a non-stuffy manner) - and recommended several good places to try out. The only negative point, a minor one at that, would be the somewhat slow single elevator. Though a 3 star hotel, I would rank it as most definitely better than most 4 star hotels - if lacking some of the facilities that those hotels offer. Highly recommended - we will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5 Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: katjop
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on tripadvisor recommendations and because it seemed like a great value for the location. I was concerned that the room would be too small as we had booked the least expensive, classic room but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room #11 (a small European size room) felt airy and open with a large bathroom. Absolutely LOVED opening the large double windows each morning to a view of the courtyard with beautiful window boxes full of hydrangeas. The bathroom also had same large double windows. Enjoyed listening to the soft water fountain below (which was turned off at night). Tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean! Would absolutely stay again and recommend to others. Note: We stayed at a 5-star hotel near Place Vendrome for 3 days prior and I actually liked Jardin de L'Odeon room better. The staff was welcoming and helpful and immediately replied to all our questions prior to arrival. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel although it looked like a great value. I did enjoy 7am coffee one morning in the courtyard while I waited for my husband to wake. The hotel location is wonderful and right near the beautiful Luxembourg Garden and an easy walk to many popular sights (several close bus/metro stops). Always easy to find your way back to the hotel as it is right next to the L'Odeon Theatre. Many fabulous restaurant selections within a few blocks. Loved Les Cafe des Editeurs! Can't wait to return to Jardin de L'Odeon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alta-Monza
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was in a great location, with friendly staff,clean and with a ok sized room. Only booked the standard room but this turned out to be fine and the bathroom was a good size to. I booked direct on the hotel website and didn't have to pay for WIFI but maybe different if you book through an operator. Some of the restaurants around the hotel are expensive but if you walk beyond the Pantheon to the Latin Quarter you'll find lots of restaurants there with menu's of the day much cheaper and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoN
Reviews.Content: Being in Paris, you must settle for a quiet little hotel. Its well worth the value: the hotel was nicely decorated in modern boutique style. Only downpoint is the breakfast, that could be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jwasikow
Reviews.Content: Very good location and a reasonable price. Room was very small, but had everything that we needed. A/C worked well and the hotel's wireless internet (no extra charge) worked well. Staff had excellent English and were very friendly - they helped us with all of our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mar155019
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 5 nights during the month of July. Great location for walking to all the major sights, though tucked out of the way to ensure a quiet rest. Front staff were extremely friendly. Very clean and beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary. Disagree with other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: RamblinJoe
Reviews.Content: Having done the usual homework, including the reviews on tripadvisor, and an active interest in art deco, I booked this hotel despite a higher price than others in the area. What a disappointment! While staff were efficient and gracious, and the hotel had an air of quiet comfort, the pictures do not tell an accurate story. The art deco was there but a few random elements, and in the room I stayed in, this was minor. So sadly, my conclusion was that it was ordinary & average, and a demerit for being comparatively expensive for what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Our own serviced apartment in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: t_jaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for around 3 nights, the staff were thoughtful enough to upgrade us on the first night when there was only 2 of us to the 3 person apartment that we had booked for the following 2 nights at not extra cost. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful especially the gentleman serving breakfast every morning. There was free internet as well which was very helpful! The beds were comfortable and the location was great! Just a minute away from the metro, cafes etc. A very short walk to Notre Dame and reasonably close to everything else too! We walked to the louvre in 15 minutes and beat all the lines too which was great. The area itself was not too expensive as it wasn't very touristy and was safe as far as I experienced. The only major downfall would be the construction of the building opposite. Had a great time and would definitely return next time! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cashkate
Reviews.Content: My 3rd trip to Paris. Chose this hotel as it was recommended as convenient for an older woman travelling alone to attend the tennis. I consider this is a boutique hotel. Great location, very close to Sorbonne, Luxembourg Gardens and public transport. My rooms (yes I stayed there twice) were small but hey this is Paris and rooms in lovely old buildings are small. Lovely decor and very clean, view over courtyard, pleasant breakfast room and friendly welcoming staff. After my Paris trip I met my daughter in London (her 1st visit to Europe) and we went to Paris for a night, again a warm welcome and a lovely clean room. This hotel is not perfect, somewhat difficult to find..the map could be clearer, breakfast on the slightly expensive side, Tv not the latest but I would really recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in a delightful and safe area in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: DeCastroSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Near metro station, quiet place and near the Luxembourg garden. Staff got a special attention to help in the city. Recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great but for the construction noise...”
Reviews.Author: Weekend-holidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (Wed - Fri incl.), at €200/ night on average, in a Prestige/Double. We stayed for one night back in 2008, so knew what to expect. I measured the room (!) to be 12' x 14' (15 m2) including the bathroom - but in fact, this was actually more than adequate! The bathroom was tiny - but very well designed and looked great, although the bath is very tall to step in to and I'm 6' (1.8m) tall!. We had no issue with noise from other rooms and in fact concluded that the rooms were well sound-proofed. Based on reviews here, we decided to go outside the hotel each morning for a coffee & croissant (<€8 for us both) and then bought in yogurts, fruit & fresh juice in a shop a few mins from the hotel. We specifically asked for a room facing on to the street - to enjoy a sideways view of Theatre de l'Odeon. This also meant the room was North-facing, therefore cold in winter, but cool in Summer. This was great, but unfortunately marred by noise from renovations to a building on the other side of the street. One morning it was quiet enough, but on other mornings, it really gave me a headache and I couldn't wait to leave the room. Other minor points - the hotel's toiletries were not of especially good quality and neither were they provided in much quantity; a new staff member was very ill-informed about Velib bike hire and restaurants nearby. Otherwise very friendly and competent. OTHER TIPS - use the Velib bikes! If you are any way fit, you will have such fun and see Paris in a totally connected way! If you fancy an Italian meal, try the Marco Polo (walk downhill from hotel towards Blvd. St. Germain) - the best we've had in any country. But if that's booked up, then don't bother with the other Italian nearby (Il Suppli) - it's very ordinary and service is poor, for the same price as Marco Polo. Lastly, Cafe au Lait (white coffee) costs €4.50 everywhere we went - but a black coffee was €2.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and informative staff”
Reviews.Author: Beenbefore
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the receptionist was very friendly and when we asked about good local restaurants she was happy to give us details of a few based on our budget. The hotel is in a great location and we walked to most of the places we wanted to go to. I would advise taking your own hairdryer as the one in the bathroom wasn't up to much and the position of plug sockets made it difficult to get my hair straighteners to reach a mirror. Building over the road is being renovated but we didn't hear any noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but an average 3* hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KevinCrew
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the positive reviews. This is an average 3* hotel. On the positive side, the rooms are tastefully decorated. On the negative side, they are small, smelly and poorly insulated from noise in the neighbouring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: AlDantravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 1st to 8th June and we were not disappointed with anything at all. It is a superb hotel in the perfect area to explore central Paris and the left bank. It is on a quiet street away from traffic but is a 10 minutes walk, through narrow streets with real Paris shops, to Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay etc. We loved this walk because we found loads of bakeries, bars and market stalls. Check out Rue du seine and the streets of it. The hotel is very friendly, spotless and chic. Nothing is too much for the English speaking staff. They were very patient when we tried out our rusty French. We splashed out and stayed in one of the rooms at the top of this amazing hotel that had a roof terrace. Room 64. Comfy bed, excellent shower over bath and quite a lot of room. From our terrace we could see the cafe outside the theatre munching on lovely picnic stuff we found on our walks back from the centre and washing it down with wine from supermarkets that sells for less than 5 euro and would sell in the uk for atl least twice that. we cannot fault this hotel at all. It is a stone's throw from Jardin du Luxembourg which is so nice to walk in and people watch. The excellent restaurants Les Papilles, Les Editeurs and Pere Louis and a short walk that you HAVE to check out. Lastly, the TV systems in the rooms are excellent. The TV has built in internet, tourist info and weather. All really quick.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a little more...”
Reviews.Author: kittykat1992
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of previous reviews and it was the only one available for the weekend we were in Paris. We got what we paid for, for Paris standards that is. We had three rooms 26,27 & 21. The bathrooms were a bit run down for our taste; "partially" renovated I would say. There are new towel racks, shower/bath doors and fixtures, however these new additions could not mask the the old dusty radiators, cracked wall and floor tiles. The staff were friendly, especially the young gentleman "in training" who served us in the breakfast room. Overall, it was "just a place to lay our heads" after a long day of sightseeing. Parking garage very close by, paid 32 euros/day. We would not recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JMDaly
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Paris as part of a birthday trip for my mom. There were 5 in our group so we booked 3 rooms at the Jardin de L'Odeon. Rooms 12 and 36 had large balconies facing the courtyard and it was great after being out sightseeing all day to sit on the balcony and have a glass of wine before dinner. The location is excellent - many shops, cafes, etc in the area and also the Jardin du Luxembourg. A couple notes - there is a renovation going on of the building across the street so there is construction noise during the day. As we were out sightseeing this did not affect us. We did eat breakfast at the hotel (€12, not included in the room rate), and it really was not worth €12 -- the other mornings we found better deals outside the hotel. All in all it was a great hotel, especially having the rooms with balconies, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly service, small room”
Reviews.Author: keviline
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at Le Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon in May 2011. The hotel is charming in exactly the location I was hoping for. The staff were always very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was quite good, and the terrace in which breakfast is served was very pleasant. The room (Prestige double) was comfortable but a little small. I would happily stay there again when traveling alone in Paris again, though two people in that room would be quite a challenge. Overall, good value for a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: dadoo
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, clean, terrific staff. Jeremy, at check-in, was exceptionally helpful. Very nice and reasonably priced breakfast. There is a patio that is nicely isolated and terrific for relaxing with a glass of wine at the end of the day. Short walk to Luxembourg Gardens, nice neighborhood. Our room did not face the street and was very quiet...this is a quiet street anyway. The TV was an ancient Philips model, large CRT. Our friends had a flat panel, so I assume they are replacing them. Rooms are stylish, though, of course, small, as all rooms are in Paris. We had a mini fridge in our room, but our friends did not, though they had a more expensive room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with friendly staff in great area”
Reviews.Author: vikingAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 3 years ago and liked it so much that we booked for 8 days again this year, 2011. This time we had a room a bit bigger than last time. The hotel and rooms are very stylish although tends to be on the smallish side like most other boutique hotels. Some rooms have tiny terraces (room 1 and 2 on the ground floor), one room on 1st floor has a large terrace and other rooms too have varying size balconies or terraces. Most rooms have french balcony doors and are facing either street or courtyard. The beds have sheets/blankets which are not as comfortable as quilts which we had at hotels we stayed at in regional France. We really like this hotel, the staff are very friendly, they will help you with any request you have and book taxies, tours etc. for you. We also like the breakfast which you can also have in the courtyard weather permitted. The hotel is in a great area just with lost of great shops and restaurants and close to Luxembourg garden. There is a handy laundrette around the corner. There is free wi-fi and also a computer for use in the lobby if you haven't brought your own. We will stay here again if we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: kkistner7
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Paris and stayed at Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon. This was such a wonderful hotel in a great location. It is a little bit removed from the main part of the city but that was the best part. This was a cute neighborhood and was a nice place to come back to after a long day of sight seeing. The hotel staff could not have been better. They were so kind and accomodating. They booked a trip for us to Giverny for the day and helped us with Taxi's whenever we needed them. I was a bit nervous choosing a hotel online and not knowing what the hotel would be like. I did read other reviews on Trip Advisor which helped me so hopefully this will help someone else. The rooms are smaller but very clean and nice. My only complaint was that there was some construction going on next door in the morning but it was not bad and there is nothing the hotel could have done about this. Overall we were very pleased with the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: fdsj
Reviews.Content: An ideal place to stay if you are in Paris for a few days sight-seeing and want a comfortable base on the left bank. Reception and breakfast staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is good value. Rooms are not huge but ours was well equipped, including internet TV, clean and comfortable. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. A room at the back will be quiet and give you a good sleep; book via the hotels website to get one of their special deals.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Corilow
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an excellent hotel in Paris, in a wonderful location, with superb service, you must stay at Jardin de l'Odeon. I have traveled to Paris many, many times and this is by far the best hotel I have encountered. It is located on the rue Casimir Delavigne in St. Germain, a stones throw from the Odeon Theater. My friend and I were lucky enough to stay in room 64 on the 6th floor with a terrace overlooking the theater. Equipped with a table and chairs, it made a perfect setting for wine and cheese before setting out to dinner in the evening and for breakfast in the morning, which the staff will happily deliver to your room. The room we stayed in was perfect for two people and was very chic! The bed was extremely comfortable, as well. The bathroom is on the small side, but as one who travels to Paris often, it does not bother me in the least. This is to be expected from an older building. The cleaning staff is to be highly commended, as the room and bathrrom was always spic and span. As for the front desk staff, Jenny, Ines, Quentin and Mosbah, they were outstanding Each one of them is extremely helpful and nice and willing help with any needs you may have.
