I cannot praise them enough for making our stay the best I have had in Paris. As a last note, the neighborhood is excellent. The street is quiet and there are many nearby places to dine and shop. Went to Le Comptoir one night, which was memorable for sure. Also dined at a nearby spot, La Ferrandaise, recommended by Jenny. The food was outstanding and the atmosphere quaint! Highly recommend that one. Of course, if you really want to splurge...head for L'Arpege. Where do I begin!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: imogen789
Reviews.Content: My five-year old daughter and I had a very happy stay. The staff was so friendly. I loved the wi-fi, which worked perfectly. We weren't expecting a large room, so the size seemed perfectly ample for our needs. The only thing I wish were improved is that the hotel room doors slammed when people left in the morning, which interrupted our sleep. We were on jet lag so were sleeping late. I should think it wouldn't be too difficult to change the mechanism on the doors to close more quietly.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: KyleWalton
Reviews.Content: Jardin de L'Odeon is a charming hotel with a helpful and friendly staff who made our ten-day stay a delight. The location was perfect for us, situated on a quiet little street between beautiful Luxembourg Gardens and the happening scene just beyond Saint-Germain. Our room had a comfortable bed, closet space, and a nice bath with great water pressure. We were able to tuck our bags under a table and the desk, but there's a luggage room in the cellar if needed (along with a handy iron and ironing board). We found the decor pleasing throughout. We'd seen a lot of foofy Laura Ashley on other hotels' websites and this was anything but. My partner and I enjoyed talking with the staff, who readily switched to English when our French failed us. The breakfast team was cheerful and attentive. We looked forward to our morning café et de lait chaud, croissants, granola, yogurt, and more. The intimate breakfast area overlooks a perfectly appointed little courtyard and we often lingered there reading our guidebooks and planning our day. The vibe was just what we wanted. I spent several hours one day just relaxing in the cozy lobby, reading and people-watching. We felt really fortunate to have found such a delightful hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: californian10
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming, considerate staff, clean and comfortable. Expensive, consistent with Paris generally. Breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Kokomonkey
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with excellent staff, cosy rooms and a fantastic location only a few seconds away from Odeon theatre. The area has wonderful restaurants, shops and bars and a cosmoplitan feel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel website is extremely mis-leading”
Reviews.Author: Irishguy27
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon with my wife for 4 nights. Whilst the hotel is in a nice location we were extremely disappointed with the rooms given how they look on the hotel's website. From looking at the website we thought we were booking a stylish, chic hotel whereas in reality it is a small hotel with tiny rooms. We originally booked a standard room but when we went into it we literally didnt have space to put our suitcases anywhere so we went straight down and coughed up more cash to upgrade to a suite (ie. two tiny rooms connected). We stayed there for 2 nights before moving to a Prestige room (ie a tiny room with a balcony off it). The rooms are very ordinary and not chic or stylish. They are clean but that's about it. For example, in a suite which costs hundreds of euro per night, you don't even get tea/coffee-making facilities! Also the bathrooms are tiny and come with tea-towels instead of bath towels! Also the website mentions having Mac computers in some of the rooms but we didn't see any at all. For the money you pay, you could get a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: tgtoronto
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another wonderful holiday in Paris at the Jardin. Rather that repeat the same kudos found elsewhere on this site, let me add that the thing that made this visit so special was the service from the capable and friendly staff, especially Inez. They helped us score reservations at very hard-to-get restaurants, took care of our every needs and answered all our questions with grace and humour. Very professional people. The hotel is charming, spotless and gives you le vrai left bank experience, situated in the midst of all the best sites and shops, a short walk to the metro and the Seine. Great area for wandering, day or night. Rates change so watch the variable ones for a few weeks before you book/go....the further in advance, the better. But we actually improved on a pretty good rate a few weeks after we booked. Great value. Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Astareth
Reviews.Content: A really wonderful botique hotel in the best location near lots of food, shopping and night life but on a street a bit set back so quite enough for being in the middle of a big city. Great that it was two short blocks back from the Luxenbourgh Gardens and very convient to the metro. Staff was what made the difference. Always helpful with a smile and honest concern that you are enjoying your stay and did their best to give info or make reservations. Rooms are clean with nice decor. Standard smallish size but hey this is Paris and who's staying in the room! The best ever water pressure and hot water I have ever seen and I travel alot! Only real downside was the bed matresses were old and out of shape and needed to be changed. It was hard on my back most all nights. But the rest was great! I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: PeterLondonW9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful find at extremely short notice for an overnight stay in Paris. Arriving quite late at Charles de Gaulle airport meant its location close to Luxembourg RER station made for a rapid arrival. The receptionist was extremely polite, helpful and efficient as were all staff I experienced during my stay. The hotel is tucked away in a relatively quiet street but the restaurants and bars of the Place de L'Odeon are only a few minutes away. My room was a very acceptable size by Parisian standards and very clean. My only complaint was that I felt the quality of bed and bath linen were not as good as the lobby area and layout had led me to expect. Given the overall value for money and experience however this would certainly not stop me from coming back or recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathBr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location on a quiet street close to Odeon metro. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Rooms small but very well designed. Very comfortable bed. Good shower. Clean and well maintained, and charmingly decorated. Friendly and efficient service too. We'll be back on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “cozy hotel on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: lorneinvan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and very well located. We had a basic room which was small but fully equipped with a safe, a bar fridge, desk, night tables and tv. The bed was comfortable and the room and bathroom were spotless. The decor was red and stripes. We did not sleep well because the air conditioning system in the hotel was not turned on yet and that left us with the choice of opening the window to outside noise or trying to sleep in a stifling room. Staff indicated that April weather in Paris is erratic and that they do not turn on the AC in May because that requires de activating the heating system. However, the heat is on hot water radiators and the ac was separate also the ac was working in the lobby, Other than that issue we had a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super value and charming staff in a pleasant part of Left Bank Paris”
Reviews.Author: Christopher_Laws
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its situation in the 6th, close to Odeon, Luxembourg Gardens and Boulevard Saint-Germain. Our receptionist was charming and helpful, the room fairly small but entirely adequate (we could have upgraded to a superior room for 20€, but chose to spend the money in a restaurant). The room overlooked the street, but was quiet. Beds very comfortable, the bathroom very well equipped, with bath and shower and loads of hot water morning and evening. The free wifi worked well with no fiddling with codes. All in all an ideal good value for money hotel that we shall be happy to return to.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Location Which Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: NorCalBusTrav
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the hotel as part of a business trip. While it shared the small rooms common for Parisian 3-stars, it surprised me with great water pressure and a towel warmer in the efficient en suite bathroom. The location is on a charming small street a few steps from the Luxembourg Gardens. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke perfect English (and were patient while I tried out my rudimentary French on them). The only knock is that the breakfast selection was extremely limited and (surprisingly) for Paris, not the best bread products. Would recommend against eating breakfast here as a result (tho the waitstaff was very nice). Next time I will spend the extra money and get one of the larger rooms which have small patios in the back or the larger multi-level room with a view over the rooftops.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff excellent, bedding is a tad lacking”
Reviews.Author: chingtan02c
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is brilliant, about a 10-15 min walk from the M4 station, cafe outside of the Odeon Theatre is also charming. Close walk to the Seine, Gardin of Luxembourg, many sights. Hotel staff were welcoming and seemed very helpful, although we really didn't ask too many questions. We had a standard room; Basic shower gel and shampoo and soap provided, nothing fancy. I found the bedding a bit hard (and I am used to hard mattresses) but I am also 34 weeks pregnant. Free internet, although the connection is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: DKL-7
Reviews.Content: We did tons of research for our visit to Paris and picked the Jardin de L'Odeon based on it's location, price and the trip advisor reviews. We were pleased with our choice: it sits on a quiet street in the St Germain area so lots of cafes, bars, restaurants and shops are within a few minutes walk. It is 5-10 minutes from the metro and the 38 bus route runs closeby from le Gare de Nord. The hotel room was charming and clean and surprisingly quiet. We didn't have the breakfast but made use of the free wifi. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: kcgirl30
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Paris, France was wonderful. We had a great little botique hotel, that was perfect for our trip and the price was unbeatable. In a great location, the rooms are a little small, but very efficient and have everything you need. We ended up staying a third night and got upgraded to a nice room with a balcony...worth a little extra dollars for a little more room. We will definitely be back to this hotel. For the price, it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “We've found our perfect Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Beth02129
Reviews.Content: We just spent a lovely weekend at the Jardin de L'Odeon & have been visiting Paris for over ten years - mostly staying in the Latin Quarter. This gem of a hotel is by far our favorite & we are already planning a return. Fantastic location, impeccable service, birdsong and peaceful ambience with all amenities nearby. Be sure to take time for the Luxembourg Gardens too - any time of year or weather. Thank you - Room 18

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful and relaxing stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Nankasatin
Reviews.Content: The Jardin de L'Odeon is a perfect little spot for a Paris getaway. Located near everything, including some great cafes, bakeries, and shops, as well as the Metro and RER, the hotel was charming and the staff was very welcoming and spoke flawless English. We had signed up for the low internet rate, but were upgraded to a superior room (room 12) with our own large, private terrace. With beautiful weather the entire time we were there, this was an added bonus. Yes the room was on the small side, but living in NYC it didn't seem that different from the rooms (and apartments) here, so for us it was a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Karolsus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin de l'Odeon which is in a great position for getting around being close the Odeon Metro station, some good restaurants and bars and a short walk to the River Seine, Notre Dame, Louvre, Rue Rivoli area. I recommend this hotel, its our second visit , its very nice and in a great location. We really enjoyed our Paris break.

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a sight-seeing trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: stuaryb0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Wednesday to Saturday (march '11) in this well positioned small hotel. We wanted somewhere quite cheap but cheerful nevertheless. I can back up the points you will no doubt read in other reviews. Small clean hotel in a quiet gem of a side street just minutes away from Many bars, restaurants shops etc. Just afew minutes walk from the Notre dame cathedral and the Rail station at St. Michel (Where you will get off the airport train) Our room (cheapest standard room) very small but clean with a good safe in the wardrobe. Ensuite bathroom with good HOT shower in enclosure. Free WIFI ( a bit slow but ok for browsing) no need for codes or access permission just connect Breakfast - plenty of breads, jams as well as some ham, cheese yoghurts and a boiled egg if you fancy. Refills of proper pure orange juice and coffee are offered which is great. As for the 2 waitresses that served us - I challenge you to find more polite or pleasant anywhere - they were great The 24 hr reception was great - throw in your key for no fuss anytime you head out. We met 3 or so different staff on the reception desk. All were very helpful, and polite at all times. All desk staff spoke great English and didnt struggle at all with our N.Irish accents More like the kind of service you would expect in a 4 or 5* I hope Ive missed nothing out - booked this hotel through the hotels website and went for the daily rate which changes everyday, seemed to offer the cheapest deal and didnt have to pay whole charge upfront Paris 1st timer tip ... Book a multiday pass on the river bus, its cheap and gives you unlimited trips up and down the route all day. The boat picks up near most of the big attractions every 25 mins all day. We didnt bother with the subway and just took the boat at a nice slow pace to see the sights Have fun ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff and great breakfast to start each day”
Reviews.Author: John-Nesbitt
Reviews.Content: I checked out quite a few hotels in the Latin Quarter and choose Jardin de L'Odeon, because it had a all-round good feel from other reviews. We were really please with the hotel. Staff were helpful and spoke English. It is a great base for a week in Paris. It was March and quite cold, so we did not use the room's balcony (on level 3), which was bigger than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, minutes to what we needed”
Reviews.Author: travelmeisteren
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the hotel in room 65 on the top floor with a large terrace overlooking the Odeon Theater. The room was a prestige deluxe class (I think that was the category). We booked through a different site with zero problems. We paid around €191 per night not including breakfast. The room was large with a sitting area w/ chairs and small table, a desk w/ chair, nice comfortable bed, a good-sized closet, and a nice bathroom (the toilet was separate from the shower and sink). My only complaint w/ the room was the hand-held shower did NOT have an attachment on the wall to hang the shower head. I was able to "McGuyver" the shower head to stay up on its own, but for a nice *** hotel, I did expect better. Other than that, only rave reviews of the hotel, staff, and room. The terrace was large with a table and 2 chairs. We managed to have a few drinks outside in the afternoons (we lucked out with cool but not cold weather) and breakfast the morning we checked out. There is a luggage room in the basement where we stored our bags both in and outbound. Breakfast was okay (we only had breakfast there once) for €12 per person but not great. I would recommend against breakfast at the hotel; but for convenience it is okay. Like anywhere in Paris, parking is difficult. I did manage to find one of the many Vinci parking garages and paid only €55 for three nights total, which for Paris is cheap! The Odeon metro stop is a two block from the hotel. Shops, restaurants, pubs, taverns, and bakeries are plentiful around the hotel. I would most definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice, central, well equipped: good value for money”
Reviews.Author: EnzoRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for both business and leisure. RER and Metro are close and so are restaurants, bistrots and bars. Located in a quiet street, it provides a decent, free wi-fi connection in every room, not just in the lobby. The only points that could be improved are the room temperature (quite hot) and the internal noise-proofing. Still, compared to the average of *** hotels in this part of Paris, this is so far the best value for money that I found in more than 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AMSmith411
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and certainly appreciate the improvements they have made since our last visit. We stayed in a prestige room and it was beautifully decorated with a modern, spotlessly clean bathroom, The only real negative about the room was that the bed was very low and not hugely comfortable. The mac was a welcome addition to the room as it meant we didn't have to lug our laptop around. The wi-fi quality was a bit hit and miss but was certainly enough for us to do what we needed to do. The main selling point for this hotel is the location. From here you can pretty much walk anywhere in Paris. It is close to lots of amazing bars and restaurants and both Metro and RER stations. I don't think I would stay anywhere else in Paris and am already trying to figure out when I can return.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing Paris”
Reviews.Author: fabio042
Reviews.Content: It was not my first time in paris or in the jardin de l'odeon hotel. The hotel is very cosy, quiet, soft elegant. It is a perfect location if you want enjoy Paris in a relaxing way. Shopping in the Saint Sulpice atelier, walking down Saint Germain, visiting luxemburg exhibitions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in quite street near hotspots St-Germain”
Reviews.Author: RogerfromHolland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on the web. It was a god choice. The hotel is in a quite street, but within 100m of Odeon metro station and St-Germain cafes and restaurants. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Smal, as to be expected in down-town Paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: wohlrabj
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at Jardin de L'Odeon. The hotel is situated in a perfect location...close to metro & RER lines (very easy access from airport). Within walking distance to Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, & many areas with cafes, shops. The reception area is staffed 24hrs/day & all were helpful with needed advice. An umbrella was provided for a few rainy days. Rooms were clean with modern decor. All contained in room safes & hairdryers. Free wifi available & there was a MAC in the lobby (no printer for boarding passes though). Rooms small by American standards but still comfortable. Our room faced the street which was generally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a not-so-busy block!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireSD07
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel. Last year, I went with my husband and 1.5 year old son - we had the bigger room (#64) which accomdated the playpen/cot the hotel provided us with enough leg room to walk around. This time, I went with my mother - the room was smaller but roomier than most European 3-star (even 4-star) hotels. Room decor was lovely, bathroom had big porcelin bathtub and a mac computer for free internet access. I really enjoy this hotel and location - easy metro access to Odean metro and a Taxi stand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: raverusa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon is in a perfect location if you want to explore Saint Michel and Saint Germain areas of Paris. It is very close to metro stops, and yet is a little off the beaten path, so there is a feeling of "returning" at night to a quiet oasis. The hotel itself is great - exquisitely designed rooms with perfect Parisian furnishings. The staff speak excellent English and are very helpful with suggestions on stores, sights, restaurants etc. While the rooms are small by American standards, they are appropriate for Paris and have an authentic boutique feel that makes them great to stay in for a romantic weekend. The bed was so comfortable as well. Can't say enough great things about the hotel and would definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, amenities and service that tell more than the stars do!”
Reviews.Author: DOGG44
Reviews.Content: If you are in Paris to attend to some business matters, you do not have to forego enjoyment! Serene surroundings with amenities in the middle of the cultural past can only enhance the corporate accomplishments!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ranict
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on other reviews on TA and we're so glad we did. We booked via the hotel website which offered a good deal. This hotel was brilliant! Upon arrival the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The lift was little so we did have to make a couple of trips with our two huge suitcases however, it was a very short ride. Our room was small which is expected in central Paris. The decor was very chic/parisian and cosy. The bathroom was new and stylish. Minutes away from Luxembourg Gardens, St Germain blvd and a short walk to the Louvre and other attractions. Location allowed us to walk everywhere with the stroller which was convenient and enjoyable as there was always something to see, do, eat or buy. St Germain is amazing! We would definitely return to this hotel on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: reverential
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week during the holidays. We had booked two double rooms, but got one double and one superior double, which was nice. We got a great rate through their last minute rates, available if you book on the website. Both rooms were clean and well maintained. The regular double was certainly small by American standards, but didn't feel cramped. On the other hand, we didn't have lots of stuff and were generally neat guests. Both bathrooms had tubs, and though small, were not tiny. On the last night we had to switch one of the rooms, and were given a double with access to the terrace (Rm 12). The terrace would be really nice in warm weather. They allowed us to reduce the number of nights of stay without penalty after our flight was postponed due to the snowstorms in Europe. (But later we ended up extending our stay anyway.) Pros: very central location on a quiet street close to St Germain des Pres, Latin Quarter, Metro station, Luxembourg Gardens, with cafes (ex. Le Danton) and a Starbucks in close walking distance; pleasant staff, and they could communicate in English; comfortable beds; elevator could fit 4. Cons: wireless internet connection was unreliable; maid would forget to replace stuff sometimes; rooms got a bit hot and we had to open windows to cool them; shower water sprayed out due to lack of proper shower curtain/screen; no English channels on TV. Overall the cons were relatively minor, we had a pleasant experience, and would definitely consider staying here again on a return trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LionHongKong
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location, we got a special deal and feel the price was fair. The room was small and there was no room to put the suitcase on the floor. Bathroom was good and for the most part the room was tastefully decorated - although we had some curtains that seemed somewhat out of place. The room was too hot and we had trouble trying to get the heating turned down, so we resorted to opening the windows - there's a courtyard that would no doubt be lovely in summer. The breakfast was good, nothing special though but as it was included we had no complaints. The breakfast area isn't big enough though and on each day we were there we saw guests queuing for tables. The breakfast staff were lovely. The reception staff were also fairly helpful. Would stay here again but would also look elsewhere for a better deal first.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem - wonderful staff, great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Oxford_UK
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris a lot for work and this is my favourite hotel. The location is fantastic - close to the Luxembourg Gardens, major metro lines and RER B stations, and in the midst of the atmospheric St Germain area. Visiting here is like coming to home in Paris. The staff are the best and most down to earth that I have come across in Paris and they are always helpful and patient - the wonderful Penelope deserves a special mention - and again help a business trip to be more like coming home or staying with friends. It is true that the rooms are quite small but this IS Paris and they are very well proportioned. The real innovation is the Apple entertainment hub which makes it very easy to access entertainment as well as internet. I have never had any problems with accessing the internet or emails at all. Overall, this is a great place to stay and if I had my way would not stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerDC52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in January 2011. Overall, the hotel was pleasant and met our expectations for the room rate that we paid. Here's a quick summary: The Good: - Great location: Many good restaurants and shops within walking distance. The Odeon metro stop and Luxembourg RER (direct link to Charles de Gaulle) are close by. The Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and Notre Dame Cathedral are all within a leisurely 15 minute walk. - Friendly staff: For the non-French speakers, all were fluent in English. - Cleanliness: Impeccably clean rooms and bathrooms. The Bad: - Rooms were tiny, though this is fairly typical of Paris. - The bed was getting old. It's time to update the mattresses. Overall, a pleasant stay and given a good rate I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris. Great location, great staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seatown44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family. We had 5 rooms. We were treated like family and felt comfortable from the start. Close to everything in Paris. Would not stay anywhere else. Sylvia and Penelope went out of their way to make us feel at home and make my wedding so very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best place in Paris to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JMPutter
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris to get married was absolutely wonderful thanks to the staff at Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon. Ten of our family members stayed there for 11 great days. They found us a place to have the ceremony, made us reservations for dinner every night, gave us directions for sightseeing every day and spoke perfect English. Sylvia and Penelope were extremely helpful with everything. They even upgraded us to a suite for free for 5 days after our wedding. The location couldn't have been better - we walked to everything - and it was especially central to many restaurants and shops. The rooms are cozy and very nice, and our balcony overlooked a quite courtyard. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I loved everything about this hotel. The staff were lovely as was my room and the location perfect for my visit.”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaW02
Reviews.Content: I loved the view from my room..the staff always so accomodating..the bed was comfy, the location just around corner from Odeon metro and bus stops was excellent. Several of my favorite restuarants were just a block away.....what could be better. I spent a snowy week in Paris and here is was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SoonergalinTexas
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best hotel experience I've had in Paris. I have stayed in numerous hotels throughout the city, most often staying in or very near the 6e arrondissement. There are many beautiful boutique hotels in this district, but none offer the exquisite service from a most pleasant and accomodating staff. There was not a trace of dust or any sign anyone had stayed in my room prior to my arrival. The bathroom was pristine, bed very comfortable, comfy temperature, and charming view with a flower window box planted with geraniums. The rooms are small, but this is just a part of staying in a nicely located boutique hotel and does not take a way from the experience and comfort at all. The location was perfect, being just steps from the Jardin de Luxembourg, a Starbucks (for die-hard Americans on the search for their coffee!), great shjopping just around the corner, and very nice restaurants and bistros all conveniently located. The hotel itself is situated on a small street off the grande boulevard St. Germaine des Pres, so is very quiet, while still offering the stated conveniences. I will definitely stay here on future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a deal on price!”
Reviews.Author: Griffies
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location. Room small but adequate for short stay. Still room for our travel cot for our six month old baby. Reasonable price if you get a seasonal deal otherwise expensive. Reception staff friendly although provided kettle and cups without teabags or coffee on two mornings! Didn't bother with breakfast, can eat cheaper nearby in cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: glhnyc
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. Very helpful staff. Great location for exploring central Paris. Rooms were small, but nicely appointed. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with helpful staff members”
Reviews.Author: MaryT14
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Jardin de L'Odeon. The location is excellent with the beautiful gardens right nearby and in the middle of the always exciting Left Bank activities. The staff members on the front desk were helpful on many occasions. We would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable yet refined gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Evbrallier
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights in Paris and came across this hotel on tripadvisor. The reviews were stellar and we liked the location. Our stay here was extremely comfortable. The rooms are small, but to be expected in Paris. We definitely were able to relax and wind down from long days of sight-seeing here. I loved the decor and the view from our 5th floor balcony was so picturesque. But I think our highest praise is the location. We were within walking distance to both metro and RER stops that helped us get all around Paris. The concierge was also helpful in recommending local eateries nearby. Their prices are usually on the higher end, but we saved money by getting seasonal rates. Will definitely stay here again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KarenMillthorpe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this delightful hotel over the New Year period for the past 2 years and have just rebooked again for the forthcoming New Year. It is a small yet welcoming and pristine hotel. We have visited Paris many times and this is the only hotel we have been drawn back to. Highly recommended. For service , position and cleanliness you won't find a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly and close to everything! Location - tres bon!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeFrappe
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel and would definitely stay here again! My husband & I recently stayed here with my parents for a Paris vacation. We booked two rooms (junior suite and prestige). Both rooms were spacious, modern, appeared to have been recently renovated, had balconies and were very comfortable. Our room had a very large rooftop deck, which was wonderful. Our room also had a free Internet (via Apple TV) so it was really helpful having internet access - and a big time-saver, too. (It was very easy to operate as well). Breakfast was simple, but very good. The STAFF were all super-friendly. In particular, Penelope, Sasha and Stephanie were all lovely and incredibly helpful. (My parents don't speak French at all, and the staff really went out of their way to answer their questions, book day-trips for them, and give neighborhood advice, etc...) Speaking of the neighborhood, it's fantastic. The best part is that when you are finished sight-seeing for the day, you have many, many great restaurants just steps outside the door for dinner. We had a delicious dinner each night. (The restaurants were on quiet side streets and not "touristy," but they were "tourist-friendly.") This hotel provided us with an exceptional experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: RedCoquelicot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and I'd like to share my opinion about it. Strong points: - beautiful location: two steps away from Jardin du Luxembourg, in the middle of a cosmopolitan area, 200m away from the metro station Odeon - the room I stayed in was pretty nicely decorated and the bathroom was huge for Paris; the bathtub was a plus. The towels and sheets were changed every day and the room is spotless - everybody in the hotel speaks English and they are eager to help you Weaknesses: - the room is really small (10sqm) but, if you're not claustrophobic, after a long and warm bath you won't notice it anymore - price. At 250euro/night it's not much of a bargain but if you can get a more decent rate (I payed 110 euro/night) then it's definitely worth it I wouldn't recommend the breakfast, it's a pity to have the same stuff everyday when you can just have your breakfast P'tit Energie at Le Coquelicot in Montmartre or at Danton near Odeon metro station...Speaking of food, go try les huitres at Mediterane across Odeon Theater, it's very close to the hotel. All in all, I enjoyed Paris very much and this hotel has played a part in that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmsl
Reviews.Content: Jardin l'odeon is a charming hotel located very close to "le theatre Odeon". I loved the location. Near Odeon and Cluny metro stations, with many restaurants, cafés and brasseries nearby. We didn't have to take trasport to our dinners for the firt time in my life when visiting Paris, since options are generous. We had different dinners in nearby french, italian, morroccan restaurants, all with excellent food. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, since we don't have the habit of having it, so I can't say anything about it. Prices ranged between 170 and 180 euros. Rooms are very nicely decorated, and I liked the toilletes, though the bath is a little bit high for elder people, and they should take care. . There is a computer/tv with wifi access -a mac- which was very nice. The rooms are really small, as you can read in some previous reviews . One of our bag had to stay on the floor by the bed side. But this is common in Paris. I did not feel clautrophobic, eventhough. As you are in Paris, I don't believe you want to stay in a big resort and you will be during all your day out of the hotel. So what matters? I noticed the main public was north americans. Though they were very noisy when returning late night to their rooms, I beleive that their happiness for being in Paris made that behaviour. The lift-elevator is big for parisian standards and there is a bag store place in the basement.The hotel staff speak good english, though I spoke french with them all the time. All I asked them was promptly answered, and I really don't agree with the "parisians are rude" idea. It never happened to me. So, consider Jardin l'odeon as one of your options, when visiting Paris, if you have a good price and want to stay in Saint germain area near le quartier latin, and you are not worried about a small but sufficient room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, room too small”
Reviews.Author: zazzi72
Reviews.Content: I suggest this hotel to everyone: clean, nice, centrally located, very good service. Only thing to remind is that the standard room is very small for the price paid (space for bed and just the space to walk around). But in Paris everything is small: table at restaurant, rooms at hotel, ecc.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, with cordial services and fair prices”
Reviews.Author: RikiBrazil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at the hotel. It was very confortable, close to the main boulevards and yet very quiet. The staff were very kind and helpful. The breakfast was a good surprise, with many kinds of options ( juice, tea, coffee, fruits, toasts, cereals, yogurts, etc. ). The bathroom was large, well-ventilated and clean. The only little problem was that the bathtube glass protection was a little small and we could easily spill water outside during the shower. In a country where people smoke a lot, it was excelent to find a hotel 100% smoking-free. Free luggage storage was also very sympathetic.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jiminpr
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location, near to public transportation, good restaurants, sightseeing, etc. rooms are very nice if a little small....as a senior would have liked a shower-tub that was not as deep....hard to get in and out of but, managed. staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: jannekl
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel is overrated in the reviews on this site. First of all price - 280 Euros standard rate for an ordinary double room comes with some expectations. Yo can get a very good four star hotel i Paris for the same price, but unfortunately, Paris was fully booked because of the Paris Car Show and the Fashion Week. The hotel is very good located and quiet. We got a room on the ground floor in the courtyard with our own sitting area outside - that was nice, even though our room was dark and small. Room was clean with a decent bathroom. TV reception was bad - 1 channel worked. Room cleaning missed one day and we had to remind reception to clean the room. The in-room safe started to act strangely the last night and beeped on and off through the night. We asked the night porter for help, but the problem just continued.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful and well positioned hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rosemary1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading comments on Trip Advisor and it certainly lived up to our expectations. Our double prestige room was newly refurbished and so comfortable! The street was extremely quiet and close to fabulous cafes, the Luxemburg Gardens and Odeon Threatre. We were able to walk to the Seine and Notre Dame as well as the train. Our best meal in Paris was at Le Rostand just around the corner from the hotel. Breakfast at the hotel was basic for the price so we chose cafes instead. We felt that we got value for money and we would stay here again if we had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....but VERY claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny91
Reviews.Content: This is an OK boutique hotel in a great location.....rooms (and we were in the MOST luxurious double) did not allow for any baggage in the room....you basically had to roll over the bed to get around. Bathroom nice /functional....but you could not escape the shower curtain or walls! Too tight! Nice people...mediocre maid service..(she left the garbage and left lights on most days)....expensive for what it is....you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mariap1919
Reviews.Content: A charming, friendly hotel in the best neighborhood. The staff is there for you 24/7 with clear, correct info. For a female business traveler, this is both a safe and charming place to stay. Every amenity is within close, walking distance. No need to worry about safety, the area is hopping almost 24/7. The Odeon theater is in site as is the wonderful La Méditerranée restaurant just steps away.... AHHHHH, the fish soup. Coffee on the corner or down the block at the DANTON; RER and METRO short blocks away; several buses on the Boul-Mich take you to any location in the city. San Suplice and San Severan Churches footsteps away.

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel in wonderful quiet location”
Reviews.Author: NIcoletteOttawa
Reviews.Content: Located within 3 blocks of Luxembourg Gardens, and within 5 minute walk to Metro, Jardin de L'Odeon was nevertheless on a very quiet side street with minimal traffic. This is not a chain hotel, each room is furnished differently, and very comfortably. It appears to have been very recently renovated. For a downtown hotel, the space is reasonable and there is room to keep luggage easily in the room. The breakfast is not included but the 12 Euro price was reasonable for unlimited cereal, yoghurt, cheese, coldcuts, eggs, juice, coffee and baguettes( though not always totally fresh) and croissants. The fruit selection was not always fresh either. There is a lovely little courtyard with a fountain where you can have your breakfast. It is within a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame and less than 30 minutes to the Louvre. Staff were helpful , spoke English and were present 24 hours daily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: MandiLonergan
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our 3 week european honeymoon. My first trip to Paris, my husbands 3rd. We enjoyed the hotel. It was an ideal location. Close to everything. The metro is right down the street. Close to restaurants, night life, shopping, ect. We didn't eat breakfast there. There are many cafes close by to have a coffee and pastry in the morning. The hotel room was small, but clean. We were on the 2nd floor facing the road. It was quiet enough at night. This is definitly not a luxury hotel, but in Paris who wants to sit in their hotel room? My only complaint: no door or shower curtain on the shower. Water got everywhere. This seems to be a trend in europe though. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. They made dinner reservations for us one night. Another great thing: free wifi in your room!!! For the price, it was perfect!! Great deal! I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DrSky
Reviews.Content: Easy place to stay - short walk from RER subway and Metro - comfortable room of a nice size, large bathroom, Internet. Internet-special-booking rate, non-changeable, and I paid in advance, during certain seasons are quite competitive and affordable. Literally half of what some of the other hotels I like were charging for that date. I have stayed at one other of their sister hotels, which I also rate highly. Staff was very welcoming, helped whenever I needed it, chatty and pleasant. (It may help that I speak tolerable French as well as my native English.) They were amused that a San Franciscan would find Paris "just like San Francisco" which is where they all would love to vacation. If you're noise-sensitive, check with the staff about which room might be quiet, but I can handle "urban noise" and this place was fine. (My guess is that some people would find the rooms noisy.) Wonderful location - I'm a walker and I could walk to all the tourist spots from this hotel, and the Odeon metro stop is only about 2 or 3 blocks away if you're going farther. This time I was here on business - so 20-minute metro ride got me there. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of the exotic”
Reviews.Author: italytraveller099
Reviews.Content: This is a very good standard 3 star hotel situated on a quiet street, but well placed for good restaurants and bars, a couple of minutes walk from Bvld St Germain.On entrance there is a welcoming reception with black egyptian figures and a smell of figs and exotic fruits. Art deco style furniture predominates with soothing colours of sands and reds,very restful. The room, prestige deluxe ,was decorated with taste, red striped walls, and had a terrace with a red tulip light! Breakfast was fine, cereals, dried and some fresh fruit ,bread basket cold meat and cheese Staff always smiling and helpful,have stayed in quite a few 3 stars in Paris and would say this is the best,would stay here again and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I have stayed in in Paris”
Reviews.Author: freespirit11
Reviews.Content: At the risk of people flocking to this one and me not being able to get back into it, i have to write the review of our excellent stay there this week. The hotel was welcoming, spotlessly clean and stylishly decorated. we had a great room - small but with a huge terrace, and altho the shower room was teeny it was also spotless. The staff were polite and helpful and the location was perfect for my addiction to Left Bank shopping. breakfast was a tad disappointing - tho free for kids under 12.....I will defintely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: anacreonte
Reviews.Content: We have been very satisfied with our choice. The hotel room was nice and clean, not noisy at all, not to big but good size for Paris, modern and comfortable with a big bathroom. The hotel personnel have been very nice and courteous, always smiling and available to help us. Above all the best thing of the hotel was the position within 200 meters from the nearest city metro station so virtually 20 minutes away from every place in Paris. We strongly recommend it for a pleasant stay in Paris, we will choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful visit to Paris :)”
Reviews.Author: leelu27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, after checking out alot of hotels on the web. Since this isn't our 1st visit to beautiful Paris, we wanted to stay around this area of the city. The hotel is on a very quiet street, though mins away from busy St.Michel & St.Germain streets. The hotel is in walkng distance of all the major sights. Our room, facing the courtyard, was very nice, clean & comfortable. Stephanie & Penelope of the hotel staff were very kind & helpfull with all of our questions. The only minus we can think of is there was no CNN/ BBC on th TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AdventureMom16
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed for 7 nights. We love the location to Lux Garden, Notre Dame and Metro. Staff is very helpful with recommendationa and direction. I asked for a hot water maker and a converter and they were prompt and helpful. I recommend the outIet shopping Mall in Valle. It's about 40 min away and worth the time and effort. I consider this hotel is great choice for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay & Great location”
Reviews.Author: MidcoVincent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights back in Feb. We got a very good rate at the hotel website at only 98 euro/ night. The hotel is in a rather quiet street in the 6th Arr. which is an excellent location. From here, you could get to everywhere in Paris easily. Room is kind of small as most of the hotel rooms in Paris are but it is adequate. It is clean, tidy, nicely decorated and comfortable. We would go back if we could get a good rate again as we really love the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall, with some problems”
Reviews.Author: rffan
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at the Jardin de l'Odeon by myself, and loved it, so this July, for a visit to Paris with my sister and niece, I booked two rooms at the Jardin for us - a classic double for myself and a Prestige twin for them. This time, the stay wasn't nearly as perfect as last time, but overall it was still a pretty positive experience. The room I got was tiny compared to the one I stayed in last year--there was no room for a luggage rack. The Prestige room was also extremely small, with a tiny bathroom that had a very small shower stall only--no bathtub--and no counter space. It's a good thing both my sister and niece are petite, because I don't see how a large person could have taken a shower in that tiny stall! Based on this experience, I would say that it's not at all worth paying for a Prestige room. The only Prestige-room extras seemed to be bathrobes and slippers and an IMac computer that doubled as a TV. (On the other hand, the Prestige room lacked the mini-fridge that the Classic rooms have.) The design touches in the Prestige room included a fake-animal-fur bedspread that we all found a bit creepy. I actually preferred the more restrained decor (and normal bedspread) of the Classic room. Breakfast was very pleasant, with excellent service, but for 7 nights in a row, it became sort of monotonous. Next time, I'd definitely try some of the nearby cafes for breakfast. On the last morning of my stay, my bathroom was flooded by a deluge of water from above. It was a good thing I happened to be in my room at the time and was able to alert the front desk right away, or the flood would have been much worse and my belongings would have suffered serious damage. It turned out that the water damage originated from my sister's room when the shower was turned on, so we were both inconvenienced because my sister and niece weren't able to use their shower and my bathroom was flooded. At my request, the hotel did scramble to clean another room for our temporary use until our check-out time, but preparing the substitute room took about an hour and did somewhat ruin our last morning in Paris. (If I hadn't requested the substitute room, I don't think anyone at the hotel would have done anything to remedy the situation for us.) We experienced brief electrical black-outs on two different nights during our week-long stay, so it's a good idea to pack a mini-flashlight and keep it handy. During my stay last year, housekeeping standards were exemplary. This time, things were clean overall, but housekeeping seemed more haphazard--sometimes they forgot to replenish toiletries or towels, and we had to ask at the front desk for these things. I'm not sure if this is a general deterioration of the hotel's standards, or just bad luck on our part. Overall, despite the various issues we encountered, I would definitely consider staying at the Jardin again, esp. at the bargain rates I booked (€104/night for the Classic room and €125/night for the Prestige room). Previous reviewers have talked about paying €250/night to stay at this hotel. If I'd been paying those rates, I'd be a lot less tolerant of the tiny rooms and the problems we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZAUSTravelagent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, has good sized rooms, very friendly and helpful staff. We very much enjoyed our stay in what is for us the most interesting part of Paris, the hotel is on a quiet street and only a short walk to dozens of great dining opportunities. We booked online well ahead of our stay and received good rates, the hotel represented good value for money, even if we did not get the cheaper rates next time we will still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Angelina64
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Jardin de L'Odeon and were made most welcome. The decor of the hotel was very pleasant and we were on the 4th floor overlooking the garden. Although the room was small it was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location was perfect for us and we had a fab time.........

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: aschaf
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location; near metro Luxembourg which goes straight to the airport, and there are several dining options nearby. The room was fine... clean, air conditioned, free Wifi, with a nice little balcony, smallish but typical for Paris. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I had a wonderful stay here...”
Reviews.Author: treh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay here. They upgraded our room to a junior suite on the 6th floor which was very nice! Even though the French chic decor is not our taste, the room had been recently redecorated and was very clean! The location of the hotel is a block from beautiful Luxembourg gardens where we enjoyed many strolls and jogs in the park. Plus the shopping and restaurants in St. Germaine are plentiful and all within easy walking distance. Penelope, the front desk host was very helpful and made dinner reservations for us at two wonderful restaurants, La Ferraindaise and Le Christine. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel in Paris with lovely staff in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: LuluLimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights from July 16th-18th 2010. Really lovely room, very comfy bed and genuinely lovely stay here. It was a little bit of heaven to retreat here after the madness of the area around the champs elysees. It's also very easy to get to the hotel as the metro Odeon stop is just a few mins walk away. The breakfast in the hotel is 12 euro, very reasonable by parisian standards and it was fine.. I liked the fact they used real orange juice instead of that "from concentrate" muck. The Odeon Theatre is just across the road and is a great spot to people watch..there's also lots of nice restaurants and cafe's around the area. Also the free wifi is fab, i could just log on to the internet from my phone without having to log on with passwords etc which is very easy. Also the staff couldn't do enough for us, even googling what time the fireworks started for bastille day. If I'm back in Paris, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Let's Keep This Our little Secret”
Reviews.Author: mark3735
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent over 6 months researching our first trip to Paris and we looked at dozens of hotel, before deciding on the Hotel Jardin de L' Odeon and it was the decision that ensured our best vacation ever. The hotel is located on a very quiet street between the Odeon Theatre and Blvd. Ste. Germain. It is full of cafes and wonderful shops and my family and I loved exploring the area each day. It is within walking distance to many of the major attractions in Paris and the nearby Odeon metro stop made traveling to other sites very easy. The hotel was quiet, charming, clean and the the staff, especially Penelope, were very helpful in answering questions and providing assistance with reservations and travel arrangements. We were wary of the size hotel rooms in Paris, but our room , #47, was surprisingly large with a seperate sleeping area for our daughter, and a big terrace over looking the courtyard. Our side of the room had a large bed and over looked the street, but noise was never an issue at night. There was plenty of closet space and a safe where we could store our passports and money each day. The bathroom was large with a great shower and tub combination. The breakfast room was bright and the breads and juices offered each morning was a great way to begin our day and the ladies who served it were friendly and very polite. The Jardin was the perfect hotel for us during our trip to Paris, and my family and I are all ready planning a return trip next year. I just hope that the hotel can remain a hidden gem because I would never think about staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “location...its all true”
Reviews.Author: Andree67
Reviews.Content: Location is the biggest asset to this hotel **Luxembourg metro is near..with direct RER train to CDG airport** 2 blocks..to boulevard St-Germain--rue Buci..etc...so travelling alone with teenage son..being close to everything made it easy ! safe area..staff extremely helpful!! (of course rooms are small you are in Paris...you get what you pay for) but really good value for money..(I agree with previous comment...beds (mattress) hard and not comfortable- all in all..would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service, but small rooms & noisy. Would stay again, though!”
Reviews.Author: Megami76
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon is a lovely hidden gem with a perfect location and incredible service. I can honestly say that the reception at this hotel (specifically, Penelope, who worked during the morning/day) was outstanding in terms of customer service. She was extremely helpful, warm, professional, and wanted to ensure that our stay was pleasurable. The hotel is located literally steps away from the Odeon Theatre, and a block or two away from the Odeon Metro and the apex where great cafe/bars are, such as Le Comptoir, Les Editeurs, and the Horse's Tavern. It's also about four or five blocks away from Gerard Mulot, which makes amazing croissants, macarons, and food you can take away with you to go to the Jardin Luxembourg (also just two blocks away from the hotel) and enjoy a lovely picnic in the park. Some pros about the hotel: location, location, location. In the Latin Quarter/St-Germain area, I don't think we could have picked a more perfect location. Service was excellent, as was the cleanliness of the room, the housekeeping, etc. We were fortunate enough to receive a room that had a private terrace, and I can tell you that on a summer night, we couldn't have had a more pleasurable amenity than that. Staring up at the stars, at the perfectly kept and manicured flowers -- it was quite lovely. Housekeeping came every day, lovely toiletries products, made the bed perfectly and left little candies on our pillows. The room must have been recently renovated. We felt safe in the area, and taken care of by staff. Really close to the Metro and the RER if you are coming from CDG -- Luxembourg RER B is the way to go and very easy to get to the hotel from there. Cons: Super uncomfortable beds. They are really firm and you can feel the springs digging into your body. I went so far as to ask for extra pillows to slip under the bedsheets to make my own makeshift pillowtop mattress. Also, the room (we just got a regular, basic room) was very, very small, which is ok -- you're in Paris, why do you need a big room? Sleeping is definitely an issue since the walls are very thin and you can hear everything. We tried to take a nap during the day and if someone left or entered their room, the door closing made a noise similar to a gunshot, and we immediately woke up. We also ordered room service (had to call down about 3x before someone answered -- but this was later at night). Room service is only cold food and for what you get, it is EXTREMELY expensive, so I would definitely skip it if you can. Go across the street to La Cambuse (restaurant) and for 20 Euro you can get a great prix fixe meal. Conclusion: Listen, we purchased a basic room at a very reasonable rate (160 Euros a night via their website) in the height of tourist season. Their service and location are incredible, but you get what you pay for -- if you go for the basic room, be prepared to have a very small room, with a small bed and an extremely small bathroom (beware ladies, you may not be able to have room to bend over and shave your legs!). While it is clean and charmingly decorated, my biggest problem was the bed -- I just wish it was comfortable! Also, the double bed really isn't made for two adults -- so that part was disappointing. I would definitely take one for the team and go back, though. I've had enough encounters with rude reception at another Paris hotel near CDG to make me appreciate what we had here at the Hotel Jardin. Again, the location was absolutely perfect. Thanks to Penelope and staff for their help. I am sure we were your typical annoying tourists and you treated us with kindness and respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: Katharina56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon for 10 days, June 13 to 23, 2010, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful, the street quiet after the Odeon lets out, the air conditioning works if you need it. We chose to eat breakfast there; it was good and the staff very pleasant. The location is excellent, just a 5 minute walk to Odeon metro; Luxembourg Gardens and St Sulpice church are very close by. We would stay here again. B. Goodson, Vancouver, BC

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: There was nothing not to like at this well-located hotel in the 6th Arrondissment with both Luxembourg gardens and the Odeon metro stop on Blvd. Saint-Germain just a few steps away. It’s on a remarkably quiet street in a busy neighborhood with countless restaurants, cafes, bars and upscale shops. My first room (#62), on the 5th floor, was typically small but attractive and stylish with a very nice bathroom that had a tub and hand-held shower. It looked fine at first. When I started to settle in for my weeklong stay, there was no place to put anything. Only a sliver of a closet (with awful, attached hangers, no dresser, no surfaces to work on, no chair other than the desk chair. The small desk was entirely occupied by a large TV/computer. When I asked to see a bigger room with more space to unpack, they were very accommodating. My new room, #18, was on the 1st floor (a lot less time spent waiting for the slow elevator). The bathroom wasn’t as spiffy but the tub had a nice strong shower. The closet had some shelves and the TV was on top of the mini-bar (water and sodas only & totally lacking in the first room) liberating the desk for me to use. Still no chair other than the desk chair unless a tiny stool, useful only for resting my daypack, counts. One of the nicest things about this room is the lovely outlook, past window boxes of pink hydrangea, into the hotel’s bitty garden. Several rooms have balconies, by the way. Breakfast was also good. The coffee was excellent and it was a decent value for 12 Euros. Having breakfast in my room helped get me out into the city sooner in the mornings, though it’s fun to breakfast at one of the cafes nearby. Most important, the staff, was professional and helpful. They seemed to really want their guests to be happy. The uppity attitude that sometimes comes from the French was totally lacking. There is excellent free wifi through most of the hotel. However the connection in my second room was spotty. They assured me this would be fixed soon however. In sum, a nice Left Bank hotel, quiet, well located, nice people. Is it worth 255 Euros a night? I’m not sure about that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect First Trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Nik D
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it wasn't exactly perfect seeing as we missed our flight from London on the Friday night. But, despite this and missing our first night of three, Marie and I had a fantastic stay at the hotel. Stephanie was a great help from the first call I made weeks before we arrived, the moment we checked in, and every time we saw her afterwards. The room was clean and just as we expected, and we were very pleased with the size of the bathroom too. The room service was also a bonus, being available until 1am and the food was great. The best thing, though, is the location. We found Saint Germain to be the most delightful, laid back, and culture filled part of Paris and a great base to see the city from. Notre Dame is a 10 minute stroll and you can take the Batobus to see all the major attractions in a day. Highly advised at 13 Euros per person, a boat every 15 minutes, and you can hop on and off at any time and as many times throughout the day. In two days we saw Notre Dame, The Louvre, The Eiffel Tower, L'Arc de Triomphe, shopped on Rue des Francsbourgeois, and saw so much more. And each night we had a lovely stroll back to the comfort of this lovely little hotel. A wonderful experience, thoroughly recommended, and we are going back in September.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service”
Reviews.Author: pmangino
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 night stay. Hotel is located on quiet street in busy area. Many good cafes and shops within walking distance, as well as Metro stop. Best part of stay was the staff who went out of their way to be helpful including booking train tickets, airport shuttles, etc. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place as base for Rolland Garros”
Reviews.Author: rjmartintx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend the French Open Tennis matches. It's only a block from the Metro Line #10 that goes to the tennis matches. And another block walk gets you to Notre Dame Cathedral and the many other key historic sites. Service was great. Breakfast was hearty. Our room #64 had a terrace with a table and two chairs that overlooked the Theater Odeon and street scenes. This hotel is small and offers a delightful Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “good standard in expensive city”
Reviews.Author: cocofamilyEssex
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with grandparents and children, I would not normally pay this price but wanted it to be nice for my pareents and convenient for restaurants/park and river. The hotel is clean and well run, my parents were upgraded as it was my mums 80th birthday and their room (5th floor with sat TV and computer ,very useful) was very pleasant and quiet looking over the back courtyard, there is air con but as it is quiet you can have the window open at night). Ours were on the 3rd floor classic rooms and were entirely adequate but you couldn't get excited about them, we had room 36, good as the bathroom is at the front and not internal - good ventilation!). Paris is v expensive and paying this rate this is what you get, clean, well run hotel, small rooms and small foyer where you can sit and have a drink (they gave my mum a bottle of champagne, a nice touch). Breakfast was good, they will bring you more of anything - croissants bread etc, nothing cooked, there is a small terrace. WE asked for a taxi to drive my parents round Paris at night, I can recommend this , my parents weren't up to hopping on and off buses and we got to see everything and could stop where we wanted, drove around Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, up to Sacre Coeur via the Moulin Rouge, around Place de la Concorde and past the Pyramid at the Louvre. Our driver was v courteous and though expensive it would have been otherwise impossible for us to take all this in with elderly folk & children. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel, and nice small shops and Boulageries. It seems lots of Americans stay here so their English is great and they can organise anything.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: alesquire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located... in walking distance to major sights, and in an upscale neighborhood. The room while expectedly small, as are many hotel rooms in major cities, was extremely shabby and a great disappointment. I would certainly stay in the area again, but never at this hotel. The room certainly does not look like the photos online.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bugstar
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris and this hotel was so wondeful! Amazing location, so cute and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyb333
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Knowing that Paris hotel rooms can be small, we reserved the largest room and requested twin beds. It was on the top floor and had a terrace overlooking the area. It was delightful to sit out there each morning. The room was larger than I expected, and more than adequate for two people. The bathroom, though small, was very nice, and the overhead shower was great. The rooms are nicely decorated and everything was clean and comfortable. The hallways outside the rooms are small and narrow so during the night I can hear doors being closed, but that was expected. Other than that, it was very quiet. It was also a nice surprise to find a computer in our room and was therefore able to use the internet. Everyone at the hotel was professional, friendly, and very helpful. We did have breakfast at the hotel each morning. Some reviewers have said that you can find cheaper alternatives in cafes and such, but I found it so relaxing to start the day with a cup of tea and croissant before heading out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: trefle13
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and we were very happy with the choice. Booked the "variable rate" on their website which changes day-to-day so I snagged a great rate. Staff was accomodating and helpful in advance with restaurant reservations and special requests. Easy to get there from RER B at Luxembourg or Odeon metro, just a couple blocks from each. Really fun area right near St Germain des Pres and walking distance to all the sights, museums, restaurants, bars. Found the street very quiet and we heard no noise at night. I recommend the "Prestige" rooms - ours was on the 5th floor and had a shower (major plus). Still very small but they've been updated and the free internet in room was a nice touch. Even had a nice view of Odeon Theatre from our window. Couldn't recommend this highly enough for a reasonably priced but still very comfortable and modern hotel. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little botique hotel smack in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed in Jardin de L'Odeon and as the last time (2005) it was a super experience. The hotel is extremely charming, with great service, friendly staff, and a super location - it is located on a side street right in the Latin Quarter. Do note that the rooms (and beds) are VERY small (as in most Paris hotels), but they are clean and have exactly the right "french feel". All in all a GREAT hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & charming”
Reviews.Author: Schmidtlock
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with tastefullly decorated (albeit small) rooms, sparkling and spacious bathrooms and charming service in a quiet but interesting neighbourhood with good restaurants, easy access to transport and only a 3 minute walk to the J d Luxembourg. We got recommended this hotel by a friend who is from Paris, and I'm glad we followed his recommendation on our first trip to this awesome city. There's a bunch of similar little hotels in the neighbourhood, so it may pay to shop around a bit. You can't do anything wrong with booking into this one though.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location. minutes from the Luxembourg Gardens and Odeon Metro.”
Reviews.Author: Painter08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris many times and only wished we had chosen this loction earlier. We have always stayed very close to the Louvre etc. but the area near the hotel was just perfect and we ate in a different restaurant each night for a week. The Hotel staff were all kind and very helpful. We decided to change our twin room for a larger room and took room 01 which was ground floor and very convenient and although probably twice as big as our previous 62 was only 20Eu more per day. The breakfast lady was especially kind and cheerful. I am afraid Paris is now at its most expensive considering the vissicitudes of the Euro and the poor Americans found life very expensive, that made a change! The little restaurant accross the road from the hotel was good at 45 Eu for two and the guide book recommendation of les Papilles also nearby was 130 Euros for two! By the way the Picasso museum is closed until 2012 for refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NycNelson
Reviews.Content: was there for four nights in late april; good location -- about two blocks from odeon metro station; room was clean and comfortable; only shower in bathroom which didn't bother me. because i don't take baths; breakfast was included and it was nice spread (breads, jucie, coffee, sliced meats and cheeses, yogurt); friendly staff; no problems here

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: imgwiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quiet street in a central area, and the courtyard rooms are calm and peaceful, decorated with pretty pink hydrangeas in window boxes, and with the sounds only of bird songs in the morning. In the afternoon and evening, there were sometimes dried fruits left out for guests to have. The hotel location is perfect in my opinion - close to Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg, St. Germain des Prés-- plus several metro and bus stops within quick walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times, and especially kind during the volcano-airline crisis. They made it possible for us to stay on at the hotel for the extra five days by being flexible on their pricing and discounting the price of the room, while we read and heard about other hotels raising their prices in the same situation. They felt it was a way they could help out in an unfortunate situation. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a visit of Paris”
Reviews.Author: HGF_10
Reviews.Content: A hotel in a good location for a town trip. Our room was small but very clean. The stuff was friendly. The breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Polkapon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during Easter, on the way back from a trip to Italy and Switzerland. When we arrived our room wasn't quite ready but the receptionist was really friendly and offered lots of advice on where to eat and things to do. The Hotel is in a great location, 5 minute walk to the river, latin quarter and shops. The rooms, although not massive are very clean, comfortable and quiet. Recommend a little cafe 'Le Danton' on Boulevard St Germain, Place Henri Mondor, near the Odeon metro stop - breakfast is lovely and the hot chocolate is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location. See for yourself.”
Reviews.Author: 101Scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in prestige double room - spacious, separate living room, lovely bedroom, good bathroom. And balcony with lovely view into back courtyard. If standard rooms are half the size they would be good. Highly recommend for family or couples. Breakfast was tasty - ham, cheese, cereal, toast, bread, croissant, coffee, juice, fruit. Grea location - few mins walk from RER station Luxemburg (to CDG airport) and from Odeon metro station. Off a main street so quiet enough for sleeping, but with several nice bars/restaurants nearby. Many book shops in the area. Staff very friendly - very good english spoken throughout. Overall excellent standard and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrtsao
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I stay at many hotels in the Left Bank. I have found my new favorite. Just steps from the Theatre de L'Odeon, the hotel could not be better situated for easy access to the best of the Rive Gauche. The staff is world class, the room I had was spacious for Paris standards and best of all, I slept soundly because the hotel is on a quiet side street. The little things, like attentive service, quality linens, easy wi-fi and convenience make this one of the best three star establishments in the city of light,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay--quiet location yet close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: CoWeen
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something not too pricey, clean, nice and in a great location. Hotel de L'Odeon was all that and more. It was right within the latin quarter, but on a quiet street. We requested the street view which I would enjoy more than the garden. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms weren't huge of course, but a decent size with a nice bathroom. Walking to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: shoredistants
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed there for three nights in the begging of March. We had a very good stay from the start to the end. We are used to stay in 4-5 stars hotels so I know what I´m talking about. What is important for us is the service. So I had checked the reviews here before booking the hotel and decided to book since there were many happy guests. The room was clean every day and quiet. But there was no minibar in the room for you who want to have something to drink. When we were there it was about +4 degrees celsius. So we had a half bottle of champagne in a plastic bag just outside the french balcony in the room for chilling before drinking :-) And a very nice thing is that they had apple TV. That was high tech for a 3 star hotel and much appreciated even though there were some problems with the TV picture. But that was from the TV screen itself and not the apple box. I recommend this hotel mostly of the experience with the nice staff and that they made our stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: Lalapants
Reviews.Content: We chose this area on the advice of a couple of friends, having never been to Paris before and this hotel on the strength of some TA reviews and another friend who had stayed in a hotel in the same road. We booked a Prestige Double room, using the hotel's own website, which gave far and away the best price. We had a few questions before arriving which were answered by email and phone very promptly. We asked for, and got, a front facing room overlooking the small one way street. The room wasn't huge but plenty of room for 2 to get dressed in the morning at the same time and hey, in Paris, who spends much time in their room! No noise to speak of that you wouldn't find in any city centre hotel (some sirens, some traffic noise from adjacent streets, some chatter from passers by). The room is newly refurbished, very warm and with a comfy bed. Good size wardrobe, in room safe, flat screen TV and Apple Mac computer and wifi internet access, that didn't drop off! Lots of electrical sockets but no tea and coffee making facilities - bring your own. The bathroom is small but has a deep bath with rain shower over.
