There seems to be unlimited hot water at an even pressure, which is very welcome. The bath was great, as it was very cold during our vist. We did not take the breakfast option, either having brioche and coffee in our room before going out or eating at a local cafe. The location was good. We don't use the metro but prefer buses and it was less than a 5 minute walk to stops with buses going in various directions, and the same to the Metro station. Pretty easy walking distance to lots of sights and lots of restaurants etc all around. We will defintely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory, typically Parisian.”
Reviews.Author: ckearney77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what you would expect from a Parisian hotel. Location was great. The staff did not speak much English but were as helpful as they could be. Rooms and bathrooms are very small, but clean and pleasant. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on this but there are lots of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel was easy to get to from CDG airport as the train RER B stopped just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. All major attractions are in close range also. Overall, a very satisfactory visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mngirl1
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has the best location with the most pleasant staff I have encountered in Paris. It is near Luxembourg Garden and the Sorbonne, close to subway lines. We payed extra for an upper floor with a newly renovated room, and it was clean, quiet and the free internet is a nice plus. Excellent water pressure in the bath/hand shower. No view, and of course it is Paris-sized. Breakfast is not automatically included in the room price, and for 12 euros, you might want to straggle out to a nearby bar or cafe instead, but the breakfast room is delightful and convenient. I would definitely return, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Newly Decorated (and more expensive) Rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: myra2009
Reviews.Content: The rooms in my favourite hotel in Paris were as of late starting to look a bit worn, so I chose the new design deluxe room for the most recent stay in Paris. I am happy to report that the redecoration is a great success with brand new and spotless bathrooms, new artwork, plush furnishings and LED Samsung TVs with in-room internet access. Our room was No. 62, small but pretty, it had a bathtub (a big plus in winter) and faced the inner courtyard. Whilst it was quiet at night, I would have preferred a room with a street view, since the back faces into a wall and the courtyard is 5 stories below, so it is not the most estetically pleasing view. Breakfast was delicious and all the service staff extremely friendly. On the morning of our arrival, one of the maids was singing as she was tidying the rooms! Matthieu at reception was very helpful and efficient. The new rooms are more expensive (we paid around €150 per night - internet discount rate) and I think what the hotel is doing is to increase room rates progressively as the plan is to renovate the entire hotel in due course. If this results in higher rates overall it will be a real shame and somehow also unfair on all the old clientele who made the hotel into such a hot spot by virtue of great tripadvisor reviews about the modest price and excellent service. I hope that Jardin de L'Odeon will not commercially over-exploit its popularity and hike up the room rates. One recommendation for the hotel: the luggage room is on the lower ground floor. It has a lock, but it is not locked and is open to access for guests who want to leave their luggage there if they are checking in early or checking out and sightseeing before departure. It would be good to lock the room and only give keys to guests who are dropping off or picking up their luggage. Like that the security arrangements would be enhanced. As it stands, anyone could walk into the hotel, go downstairs and pick up a few bags. We were lucky and I have to say nothing ever happened in the past, but I think this is a problem that is an ongoing risk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: TCvacationer1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after deciding on the area and reading reviews. It was a great selection for our first visit to Paris. The room was very clean, location perfect, and service from the staff couldn't have been better. The only drawback (which we were aware of going in) was the size of the room and bathroom. We chose the standard room knowing that it would be small because we would only be staying 2 nights and we had just one bag. We would definitely upgrade for a longer visit. As others have noted, the hotel is in a great area for restaurants and touring. It is close to metro/rail stations. We were able to take the rail from CDG and the hotel was just a short walk away. It was a great choice and we would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great location and very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: GershwinLondon
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi in rooms a great bonus. Chose not to have the breakfast but it looked nice. Standard rooms on the small side but that is Paris! We had a superior double which was a really good size with separate loo and bathroom. The staff were extremely helpful and very efficient at answering any questions I had by email prior to our visit. They were able to recommend various venues for us including jazz club and restaurant. All in all a really nice and reasonable hotel that I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and clean hotel in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: SherlyC
Reviews.Content: Spent a 5 nights Honeymoon with my hubby in Paris. It was our first visit to Paris. Hotel room is clean and spacious and located in a quiet neighborhood. Lot's of restaurants and stores nearby. The Oden Metro was closed for maintenance so we walked to Luxembourg RER (10 mins walking distance) which is near the Luxembourg garden. The receptionist at desk speaks excellent english and gives good guidance in getting around Paris. We will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in St. Germain de Pres”
Reviews.Author: terrymv
Reviews.Content: The Jardin de L'Odeon was a lovely hotel in St. Germain de Pres, close to some great restaurants, but on a little side street that was quiet and safe at night. It was also very close to the metro station, which was perfect. The rooms were very clean and beautifully decorated, particularly the bathroom. Each room came with a brand new Apple iMac computer (with large screen) for television, movies, and internet. It also broadcast wireless internet so that I could also work on my own laptop. Breakfast was small, but good. The breakfast room staff was very friendly, as were the housecleaning staff. One of the front desk staff was very unfriendly to us (but overly friendly to other American guests), and we still have no idea why! We take great care to be friendly to Parisians (because they have always been so nice to us), so we are uncertain as to how we could have offended her! The other male staff, however, were extremely friendly and helpful. Overall an excellent experience. Would absolutely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Value - Details On Hotel, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MLM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Overview: - Great value for the money spent. Location: - Overall, the location was good. As this was my first time to Paris, I wasnt sure what to expect or where to go. Based on previous reviews, I expected the hotel to be very close to many attractions. In reality, this was not the case. It wasnt as close as the previous reviews led me to believe. Although getting around in Paris was easy using their Metros. With that being said, once the hotel was located - getting to the Metro station (Oleon) was quite easy. Turn right out the door, cross one street, down steps to the left and you are there next to the Metro station across from Starbucks. Service: - I believe this was the best part of the hotel. Very Very helpful staff. Anything you needed they would help you with. Minor details such as getting coffee in the lobby - I approached to make it myself and they came over and "prepared it" for me.. Great service and again very friendly. Getting Around: -Getting to major attractions wasnt too difficult upon finding the Metro. I used the M4 to connect with most places...generally I would go to St Michael Metro station to connect with either the RER's or other metros. St Michael is the very next stop north of Oleon. Dining: -Hotel has room service until (I believe 0200). The menu is somewhat limited although the food is good. If you are not into room service, there are plenty of restaurants quite literally right around the corner. Places such as Mediterranean Restaurant and a GREAT sushi restaurant for very very cheap (delicious) as well. Misc: -Overall, I would definitely stay here again and recommend to my friends. Its a very good deal for the money and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: leetaxor
Reviews.Content: Like most very central hotels, the rooms in Jardin de L'Odeon are relatively small, but the standards are very high. The en suite bathroom was excellent, with a superb shower and very clean, high standard of equipment. Left luggage facilities are always useful too, and we made use of them, although they weren't locket at all, so I made sure I took my passport with me. Breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Superb Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NfromTO
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Paris during the Christmas holiday. We chose to stay at this hotel based on the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. We booked it through the hotel's web site as it provided the best rates and value (premium room with breakfast). The room was satisfactory, although a bit too hot and dry which was uncofortable at times. The continental breakfast is adequate, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the free wi-fi is an excellent value-added feature. Since we do not spend too much time in the hotel room while travelling we require a basic comfort level and Jardin de l'Odeon meets the criteria. Having said that, the best selling point of this hotel is its proximity to all the major sites -- we travelled with a toddler and going back and forth to/from the hotel throughout the day was very convenient. To conclude: a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Woderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: photographer1London
Reviews.Content: Our third visit and as usual too short. This is our favourite Paris hotel. The area is both quiet and secluded and yet near most of the things we want to see. The hotel as usual was spotlessly clean. The staff were helpful and friendly - and spoke perfect English which, given that our French is so poor, is important. The only improvement I can think of would be if tea/coffee making facilities were available in the rooms. Be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A special place.”
Reviews.Author: barbev2
Reviews.Content: After a superb night at the lovely Hotel Relais de St-Honore, we were afraid that our four-night stay at the Hotel Jardin de l’Odeon a week later would compare unfavourably. Fortunately this wasn’t the case. It was different, sure, but nevertheless a very pleasant small hotel in a great location – almost opposite the Odeon Theatre and five-minutes’ walk from the nearest Metro and the Luxembourg Gardens. Our ‘deluxe’ room wasn’t exactly spacious but it opened onto a large private terrace with tubs of trees and plants, and an outdoor table and chairs where we could sit and sip wine in the evenings. The bedroom was comfortable, nicely furnished and quiet – though at night there was some occasional noise from the room above. The bathroom was quite small (using the shower was a challenge for even moderately well-built people) but modern, clean and functional. Being morning slow-starters we ate breakfast at the hotel every day and had no complaints: a nicely-presented standard ‘continental’ buffet served in a charming conservatory room by a friendly and attentive woman. Reception staff were extremely pleasant, helpful (providing a corkscrew for our evening wine bottle) and spoke excellent English. They even seemed slightly apologetic when making the exorbitant charge of 17 Euros for a card to access the internet on the foyer computer… We would most certainly stay here on future visits to Paris and recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a small, charming, friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - French charm”
Reviews.Author: djjuniorUSofA
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to France and we stayed here - it was a decision we were so pleased we made. It's a perfect size to feel you are welcome as a guest and not a room number. We fell in love with Paris and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: CountSQatar
Reviews.Content: I came looking for a romantic weekend and I got one. Lovely rooms in a wonderful part of Paris (and a great little restaurant over the road, by the way). Very friendly staff and nice ambience. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, spotless, great location”
Reviews.Author: irishdancer65
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here. The location is excellent. Staff are extremely friendly, charming and polite. As with most of the boutique hotels in the St. Germain area, the rooms are very small. Our room was compact but fine for us. The bathroom is tiny but well planned. Nice hot power shower. The room and bathroom were spotless. Bed comfortable and the room was quiet at night-time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to criticise... the perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 2 nights here, having booked and paid in full at a special rate from the hotel's website back in March, planning ahead to catch up with friends visiting from Australia. A bit nervous about the payment in advance, wondering what we'd do if the hotel failed to live up to its pretty website photos. However, it turned out to be a real find... in the heart of the lovely St Germain area and so a stroll away from the (mostly very expensive) cafes, restaurants and bars (8 euros for a small beer!). The room was beautifully appointed with windows that opened to the street (not much street noise at night - at least, we weren't disturbed), the bathroom clean and elegant, good linen and towels. Reception was friendly and efficient (their English better than my French) and all the staff we spoke too were friendly and helpful... a far cry from the stereotypical French brusqueness (which we're beginning to think may be these days undeserved as everyone ... from restaurant staff to passers-by from whom we asked directions on this admittedly very short trip... was smiling and helpful). Breakfast, included in the price, offered reasonable choice and the lady in charge of breakfast was very charming, not minding at all when we turned up earlier than the appointed time on our last morning because of our early train home and happily getting coffee for us. We know where we will stay when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: KKD_60
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Jardin de l'Odeon. The rooms are a little small, but spotless, charming, and tastefully decorated. The hotel is well located...just steps from the Odeon metro stop, in the heart of bustling St Germain, with numerous cafes and restaurants. Our room had a view of a tranquil courtyard w/fountain. The best thing though, is the service. The staff had a great willingness to help me find a french film I had been looking for...directions for an obscure address...restaurant recommendations...our stay was just delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: angchicagoPT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid-October. They gave us a free upgrade to one of their newly remodeled rooms, which had free internet in the room on their own computer which was a lifesaver! The room was small, as I had been warned about for Paris hotels, but it was roomy enough for us. I think this is the perfect location, the street is just a little quiet street but not far from some really fun areas. It is within walking distance to all sites we wanted (Marais district, Centre Pompidou, Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe). A little bit of a hike but possible. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel!! It was clean, well run and totally enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: HotSouthandSunny
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hidden gem close to shopping and Michelin 2009 recommended resturant - we loved this hotel. Would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Paris. Just steps away from the Odeon Theater of Europe!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly right!”
Reviews.Author: BBest
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service, nice people, wonderful experience! Go there, it's really GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a few nights stay within easy reach of the best bits in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: cutlogtrip
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay for a few days in Paris. Travelling to Paris is for the pleasure of the city. One doesnt want to have to worry about where they are staying or have a hotel that ruins your experience. The hotel is a lovely sweet retreat at the end of a busy day in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NaMakani
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Des Jardins de Odeon is a very comfortable hotel in a good location. My wife and I stayed here for four nights in late August ‘09 and would definitely stay here again on a future trip. Situated on the edge of the St. Germain de Pres area, it is a short distance from the Odeon Metro (doable with a reasonable amount of luggage), and even shorter from the Odeon Theater. We arrived by train at Gare Lyon and took the # 63 bus right outside the train station to Place de l’Odeon, about two blocks from the hotel, on a quiet side street. Note that Paris buses are easy to use with luggage in tow. Our room (# 37) was moderate to large by Paris standards, and was very tastefully decorated and recently redone. There was a comfortable queen size bed, closet, desk, two nightstands, t.v., and small refrigerator. There was very little street noise, and was generally very quiet except for some occasional noise from the hallway which would only bother the most sensitive. The a.c. was quiet and effective but somewhat hard to regulate. The attractive tiled bathroom was good-sized with shower only. There was adequate counter space. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn’t try the 12 euro breakfast, opting instead to buy fruit and yoghurt elsewhere. There are also lots of nearby bistros for breakfast. Overall, we think the Hotel des Jardins is a very good value and an excellent choice for a place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJTourist
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through trip advisor and booked direct with the hotel. I must say that the position was fantastic (nice & quiet) yet handy to transport and within walking distance to most attractions.The hotel had a lovely parisian feel and all the staff were so helpful. We had breakfast here and the continental that was provided was delightful. We stayed a week here and found that all the staff were excellent . Our room was on the fourth floor and we did not have a view but everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel as the position is good and very good value for money with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Camilla16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we couldn't fault the staff, room or breakfast! The staff were all extremely polite and very helpful and were all too happy to recommend a local restaurant which turned out to be lovely. We were upgraded to a premier room which had been recently redecorated and was very clean. There were a number of thoughtful touches - a free bottle of water in the room and sweets on the pillows. The metro is a 5 minute walk away and all the main sights are less than a 20 minute metro ride away - many much closer. There are a number of restaurants, brasseries and bars nearby as well as some lovely boulangeries!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull place”
Reviews.Author: FabioElena
Reviews.Content: We was in this hotel for ten days. We found it the perfect place for our honey moon. It's quite, very near the center and near of nice restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and clean, if not the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TRV_1957
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week vacation in France, which started off in Paris. This smoke-free property is immaculate and very well-managed. A boutique hotel with lots of personal attention from start to finish. We booked a junior suite with a very good early booker rate. It was a two floor room, but typical for Paris, rather small. The staircase is very steep and the bathroom quite narrow. There is a full size tub and second sink. The bed was very comfortable, and the AC worked well, but no view. In-room Internet access uisng a flat screen LCD (also served as the TV) was free and a very nice touch. Breakfast was ample and reasonably priced (for Paris). The beautiful Luxembourg Gardens are a five minute walk away, while the Odeon Metro station is about the same distance. The only drawback is that the Metro lines from Odeon do not go directly to many of the more commonly visited locations in Paris. Next time we will likley stay in the more leafy and more gentrified 7th.

Reviews.Title: “Classy little Art Deco hotel well located between Odeon metro and the Luxembourg Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Europofile
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed there, and will again after so many other disappointments. The staff are courteous and helpful, and the location is so convenient to the metro and buses, and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: luminescentma
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the great number of very positive reviews. There are some areas of agreement I have with them. The location is wonderful for walking and viewing Paris. Quite lovely. The desk staff ranged from extremely sweet and knowledgeable and helpful to surprisingly indifferent. The lobby, breakfast area and street presence of the hotel are appealing. Our problem was with the room and how minimally comfortable it was. The double bed was really two twin beds, low to the ground, that were pushed together. The mattress was very firm bordering on seriously uncomfortable. The pillows were squashed and tired. Two pillows barely equaled one decent pillow. Since one really needs a decent night's sleep in a hotel, more than anything, a hospitable bed would be a minimum requirement. The walls are thin and between the noise of water running heard from other rooms, a strange and rather constant sound of a pump of some sort and the sound of doors opening and closing in the am, the illusion of elegance was eliminated. The hair dryer was poor, the shower allowed water to saturate some of the bathroom and there was no counter space. To my surprise there was no small bottle of conditioner in the shower but I was told I could go to the drug store 5" away and buy some if I wanted. Not really, and yet I had to. For this amount of money, perhaps a tiny bottle of conditioner and a comfortable bed wouldn't be too much.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, convenient hotel in wonderful part of the latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: ismeneLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon two times now and have found it a great place to stay on both occasions. The staff are welcoming, friendly and informative. The decor is beautiful....art deco with lovely gustav klimt prints in the bedrooms, lovely bedlinen and very clean bathrooms...the showers are very good also. The location is in a quiet part of the Latin Quarter with lots of interesting shops and landmarks nearby. The jardin de luxemborg is close and the metro 5 minutes away. I will definitely stay here on my next visit ot Paris....until then.....au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: CVTravelerSoCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my spouse and 2 young children - the rooms are small (typical for Paris) but clean; we had 2 rooms across the hall from eachother. Managment is friendly and the location is outstanding for visiting Paris by foot or metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: BistoBuff
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location with very friendly and helpful staff. Got the room at a soecial rate so no complaints with the price. Room not very big but considering most of our time was spent outside it didn't matter. As previous reviewers have commented the metro is close by as well as tourist attractions. When we go back to Paris we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for single traveller”
Reviews.Author: PotatoMasher
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Latin Quarter on quiet street

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you're expectations are right”
Reviews.Author: acdublin1980
Reviews.Content: Jardin L'Odeon is a decent, very clean, excellently located three-star hotel in Paris. No more, no less. Don't expect luxurious extras, don't expect lots of space in your room or bed. The internet works, so does the lift, the bathroom is small. If you want to see Paris at a very good price, in a great location and want to be confident of cleanliness, stay at Jardin L'Odeon. If you want a hotel experience that stands out as special in its own right, don't. Final word: I was keen to get a superior room with a terrace and paid about €30 a night extra to have it. We hardly used the terrace (though it was a good size) and the room was smaller than the standard size. In future we would stay in a standard room for less money, no terrace and bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- Definitely Stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Irelandaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the jardin de l odeon for 5 nights with my partner. room was perfect for our needs. clean tidy, all the mod cons and for a good rate. we had a room at back of the hotel so it was quiet at night ( its a quiet street so no need to worry). Literally a 5 min walk to st micheal/ latin quarter & st germain. metro odeon is a 2 minute walk! Breakfast is simple but a bit on the expensive side @ €12 per person. easier to go to a bakery and grab a croissant & coffee. Staff are very helpful & full of uselful knowledge. If your looking for a good restaurant, pop around the corner & visit premier restaurant polidor! great value & good grub!! overall a great hotel if u want a simple , comfortable & good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern friendly hotel in a brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: SashaDoodle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a small, modern and really well decorated establishement. Hotel was in a quiet street just 1 minute from Luxemburg Gardins and 3 minutes from Latin Quarter. Lovely view from the room through the full length French balcony windows of the Odeon Theatre and outdoor cafe/bistro. Staff were excellent, even helping me with my very bad French. But do try speaking French, people become a lot more receptive to you. Location is excellent, near several Metro stations which were not used as the Hotel is near all the things to see on the Left Bank, Luxemburg Gardens (go there in the late afternoons and relax beside the boat lake), Museum D'Orcy, Louvre, Notre Dam. We had the most relaxing and enjoyable time and would quite merrily go back to the same hotel as well as recommend it to a freind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: crox40
Reviews.Content: You absolutely can't find a better location in Paris. It is very convenient on one Metro line from Gare du Nord and a couple minutes walk from the Odeon stop. It is also in the heart of St Germain and around the corner from a great corner of cafes. Make a booking ahead of time for Le Comptoure otherwise you will never get in for dinner. The staff were extremely friendly - you will not get the Paris treatement here. Desk staff all speak good English though you will need to know some French at breakfast time. The hotel is clean, it is comfortable and well decorated with some nice pieces of art on walls in halls and your room. It is a cramped room but that is what you will almost always get in Paris. And the bathroom is a great size so nothing to complain about there. The free wireless is a great plus as well. The breakfast is served until 10:30 which is quite nice if you have been out late. Most places don't serve that late. It is a typical breakfast - meats, breads, etc. They bring you orange juice and coffee though the coffee is a bit strong. Think you can order boiled eggs but they were out when we asked. The one complaint I would have is that the rooms are quite thin and it can make for a noisy morning. But again, this does not seem unusual for Paris. I am rating this 5 stars based on expectations for a hotel in this price range in Paris. I don't know what it costs to book a room normally but if you are coming from London, use railbookers.com and get a package deal with Eurostar. It becomes a terrific deal.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews on TA are Accurate”
Reviews.Author: ssmhawaii
Reviews.Content: Nine Americans, first time to Paris w teens. Once again, found this through TA and these reviews are on the money. Great location for St Germaine and access to the Latin Quarters, as well as The Louve/Seine/Notre Dame. Nothing happening on the 400 yd section of the street the hotel faces, but a plus since quiet and 2 minutes to start shops/food etc. Perfect for anyone or first time to Paris. Don't waist the time or money on breakfast. Walk 2-7 minutes to what St Germaine region is all about. The ambience of narrow streets, and great bakeries and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: spaustralia
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel for 5 nights recently.Off the busy streets but close to great restaurants, pubs and shops and also close to the tourist attractions in Paris.Staff were very helpful.Room was clean,comfortable and airconditioned.We basically only slept and showered there as there was so much to see and do.Also easy to get to Gard du Nord and the Eurostar.Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hotel in Paris to celebrate wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: NohemiVienna
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week July in Paris in Jardin le Odeon, we found this hotel through Trip Advisor, and all the comments we read were confirmed, the reception people are very cooperative and friendly, they have made almost daily our reservations for dinner (we provided the data), our room was so quiet "fantastic", clean and big enough for us. Its location is wonderful, one come very easy from Charles de Gaulle airport using Rer B or just walking to Louvre Museum or Notre Dame, Pantheon, Latein Quartier (here there are many restaurants and a lot of people), Saint Germain Boulevard etc. We confirm: travelling via the underground was cheaper using single tickets (buy 10 block). Having breakfast at the hotel saves time. The only thing we regret is: they do not give free acces to internet, one have to buy a card 20€ and we only want to send an email, instead we have used our handy. If one wants to stay in the center of Paris and in a quiet Hotel this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent location, helpful, friendly staff made our stay memorable.”
Reviews.Author: YU58
Reviews.Content: The rooms, though small, offered all the amenities. The staff was cheerful and very friendly. For lovers of the Left Bank, the location is very convenient to all the fine restaurants and sights. This was our fist stay, but it will not be our last!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, perfect service, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexander14
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay of one week in this hotel very much. It is in a convenient location, close to several metro stations and walking distance to Saint Germaine de Pres, Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. The room was comfortable and quiet, the service was very friendly and helpful, giving recommendations and making reservations for restaurants, helping with whatever was needed. The breakfast room is cosy, with a little garden and perfect service. We think this hotel gives very good value for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Gbrain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The location is convenient to everything, the staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms attractive and comfortable, and the continental breakfast tasty. We will most certainly stay at the Garden de L'Odeon or try one of the chain's other hotels upon our return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a top location”
Reviews.Author: xaves99
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Jardin before and came back this trip for 7 nights because the hotel offers great deals when booked quite a way in advance. We paid around Euros100 for a Double which included an excellent breakfast. This hotel is in a fantastic location, between the Latin Quarter and St Germain on the Left Bank and is surrounded by quality restaurants and cafes. The Odeon Metro is a 5 min walk. Our room was quite small (we paid more last time and the room was larger) so if this matters then go for the Superior. However, we were happy to be a bit squashy and keep the Euros for eating out. Our window was able to be opened, we could lean out and look down a typical Parisian street. Lovely. The staff here are uniformly pleasant and as helpful as you'd want. They speak very good English so even for those of us who try to speak a little (very little!) French, its great not to have to communicate the complicated things in another language. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone other than those who really hate a small room, although as I point out, if you pay more the room will be larger.

Reviews.Title: “Totally delightful hotel in Paris that I would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: HessWalsh
Reviews.Content: This small Paris Hotel is located close to the Pantheon in a very quiet neighborhood. The rooms are clean, air-conditioned, and quite comfortable. The service by the staff is exceptional. They recommended great restaurants and answered all of our questions. We were only a few blocks from the Metro which made it easy to go wherever we wanted in the city. We were easy walking distance to Notre Dame, the Cluny Museum, as well as many shops and cafes. My husband and I would definitely stay there again when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A steal!”
Reviews.Author: belladolce
Reviews.Content: Fantastic find in the 6e, within walking distance of the major sights and the shops and restaurants of the St Germain area. After reading about the hotel in the Sawday's guidebook, I found a promotional rate on the hotel's Web site of just 125 EUR per night for a standard double -- a steal. The hotel itself is small and charming with rooms reasonably sized by Parisian standards and nicely decorated with a red or blue and yellow color scheme and prints of works by Picasso and Modigliano. Lovely French windows overlooked a quiet street and the Odeon Theatre. Taxi drivers don't seem to know the street or the hotel, but just ask them to take you to the theatre. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but it does have room service and a breakfast nook. It also offers Wi-Fi, though I didn't test it, and English-language television (the BBC). The cons: bathrooms are basic, the walls a bit thin, and the front desk short-staffed. The quality of breakfast left something to be desired, but if you're in a hurry, it'll do and at 10 EUR per person is reasonable. Just be sure to arrive early if you want a hard-boiled egg and fruit -- they seemed to go quickly. Other breakfast options -- the usual bread and pastries, cold cuts, yogurt and cheese. I'd gladly choose the Jardin de l'Odeon on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “with a little more effort, it would be great”
Reviews.Author: K-traveler13
Reviews.Content: The location and front desk service were excellent. Breakfasts were good. The size and condition of the second room we stayed in (we were moved after we complained about the size of the first room) were excellent. The hotel could have done a little better servicing the room--one new soap and no hand lotion in a week's stay. We would certainly recommend this hotel for its location, front desk service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: MissKey
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations--the Trip Advisor reviews are right on-target. My mother and I stayed here for four nights in May. The neighborhood is quiet and upscale, but it is central to the Metro, the tour bus stop, and lots of reasonably-priced restaurants and shops. We stayed in Room 32. It was small, but very modern and clean, as is the whole hotel. The room overlooked a cute little courtyard and fountain. The staff was very helpful and kind. We had breakfast there once. It was good, but kind of expensive at 12 euro each. There are nearby cafes that are cheaper. We ate at nearby Le'Mediterranean and La Cambuse. Both were good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but central”
Reviews.Author: bikehippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights on a sightseeing trip to Paris. The hotel is located on a quiet back street in a charming area of the city, within a few minutes walk of the Seine, Notre Dame, etc. The room was quite small for the price but for Paris I suppose that is normal. It was pleasant, clean and comfortable, the soundproofing was excellent, the wireless internet access was very good and the hotel staff were polite, friendly and spoke good English. We would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room with an outstanding hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: SilverFox0
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were most helpful, considerate and truly cared for our well being. The room was clean and most comfortable. The location of the hotel is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; bright, cozy room.”
Reviews.Author: Havana-O
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a weekend in Paris after a business trip. Hotel is in a perfect location, with easy walking access to the Luxembourg gardens and the famous cafes of St. Germain and Montparnasse. The room was small, as rooms usually are in Europe, but bright and cheerful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynBoston
Reviews.Content: After doing some searching on my own, I looked up hotel reviews on TripAdvisor and found this gem. It is such a treat to arrive at a hotel that you are so pleased with. The staff was always so helpful with tips on where to go or restaurants to eat at. Our room was very nice and having two twins worked out great for two gal pals. This is truly located in the best neighborhood for food and simply hanging out. We loved the walk back at night after dinner and fun. Definitely recommend it for friends, couples, etc. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “A compact, clean hotel with great service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: LondonSpaceman
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, the hotel is in the heart of the St Germain district with all it's bars and restaurants and a stones throw from the beautiful Jardin Du Luxembourg. The hotel is small but stylish and the service is personal. Our room was a immaculate and although on the road was extremely quiet (excellent double glazing). A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best accomodation in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mcika
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th visit to Paris and the best accomodation ever. I had a room No 52 prestige cllasic room - newly redecorated, beautiful bathroom, garden view, and extremly quite. We did not eat breakfast in hotel so I can not tell you anything about it. I manage to make a special rate reservation for unbelievable price of 20 € for the first nigh and 95 € for a second one. Fantastic rates, fantastic rooms (5th and 6th floor). Rooms are small but clean, very nice and practical. The only bad thing xas that out fantastic, new flat screen tv did not work and nobody had time to come to our room to check it. But that did not spoil our stay. Fantastic three star hotel (looked as at least 4 star one)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our weekend break”
Reviews.Author: mandi81
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Jardin de l'odeon recently. We were very impressed with the hotel. We booked a standard room and were upgraded to a prestige room. The room was small, but i beieve most rooms in Paris would be due to the lack of space. The room was nicely decorated in a contemporary yet french style. The plasma tv also had a keyboard for access to the free internet. We caught the metro everywhere, and it couldnt have been easier with the Odeon metro stop literally a two minute walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful, offering suggestions for restaurants and more sights. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sullytex
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for the weekend with our baby girl (6 months). We opted for the room with the balcony as we thought our particpation in the Paris nightlife might be a bit hampered with the little one! Well worth it as we spent both nights relaxing with bottle of wine and some food we purchased from a nearby mini-super overlooking the Odeon Theater. The room was comfy with a great in-room entertainment system. The cot that was provided for our girl was more than adequate. They even provided a sleeper. It was fairly warm in Paris that weekend and our A/C held its own. The staff were all friendly and spoke good English. All in all, very happy with our stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with an exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: BEACHBUMNashville
Reviews.Content: The Jardin was the location of our first stay in Paris. We could not have chosen a better place. The hotel is in a great location that is convenient to the Metro and local tourist sites. The Roland Garros tournament is a short Metro ride away. The rooms were clean and well decorated. The breakfast was outstanding. My strongest recommendation is the staff. They were friendly, helpful and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “The Best on the Rue”
Reviews.Author: Sucal
Reviews.Content: This is one of 3 hotels on a small stretch of Rue Casimir Delavigne. I have now stayed at them all and others elsewhere in this area. This is the best in my opinion - not the cheapest or the most expensive.The furnishings and cleanliness are to a good standard, the staff who spoke very good English the most helpful I have found in Paris and the breakfast buffet good value for 12 euros. The lift is a bit larger than normal and seemed in good condition - an asset - as sometimes the lifts in small Paris hotels scare me. Sometimes there isn't a lift so carrying your cases up the small staircases can be difficult. To anyone who wants to experience real Paris this St Germain area should tick all the boxes. Not too touristy, no large hotels, lots of good bars and restaurants used mainly by locals, plenty of small shops and a fantastic food indoor market and patisserie less than 5 minutes walk away. Both the Metro (Odeon) and buses stop within 5 minutes walk the other way. You can catch the RER from CDG airport or Gare du Nord straight to Luxemburg ( no changing) and then a short 5 minute walk takes you to the hotel. Also from Gare du Nord there is a bus that stops within 5 mins walk on Blvd St Michel. Sorry didn't note the number.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Fabers
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, top location : just a few minutes from Metro Odeon, direct in the Saint Germain area with all off its nice shops and restaurants. Good reception , nice staff, good service, good room , off course not a ballroom: you are in paris! Quiet street, double windows, no metro line under the hotel. Good luggage storage etc. Just book and enjoy this lovely city. Have a nice time in Paris ! Andrea and Eelco Faber, the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at Jardin de L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: marcnnet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another wonderful stay at Jardin de L'Odeon. I took my son for his 13th birthday and it was all we had hoped for and more. The hotel is in a perfect location, is charming, clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. This was my 6th trip to Paris and my second stay at Jardin de L'Odeon - I will absolutely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, charming, clean, and with friendly English-speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: Vero_PK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming, clean, and well decorated. We had room 45, facing the street. It was nice and quiet. The location is perfect, only a few blocks away from Odeon and Luxemburg metro stations (we used this last one for our airport transfer). The area is packed with little cafes, restaurants and shops. We ate one night at Le Pub St. Germain with friendly English speaking staff, food was good. The reception desk was extremely courteous and helpful and they spoke perfect English. Our breakfast was included and it was good with friendly staff. We highly recommend this hotel, particularly for its location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nechie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near the Jardin de Luxembourg. The front desk was extremely helpful with information. We paid for the breakfast and found the staff charming and the setting pleasurable. Our only complaint was that the room was small, although the bathroom was quite large. Overall, the hotel was an excellent choice for us as we spent a week walking around Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - No Value”
Reviews.Author: Constantin88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is good, close to the Odeon Metro, restaurants and cafes. I stayed on the 5th floor. I found the room to be tiny and very noisy. There was constant noise from other parts of the hotel. After I arrived I noticed that the tv was not working (a staff member had to fiddle with wiring at the back to make it work). I also found that the 'free' internet service (via the tv) was incredibly slow. Although I reserved a room with a mini-bar there was no mini-bar in the room. During my third day I arrived at the hotel during the early evening after a tiring day of sightseeing to find the bathtub was filled with dirty water and muck. I went to report this at the reception and was greeted by a friendly but disinterested staff member who said that she was all alone at the hotel and was not sure if the matter could be attended to that day. I mentioned to her that I was not happy to stay there if the tub was not cleaned. When I returned from dinner later that evening I found that the bathtub was clean. No apology or explanation, other than that there was a "plumbing problem", was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BaHaar
Reviews.Content: I can understand where the negative review of the Pittsburg poster is coming from. I believe people who stay in different rooms will have different experience .I stayed 9 nights from 27 April until 6th April in this hotel at a prestige room in 5th floor . I loved my room , the size was fine for 2 person however I was staying alone, there was a LCD tv and fast access to internet is provided through it as well. First day when I wanted to take a shower I discovered that there is a problem with shower hanger ( you can see that in the photo ) and it was not easy to take a shower . I spoke to the front desk and it appeared that it is not fixable during my stay and they offered and show me 3 different rooms which I did not like them . one was a super room in 3rd floor overlooking to court yard , very spacious but gloomy and not as bright as first room. Second room was smaller than my room and third room was great but I preferred to stay at street side and decided to stay in my room regardless of shower problem. The walls were thin and can hear through ,however I did not have problem until last 2 days which I had loud neighbors . I don’t know which noise is pervious poster is talking about ! I stayed in a street side room and I never ever heard or bothered by any noise from the street during day or night. The hotel is located in a very quiet street with almost zero traffic . I took the RER to Luxemburg station which was very convenient from and to CDG airport and drag my 20 KG suitcase but it was totally fine for me and it was not uphill way .if you want help from front desk you should avoid staff who are there at night . I figured out that very fast . Oliver and Stephani in morning and afternoon where 100% helpful and answered all my inquiries .BUT the guy who were in front desk at night was not even letting me to my room 2 times !! first time when I asked for my key he asked my name , checked his computer and said your name is not here and ignored me and kept talking to other person !! like the problem solved and I should move on !! I was like “ what ? what you mean my name is not here ?! give me my key” . he done it to me 3 days later again ! The location is prefect and I probably will stay in same area if I return to paris. I was comfortable in this hotel regardless of some inconvenience . for help look for Oliver and Stephani.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of tranquillity in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: ldx2
Reviews.Content: Because we booked well in advance, we got a superior room with terrace for the same as we would pay for a B&B in Ireland, so excellent value there. Polite staff, comfortable room, great shower, slept well every night, I have no complaints. Very central to the heart of the city. We would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've tried in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FrequentCoopFliers
Reviews.Content: Paris hotel rooms are generally dark, tiny and poorly equipped. Ours here wasn't bright and huge, but it was bigger than most, nicely appointed and in a quiet, perfect location. Breakfast included good croissants and other pastries, 2 excellent types of ham and American-style Tropicana juices (as opposed to the typical flavorless European canned or bottled ones). Excellent air conditioning, though having arrived during a cold spell, we had to ask for it to be turned on to cut the overheating--which was done immediately. Fast free wi-fi. Only thing missing was a decent reading light by the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place and people!”
Reviews.Author: LandJ15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon as part of our 15th anniversary trip. We loved it's quiet location in St. Germain and it's helpful, friendly staff. Our room was great and we could walk to all of the major attractions. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Maja9
Reviews.Content: Our Experience was very good. We paid more for a upgraded room with a patio and garden It was will worth the extra money. Our friends stayed in one of the less expensive rooms on 4 and it was horrible. Dark narrow hallway and very small noisy room. If we could not pay more for more, we would not have enjoyed our stay. However, that being said, it was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. I would stay there again with the same accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “"Not bad for what it is"”
Reviews.Author: ahfong63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights there , our room was located on the second floor facing the Odeon theater side which was fine for the first three nights , boy ! the four night was horrible , there were kids partying and screaming outside the theater till 4 AM in the morning ! I was unable to sleep at all before we have to catch a morning flight back to the United State . I would stay there again but, I will definitely request a room facing the court yard side .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good accomodation, good food, good service.”
Reviews.Author: BevBill
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel - well-located just off the main streets so it was generally quiet during our stay. We were upgraded to a top floor room with terrace - looked like it had just been decorated - we couldn't fault it. The staff in general were very obliging and very helpful. Breakfast was generally good - only slight niggle was one morning we had to wait a while to be seated as there was only one person on breakfast duty who couldn't keep up with both serving and clearing away. There was a small restaurant opposite - la Cambuse - which we used most nights - good basic food - and used by several "locals" so that must say something. We didn't think this hotel was particularly cheap - but then nothing is in Paris! All in all it was good value for money and we had a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: PondCrosser82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March of '07. EXCELLENT location. Easy walk to major sites and close to a train station. Great (and reasonably) priced restaurants around hotel. Clean room. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SophieMacaron
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Paris for easter and booked Jardin de L'Odeon some weeks before, thanks to the advices at TripAdvisor. We were very satisfied by the charming staff and nicely decorated rooms that are newly renovated. We walked alot and rarely used the metro thanks to the good location, l'Odeon, surrounded by lots of nice bars and restaurants. If you're going to Paris and looking for a nice fresh hotel for a good price, I highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaithiDathuil
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay. The hotel is in a great location, 2 minute walk to the Odeon metro stop. The rooms were quite nice, very clean and the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel does a continental breakfast for €12 which isn't bad value and was quite nice and there is also free wifi throughout the hotel which was great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Continue to Return”
Reviews.Author: ParisKat
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon. During all my stays, the hotel has consistently been very clean and the staff has been wonderful. The staff was very helpful with getting taxis and storing luggage. The location and price of this hotel are what makes this place great. The hotel is between the Odeon Theatre and the Carrefour d'Odeon. Nice, quiet street, yet still near lots of good restaurants, shopping and attractions. Yes, the rooms are small by American standards, but they are certainly fine if you're in Paris to spend time in the city, not in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for 'coming home' in Paris........”
Reviews.Author: SJB_Berks
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days and 3 nights here over Valentines weekend. Perfectly placed to get around Paris either by Metro or bus, this little hotel is ideal for a short break. Its a short 5-10 min suitcase drag from the Metro (depending if you know where you are going!). The rooms are very clean and adequately furnished. We had Room 1, a superior room with a small terrace with table and chairs. The room was still small, but enough storage space, a fab hot & powerful shower and more importantly NO sound from any other room or the streets!! We had the mini bar/fridge and heating worked well. Breakfast was included in our price, but next time I would probably eat out - just to soak up more little cafes!! All the staff were in good spirits and happy to help, either by directing us to the required bus stops and telling us the number bus we needed for our destination, or ordering cabs for us - which turned up on time all the time! Around the hotel they were courteous and charming. It was easy to get to each 'touristy' destination from where we were. Notre Dame is a short walk, and oodles of good restaurants and cafes nearby - Les Deux Magots and Cafe de Flore being the obvious 'famous' choices. Jardin de Luxembourg is on your doorstep, but the 'big' sites are never more than 10 mins bus or metro away - and Paris public transport is all very cheap and easy to use. You could still walk to the Louvre if one wished. Our cab to the Moulin Rouge was only about £20. We were in central Paris, but it was still relaxed and not too busy a district. Would definately use this hotel again. SJB & SNT

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous_IrishMan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean and well-maintained hotel not far from many of the tourist attractions in Paris. It is very close to the Odeon metro stop so it is easy to get around the city, which is quite large. It is close to the Pantheon and the Luxembourg gardens and the other sights are just a metro stop or two away. A taxi from Moulin Rouge to here cost just €10. As for the hotel itself, our only complaint was the noise from 8.45am on the morning we left. There was banging and scraping on the floor above that made it very hard to sleep, which was disappointing as we had a busy day of travelling ahead of us. Apart from that, our room was clean and well maintained, the staff were friendly and helpful and I would definitely consider this hotel if we go back again. We didn't have the breakfast so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: mzdee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in room 41 for Valentines Day and would recommend it. The area is very quiet, upmarket residential but a short stroll (5mins past the church of St. Sulpice) away from St.Germain and it's bustling cafes and bars not to mention very exclusive shops (Yves St Laurent on Bonaparte St plus delicious heart shaped macaroons at Pierre Herme on the same street, there was a queue of very well dressed Parisians outside the shop buying for their loved ones on the 14th). Our friends stayed at the Crystal Hotel on St Benoit street (St Germain) which was right next door to les deux magots and paid a similar price to us but we think we had the better deal as even though our rooms were smaller the finish was better (just). We reached the hotel very easily from the Luxembourg RER train stop direct from the airport (£8 one way). We didn't bother with a travel pass as so much of what we wanted to see was in easy walking distance from the hotel, notre dame, pompidou, louvre, museum d'orsee, st germain etc. Got a pass for the boat bus down to the Eiffel tower and hopped on a metro to montmartre and the sacre coeur. Had a great time, hotel staff were friendly and helpful, rooms spotlessly clean, shower power was good and we had no problem with neighbouring room noise. Didn't have the breakfast which was 12EURO instead ate breakfast at the little eateries in St. Germain. Had a lovely time and would stay at the jardin again, book through the hotel site directly we paid approx 250E for 2 nights, room 47 is the room to ask for though, it is much bigger than ours was and has a lovely terrace which would be great in the Summer.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Springbreak at Jardin de L'Odeon.”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_flag
Reviews.Content: We chose the 3 star "Jardin de L'Odeon" in the excellent location of St Germain des Prés, for a 3 night stay in Paris, to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We got a great deal on booking.com! We found the hotel very easily as it was only a 10 minute walk from the metro stops of "Odéon" and " Luxembourg". If coming from the airport , it is advisable to get the RER to Luxembourg as the train is direct and you don't end up having to negotiate your way through the maze at St.Michel to change line! The hotel was delightful, with a welcoming, cozy lobby. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room (number 35) whilst very small ,was tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean.As temperatures plummeted in Paris , with us having snow during our stay ,our room was a welcome respite from the cold :-) The bathroom was spotlessly clean, however I did note the handrail on the bath was loose and does require some attention! My husband was in his element with the mini-bar which was replenished everyday (we normally self-cater) . It was most welcome after a day pounding the pavements of Paris! The only thing missing was "Draught Guinness" :-) Upon checking out, we discovered that a well-known Irish celebrity, was also staying there that weekend, so we obviously share the same good taste ;-) All in all an excellent small hotel, in a brilliant location. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACW_Oslo
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at this hotel and I really appreciated the location near the Luxembourg garden and the Latin quarter. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast was good and the staff were also very helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - the finest city in the world!”
Reviews.Author: KarenMillthorpe
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this small, delightful hotel. We are very well travelled people and visit Paris at least once a year and this is the only Parisian hotel which we have returned to! The rooms are immaculately clean with modern decor and the breakfast room provides a good selection of food and beverages for breakfast with courteous service from the waiting-on staff. Reception staff were only too pleased to be of assistance too. We stayed in a superior room on our first visit and a standard room on our most recent visit. Both were of equal cleanliness and decor although, naturally, the superior room was somewhat more spacious. The hotel is located in an excellent position only 5 minutes walk from Odeon metro station and a stroll along Boulevard St Germain takes you to Notre Dame or Place de la Concorde in the opposite direction.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Christmas Stay”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlCH
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and wasn't disappointed. It's a really nice little hotel, on a quiet street, and our rooms were at the back of the hotel so absolutely quiet. It's in walking distance from the river and Notre Dame, etc. The staff were all friendly and helpful (in both French and English), both at reception and at breakfast. I was travelling with my mother - she had a double room and I had a single. The single room is VERY small (predictably perhaps) but the double room was lovely. Next time I would spend a little bit more and get a double room, even travelling alone. We were staying in the hotel over Christmas (and had a Christmas rate for the rooms), visiting family in Paris, and there was a pleasantly festive atmosphere in the hotel. For a really good (if relatively pricey) meal, try the fish restaurant La Méditerranée just round the corner from the hotel in Place de l'Odéon.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Heart of the Paris”
Reviews.Author: CanucksInTrucks
Reviews.Content: We liked the Tripadvisor reviews and the convenient location, and since it was a special occasion we decided to spring a few extra euros to book a 'superior' room. When we arrived we were delighted to find that they had upgraded us to their 'deluxe room with a terrace' (room 47)! It was so enjoyable to sightsee Paris from this wonderful home base. The desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful and all speak English well. The hotel, while small, is very well appointed and maintained. All sorts of cafes, restaurants, shops, etc. nearby, and a couple of short blocks to St. Germain and the Odeon Metro stop. If you don't mind rolling your suitcase several blocks you can take the RER B directly from CDG Airport to the Luxembourg stop. We also stayed at another hotel run by this corporate ownership on an earlier visit, the Hotel Des Grands Hommes near Le Pantheon, and had a similar positive experience. And it's only couple of short blocks to a Starbucks if you're like my wife and need that North American caffeine fix in the morning (not everyone likes how the Euros do coffee!)

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: littlemissaoife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. It is reasonably priced and in a very good location near both an RER B stop (Luxembourg) and metro (Odeon). It is clean and the staff are polite and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable. The maintenance work at 10am on the morning of the 31st was very irritating but the complementary small bottle of Champagne left in our room to celebrate the new year was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Paul_W_7
Reviews.Content: Whilst in many ways this is a typical Parisien hotel - the rooms are not massive or ultra luxurious, there are plenty of things that set the Jardin de L'Odeon apart from the crowd. The reception staff are all very helpful, pleasant and knowledgable; the breakfast is generous and varied; the area around the hotel is calm and, for a city centre hotel, very peaceful. The hotel is also ideally located for visiting central and southern sights on foot - even with a 3 yr old we were able to walk to places such as the Louvre, Notre-Dame, the Pantheon and even Les Invalides. Overall I would highly recommend the Jardin, it is a cut above the norm for a mid-range Parisien hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MichellesTravels
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon for one week in December and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself is very charming. Our room was on the smallish side (which is not unusual in Paris I think), but it was still very comfortable for two people. It was also clean, warm and beautifully decorated. The location of the hotel is fantastic, with plenty of restaurants and shops very close by. It was also very easy to walk to many of the touristy sites such as Notre Dame and the Louvre. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a reasonably priced, good quality place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Aussies In Paris”
Reviews.Author: SnappaOz
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a wonderful stay. The 3-star hotel is in a great location in the quiet part of the city with very good access to cafes, restaurants, the Metro and the Luxemburg Garden. The hotel is clean and very well presented with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are small but cleaned daily. The breakfast included offers a good array of food, although a wide selection of fresh fruit each morning would be good. Other thoughts to improve: install an exhaust fan and wider shower screen in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Br00klynm0m
Reviews.Content: The staff was always friendly. The rooms were clean, quiet, and attractive, but a bit small (fine for one, but too small for many couples). Although steps from St. Germain and an easy walk to the Louvre, we found the street quiet. Great black-out blinds. Good tub in one of our rooms, but the shower in the other was tight. Loved the breakfast buffet included with our very good Christmas rate. Forget Expedia. You'll do better in Paris to deal with the hotels directly for the best rates, especially in the off season. The economy is hurting and hoteliers are negotiable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a reasonably priced hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: maclondonuk
Reviews.Content: Great stay at a reasonably priced hotel in Paris - which is rare. Rooms are small but fine for a short stay and are quiet. Location is great - in the middle of sophisticated Left Bank and easy to travel to other parts of Paris or just stroll around and have cups of coffee! Would stay again MAC

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Worst Bed”
Reviews.Author: birdette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Europe and when part of our trip was spent in Paris, so we stayed at this hotel for a total of four nights. The Best thing about this hotel is the location, whether you are in Paris for the first time or the tenth, I’m sure you will appreciate the location of this hotel. The hotel staff were very nice and the breakfast was lovely, good coffee, cold cuts, breads, juice, cereal, and we enjoyed it. The hotel and room was also clean. Our room had a lovely balcony but we never really used it because it was raining most of the time, but I can imagine it would be lovely in spring or summer. Now let’s move on to what bothered us during our stay at the hotel. We stayed in room 38 and hated the room layout, there was enough space for our luggage and a small table and chair but the tiny bathroom was literally one tiny step away from the bed, so if you sat on the bed your feet would literally be in the bathroom. The shower was ok but again compared to the closet space, the bathroom was way too small and way too close to the pillow…not pleasant at all, ever for Paris Hotel standards. The other problem was the TV, considering how much these hotels charge about 150 Euro a night and the low price of flat screen TV, they can easily afford to put a proper tv in the rooms. Our tiny TV could hardly be heard because the hotel has put a volume limit on the TV (since the rooms are so close to each other) and because of this you can hardly hear the only two English Channels available (CNN + BBC). My other problem was the mattress and the bed which was not comfortable at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: djkr
Reviews.Content: Nice room if a little on the small side, obviously very recently refurbished. Very quiet location but convenient for metro & all the sights, helpful staff. Nice restaurant literally across the road (La Cambuse). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jardin de l'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Namiko_Mika
Reviews.Content: HI! I found this hotel (for my parent's holiday in july) on the internet, using also tripadvisor.com. It is a little expensive but you might find a special offer on the hotel site. 120euro for a double room including breakfast is not expensive for Paris, if the hotel is good and the location is central. It is really a 3* hotel, breakfast is enough, the location of the hotel is very good, around 7-10 minutes to the heart of Paris. It is near metro station. Advice: to get to the hotel search for Casimir Delavigne Street on google maps because the map on the hotel site is not accurate. Follow the advice you find on their site, the direction to go when at the metro and when you exit. The staff were very friendly. The only problem is that when you make a reservation, even online, they ask for a down payment for half the stay. Maybe this is a rule, or it is just because we are from Romania, but I don't think this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60Appletree60
Reviews.Content: A trip with Railbookers was a birthday present from my husband and I chose to take Eurostar to Paris. I selected this hotel having read reviews on this site and it lived up to expectations. It is in a quiet street in the 6th and close to Odeon metro giving easy access to the whole of Paris. It is also within walking distance of many cafes, restaurants, the river, Luxembourg gardens and of course many of the major tourist sites such as Notre Dame. There are lots of Japanese restaurants close by if this is of interest to some readers. The welcome was warm - as were the rooms! Our room was small, but if you are out and about all day as we were, this is not a problem. It was very clean, well furnished and bright. The bathroom was modern and, unusually for France, had an excellent shower over the bath. With the current weakness of the pound sterling buffet breakfast seemed expensive at 12 Euros, but it was a perfectly acceptable spread of breads, cheese, meats and fruit and was served in a small and pleasant room on the ground floor. Paris is infested with beggars and scam merchants at the tourist sites and in the metro - much worse than London - but the area around the hotel is quiet and calm. Overall very pleasant and to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rileyhaha
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the recommendation of a travel agent but booked direc through their website. The location of the hotel was perfect, we arrived at Gare du Nord on Eurostar and had a 15 minute direct trip on the Metro. A lovely quiet street but very close to most of the places we wanted to go. The hotel was lovely and very comfortable. The ONLY thing that was a slight minus was that the room got very hot in the night and the air conditioning didn't work as it was november. Despite this though, we would probably look to stay here again on our next trip due to the location and lvoely room. Thanks very much for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Le Jardin”
Reviews.Author: NorthernWanderer0
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in late October 2008, based on location and previous reviews. We had a superior room (28) which overlooked the small garden (jardin) and was large by Paris standards, very quiet, and comfortable. Well heated, but we could open the window as necessary as there was no noise apart from small birds in the morning. Room was well maintained. Bathroom small but had all we needed, separate WC. Staff were really good and helpful. Location is good - on the left bank, close to metro, plenty of cafes,bars and restaurants nearby but no noise effecting the hotel. Has an elevator and lounge area. Can have breakfast, but we went to nearby cafes. Has a luggage storage room if required. Has 1 Mac computer in lobby, but is expensive (17 euro per hour) so use your own on WiFi. I would recommend Le Jardin and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Den11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the wife in mid September. After researching Paris accomodation, we settled on the Jardin de L'Odeon for numerous reasons. First and foremost and based on prior reviews here on Tripadvisor, were the wonderful staff. We mainly dealt with the Corsican gent and Laotian lady (apologies for not remembering names) and they were always very helpful and pleasant. The reception was staffed 24 hours a day, so when we had to call for a taxi really early one morning it wasn't a problem. Similarly on the day we were leaving Paris, the staff advised us of a public transport strike affecting the RER line to CDG airport and they made arrangements for a van to take us to the airport. This thoughtfulness was certainly appreciated. Secondly was the location. The hotel is in a very small and quiet backstreet so there is little street or crowd noise to bother you at night. The St Germain area is full of interesting shops, restaurants, bars, cafes etc. Do go to the nearby Gerard Mulot Patisserie, we were in sweet heaven! Main tourist attractions such as the Louvre and Notre Damme were within 15 min walking distance of the hotel. To go further afield the nearby Odeon metro station was very conveniant. Just make sure you buy a sturdy and detailed street map because you will need to orient yourself if walking around Paris a lot. The room at the hotel was quite spacious, nicely decorated and had a sizable bathroom. The price was quite reasonable as well. Breakfast was 12 Euro a person but it was all you could eat. We did eat breakfast there a few times and the selection as well as the coffee was good. There is also a cozy little restaurant called "Cambuse" almost directly opposite the hotel run by a kindly middle aged gent. We tried it out one night when too tired to go further afield and the food was traditional, delicious and well priced. It is no surprise that the Jardin de L'Odeon has so much going for it. Highly recommend it and thanks again to the staff for making our stay in Paris so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: clancyaustin
Reviews.Content: great little place. near enough to breakfast in Luxembourg gardens. The rooms were big enough, everything was fairly new and very clean, great concierge - helped us with reservations and travel to the airport. the pictures online were pretty accurate. The breakfast at the hotel was not great, and the hotel was not quite in the cutest/busiest area, but I liked that - it was quiet at night, and there were still a handful of restaurants and cafes within a one block radius. It was only a 5 minute walk to what we thought were the best areas - Rue de Buci and the area near notre dame on the left bank - I can't remember the street name.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleWings
Reviews.Content: The trip was great and the hotel was a fantastic! It's in a great location off a quiet street. While the rooms are small, they are very clean and have a 'fresh and new' feel about them. We travelled with a party of three and the first night we split between a single room and a double room. Both were nice and quiet (didn't matter if you were street-side as the hotel is off a very quiet side street). The next three nights we shared a triple (it was actually split across two floors (with an upper loft). All three rooms were very solid. In addition, the staff speaks perfect english and was very helpful. They also helped be make dinner reservations. The hotel is located near the Luxenbourg RER B stop for those taking the train from CDG. It is also located only a few blocks from the St. Michel and Odean metro stops. If you chose to stay here, I'm sure you'll enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “A Tranquil Place Amidst the Bustle of Paris' 6th Arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: ljwalsh
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon for our honeymoon. Though this was our third trip to the city, it was the first time that we had stayed in this particular neighborhood. We were not disappointed. The neighborhood itself, which encompasses the fairytale-like Luxembourg Gardens, is full of wonderful places to eat, stroll, shop and people-watch. Though the area bustles, the Jardin de l'Odeon is situated on a quiet side street--the best of both worlds. As for our room, it was comfortably sized (hard to come by in Europe), nicely appointed and featured our own private terrace with table and chairs. Of course not all the rooms had the latter; however, it might be worth asking if you decide to book here. The only drawback was that the bed was a bit hard, though no worse than other Paris hotels at which I've stayed. The service staff at the hotel was exceptional. Our room was nicely tidied each day by the housekeeping staff and the personnel at the front desk were always very polite and helpful. They even went the extra mile to loan us an adapter, a corkscrew and a couple wine glasses for the duration of our stay. Overall, staying at the Jardin de l'Odeon was a very positive experience for us, and we would most definitely consider staying here again.
