As a side note, if you are in the neighborhood, be sure to check out Le Comptoir--just a few blocks away--for dinner on the weekend (you'll need a reservation during the week when they do a full gastronomic tasting menu). We ate here twice because it was so tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JHMH1
Reviews.Content: We were very, very pleased with our stay at the Jardin de l'Odeon. The location was fantastic and very centrally located to many of the sights we wanted to see in Paris. The hotel is just a few minutes walk to several metro stops/RER lines and the Jardin du Luxembourg. You can also easily walk to Notre Dame and the Louvre. The hotel was very clean, very comfortable and our room was a very nice size. We booked a deluxe room with a terrace - which had a view of the Odeon Theatre. It was quite lovely. The staff was friendly and very helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: neitzjl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of August and had a great stay. The front desk stay was friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice. The hotel has a fantastic location in St. Germain close to many cafes and the metro. Also it is easy walking distance to many of the tourist sites. The only negative is that the hotel is on a small street which is not on many of the maps and was pretty challenging to find the first few times. FYI - easiest way to find it is to go to the Odeon theatre. The positive was that we slept with our french doors open and it was very quiet still. We had the base room and felt the room size was adequate. We booked ahead of time on the hotel website and got a great summer rate -99E.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: PennyLaneSussex
Reviews.Content: As my travel plans changed at short notice and many business hotels were full due to a trade fair, I was booked into this hotel for one night. I arrived at the hotel after midnight but received a very friendly welcome from the staff on duty and was swiftly checked in and up to my room. As other reviewers have remarked the room was only average size but the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was spotlessly clean and there were tea/coffee making facilities which I made the use of. The mini bar was very reasonably priced. The breakfast was 12 Euros for a continental buffet, there was not hot food, i.e. scrambled eggs etc. However, the choices of cheeses and cold meats, yoghurts, fruits etc. were more than adequate for me. The one down point of the stay was that the receptionist was unable to order a taxi for me in the morning. She kept ringing a number of different taxi companies, but none were available. In the end I had to take a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro station, where I was able to get a taxi which was waiting on the rank. The hotel is well situated, it is next to the Odion Theatre, and there are many bars and restaurants in close proximity. It would be a good choice for a short weekend break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: checoni
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay very much. All the staff was very helpfull and kind. The hotel is very well located and is very easy to move around. The surroundings are incredible with a lot of options to eat and shop. The hotel is located at a very quiet street and the rooms are extremely clean. The room size is average, as all other hotels in Paris. Breakfast is a little expensive but is really great. We certainly will come back and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: anglophile_7
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice - a value for money hotel with comfort. It was definitely a 3 star and we had a good rate from the hotel's internet site. The rooms were a good size (for Paris) and the beds were fine. I thought it was nice and quiet and we did have a room overlooking the street. We preferred to breakfast outside at a cafe and there are plenty around. Rue de buci (10 min walk) has plenty of restaurants to choose from for dinner. In the evening this area has lots of life, street performers etc which was quite fun. Watch out for cafes and bars on rue St Germain very expensive! walk 2 mins off the main drag and better value and still lots of Paris to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Suburbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got back from a 4 night stay at Jardin de L’Odeon. We booked it based on all the favourable TA reviews and the reasonable price and were not disappointed at all! As noted, the rooms are small but very comfortable and the location is amazing. It’s on a small quiet street but minutes to a huge selection of restaurants and cafes, very close to the sights along the Seine as well as RER and Metro stations. It made it very convenient to stop at the hotel mid-way through our days for a rest or change of clothes. The rooms had a mini bar fridge which we stocked with snacks and drinks from a nearby Monoprix (grocery / dept store), allowing us to skip the 12 euro breakfast. The bathrooms are very clean and look recently renovated, and much to my surprise, the hairdryers were actually pretty good and I didn’t end up using the one I’d brought from home. We took a taxi to the hotel from CDG, but given its proximity to the RER B line, I wish we’d taken the RER instead. I would warn anyone who does this, however, to get very detailed walking directions from the hotel as even though it’s close by it could be difficult to find. The service is very good and everyone at the front desk is very helpful and pleasant. They ask you to leave your key at the front desk each time you leave the hotel, which I’ve never experienced before but wasn’t a problem. The only potential downside to the hotel is that in general it is very small and the layout is fairly compact so you can hear noise in other rooms and the hallways. If you are a light sleeper it may not be the place for you, but we were so exhausted each night from all our walking that it wasn’t a problem!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Bay Area, CA but now living in the
Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more”
Reviews.Author: AandN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated near St. Germain des Pres and St. Michel, to take advantage of the sights and restaurants. But, it is tucked away on a quiet street away from the hubbub. Favorite aspect: great recommendations for restaurants from the staff. Showers have good water pressure, linens were crisp, hairdryer in bathroom, free wireless (if you have your own computer), safe and minibar in room, breakfast for 12 extra euros (typical croissants, cold cuts, cheese, coffee,etc.), evening-2AM room service, elevator, inviting lobby with a fee-based computer for those without computers with them, easy access from CDG airport via RER (if you don't have too much luggage). The rooms were small (but underbed storage and a small closet helped), double beds are sometimes two twins pushed together. If you stay a while & while the weather is decent, try to upgrade to a terraced room--it was great to be able to sit and enjoy a coffee or glass of wine there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, some problems”
Reviews.Author: bluegoldhighlander
Reviews.Content: We were booked in this hotel as part of a group cycling around France. Check in was friendly and efficient, we were shown into our room with no delays or fuss. Our room was quite spacious, well decorated with nice windows and plenty of light. The bathroom was Ok, other than the fact that it leaked water. It took a bit of to-ing and fro-ing to get it fixed, I'm not sure why the housekeeping staff never seemed to notice the pools of water on the floor. The location was very good, close to Odeon Metro, Luxembourg Gardens and St. Germaine. Restaurants for dinner were only a step away, and we really enjoyed browsing the area's art galleries and antique shops. There was a bit of street noise if your room fronts onto the street, but not too bad. Breakfast buffet was adequate, what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. On check out we did have a bit of difficulty when we tried to cancel our booking for the following weekend and get a refund. Even though this was for the Rugby World Cup final weekend and the town would be bursting with fans from the UK (re-letting the room would have been a snap), the staff would not budge. We found the lack of flexibiltiy and helpfulness a bit off-putting. All in all I would consider this hotel again, but then there are a lot of other choices in the City of Light.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, stay marred on last morning”
Reviews.Author: Carrie105
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a lovely, well located little hotel. It is a 2-5 min stroll to the Odeon metro, and also well located for the lovely cafe rich districts of St Germain Des Pres and the Latin Quarter. No need to walk more than 10 mins for your evening meal. Our room was plenty big enough and well decorated, and looked out onto a pleasant courtyard with a relaxing water feature. The breakfast I felt was a little pricey at €12 a head as there are many hotels around the area that offer the same for €8, which I think is more fair. Not a problem, however, as there are plenty of little cafes that serve breakfast near the Odeon metro. One problem we did have that left a bit of a cloud over our stay was our last morning. We left the hotel to go out for breakfast at about 9am, we returned at 10:15am to pack our bags and check out, (check out is 12pm). However, when we got back the maid had cleaned our room for the next guest and piled all our belongings in the corner. We were a bit shocked that they had done this before we checked out, it wasnt as if we were cutting it close to the check out deadline, we were back an hour and 45 minutes early. This would not have been the end of the world apart from the fact that the maid had taken it upon herself to throw some of our belongings away. Whilst we were packing we kept noticing things missing. First our toothbrushes, and a 3/4 full tube of toothpaste, then some plastic champagne glasses that we had bought for picnics. Not flimsy ones, but proper dishwashable picnic glasses, some of which were still in the wrapper, we left them next to the TV, and a few other assorted items. When my partner went to enquire after them it all seemed like too much bother for the maids, and they gave him the bin liner that they had thrown our stuff away in and we had to rummage through it and retreave our stuff!!!! Obviously this meant accepting the loss of our toothbrushes etc after they had been in the bin! This spoilt our last morning in Paris a bit as i was a little upset about the whole experience. I have never stayed in a hotel where they have prepared the room for the next guest and dumped your stuff in the corner (and thrown some away)! before you check out, and as I had said we were not running late. This problem would stop me staying here again in the future. Or recommending the property more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Pareee”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaZimmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 12yr old daughter. Superb location ideal for cafes,restaurants,river, sightseeing. 10-15 min gentle stroll from St Germain,St michel, Notre Dame, Sorbonne etc Quite spacious room, seperate bedrrom for our daughter.Ultra comfortable bed. Hotel very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Perfect 4 night stay - will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping tips!”
Reviews.Author: jubesOxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with two teenagers for a 4 night break and had a great time. The hotel was very clean and well kept and the staff always polite, friendly and helpful. When I asked for advice on where to shop for my teenage daughter I got excellent suggestions on where to go - not just a pat list of the designer shops - but realistic advice on where to find affordable appropriate clothes. As a result we ended up with a good shopping trip (and lots of clothes!) to complement the cultural aspect of the trip. The hotel is very convenient for the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: erneste
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed just for a couple of nights but we had a great time. All the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. The room wasnt big but it was clean and nice and airy when we opened the big windows overlooking the courtyard. The area was nice and quiet for when we got back from evenings out so sleep wasnt disturbed yet the hotel is ony 5 minutes walk from the many bars and restaurants in the area. All in all we had a lovely few days and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A bijou of a room”
Reviews.Author: EssexJackie
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant, clean, comfortable hotel. I would say it is good value for money since it is in Paris. Ideally located if you want to be near enough to the sights but far enough to have a little peace and tranquility. The Luxembourg gardens nearby are a haven and the area is generally not too noisy. Rooms bijou and decor has been given some 'designer' treatment. Room on 1st floor, at front, adjacent to hotel sign. Little distracting at night even though the curtains were heavy - illuminated the bathroom without any light at night. Would be better if this were turned off at the witching hour rather than 5am in the morning just as day is breaking and it may have not helped you in getting some shut-eye. Staff helpful and friendly. Generally v good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: AD27LD
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, in the very central St. Germain area. A few comments have said the rooms are small, although there is so much to do around the area it really doesn’t seem important! They are very comfortable, clean, quiet and there was plenty of space for two large suitcases. The staff were great and always more than happy to help. Skip the 12 euro breakfast, you are better off walking to one of the cafes nearby to start the day. Make sure you visit Gerard Mulot (Rue de Seine) for a pastry, Bis Morgen (Rue des Quatre Vents) for a one-off handbag and Peres et Filles (Rue de Seine) for a tasty meal. Explore the shops in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, tonnes of small eclectic shops with the kind of finds everyone wants to take home from their European holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: nyknicks
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the other reviews and was so glad they were so accurate! After staying there, I completely agree with all the reviews. (1) Location of this hotel is amazing. This was the first time for both my boyfriend and I to visit Paris. The location of this hotel made it so easy to navigate to all the sites that we wanted to see. It was very close to both a RER and Metro station. (2) While the room is small, the bathroom was of a very good size. This made the fact that the room was small less noticeable. The room itself was quite comfortable. Free wifi in the room was a surprise bonus. (3) Cleanliness and maintenance was not an issue. Whenever we came back to our rooms, everything was in great condition. The staff did a great job (4) The front desk reception was very friendly and spoke very good English. They helped us with whatever our needs were. Overall I very much enjoyed my stay here. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again on my next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but terrific otherwisw”
Reviews.Author: Baaam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel de l'Odeon in July for 4 days. Location is great, about 5 min walking distance from a metro (Odeon) and RER B (Luxemberg). The hotel was kind enough to upgrade us from a double to a superior, which although the room was still small (we were in it mostly only to sleep), came with an amazingly large private balcony. Even with the curtains from the french doors open, no one could see into our room, and we had a great view of the small interior garden. Our balcony had lovely grapevines, and other greenery with a small wrought iron table with two chairs. Great for some wine in the evening. The only complaint we had was the size of the showers. My husband is 6'2" and 240 lbs (Obviously not European:-)), and he had a very hard time managing with the tiny, tiny shower stall (About half the size of a normal hotel shower stall w/out tub in the US). They make the most of a very tiny space. On a positive note, the water pressure was GREAT! and there was plenty of hot water. The rooms were very clean, and I have to compliment the cleaning staff, because they did a fantastic job, every day. When we got back, our room would look like it did when we first checked in. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: miserygutz
Reviews.Content: Jardin de L'Odeon is in a wonderful location for tourists visiting Paris, being in the heart of the left bank scene & adjacent to both a Metro & an RER station. Our superior double room was compact but beautifully presented & had that seldom seen luxury of quiet, controllable & efficient air conditioning. No exterior noise made for restful sleep. Staff were courteous & spoke excellent English. We will gladly stay on our next visit to Paris & are grateful to Tripadvisor for putting us on to this property

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tedddies
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel very near the Odeon theatre in St. Germain and a short walk from delightful Luxembourg Gardens. The room (Room 11) was very clean, well decorated and quiet - overlooking the lovely garden courtyard at the back. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A smashing place to stay and a good base to explore Paris. It was so nice we will stay there again. BF, Teddington, England

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Odeon area”
Reviews.Author: Bobothehobo
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, my last trips to Paris were solo trips so I tried a few different hotels as I was more mobile. This trip I was with my girlfriend (who became my fiancee on this trip) and both of us loved this hotel. The hotel is in a great location, and the rooms are very quiet at night. The rooms are small of course, but easily enough room for the two of us, and the key was the bathroom. An actual bathroom, not a converted closet like you find in many small rooms in Paris hotels. Staff was friendly and helpful as well. We tried a different hotel closer to the river, which was more expensive and looked nice online, but it did not compare. No more hotel testing for me, next time I'll stay in place at Jardin de L'Odeon.

Reviews.Title: “a great little place!”
Reviews.Author: roger321
Reviews.Content: The Jardin de L'Odeon is a great little hotel in a really fantastic location in Paris. Tucked away in a quiet side-street but still only stone's throw from many major landmarks it was the perfect base for us during our long weekend break. Being situated in between St. Germain and the Quartier Latin provided the best of both worlds for eating and drinking, with both fine dining and the more budget bistro food available in abundance - all within walking distance of the hotel. There's also great shoppjng nearby too. The hotel itself was extremely well presented - clean and well-furnished and the staff were very polite and friendly. Our standard double room was quite small, but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was of a good standard too. If I HAD to raise any fault with our stay it would be that the walls were quite thin and consequently noise from the corridor and adjacent rooms (ie bath/taps running) was at times a disturbance. I expect, however, that this would be much the same for any hotel situated in a similarly old building. All in all we had a great time, were very well looked after, and will definitely be staying there again. Thank you to everyone at Le Jardin de L'Odeon!

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: bogart08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon in Paris for one week for an anniversary celebration. Starting with our original phone call to the reception staff, the staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. The rooms were charmingly decorated and furnished and spotlessly maintained. The location near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Odeon Theater is very appealing. Quiet street...no noise. Pleasant courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Weekend-holidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (Fri. 23rd May) but thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was quite spacious for Paris and cost €160 per night. The décor was fresh and comfortable. The room had air-conditioning. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate – apart from the fact that the shower holder was broken. A good range of quality toiletries was provided. We had a fab side-ways view of the Theatre de l’Odeon. The street was very quiet, but just minutes from a vibrant area with many lovely restaurants and cafes. The metro (Odeon) was 5mins away. We had breakfast, at €12 per person, with a good selection of bread, pastries, cold meats & cheeses, fruit and yogurt. The breakfast room staff, in particular, were very, very pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel and will return to it next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Je t'aime Jardin”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Jardin de l'Odeon. Great location and very comfortable hotel. Small room and tiny bathroom but lucked out with a nice terrace (room #38). Worked perfectly for our 20th anniversary and first visit to Paris. Clean, quiet, smoke free, and good service. Tasty breakfast that was included in our room when we booked through Travelocity (175 euros/night). We wandered and ate throughout the city but our best meal was at a seafood restaurant around the corner Le Mediterrane'. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “breakfast charges should be spell out clearly”
Reviews.Author: faithfu7
Reviews.Content: Just came back from paris, the stuff at the hotel side was helpful, they are quite handsome too =) i forgot the guy that recommended me some restaurant, just want to say a big thank you. You were very helpful. The rooms are clean, and knowing that paris rooms tend to be on the smaller side, we had no complaints. However what made us furious was that we had to pay for breakfast. Ok it was our fault that we did not check properly. I went to europe for 15 days and out of all the hotels, we had breakfast that we did not have to pay. So of course, as it was not spelled out clearly, we went for breakfast which was normal bread, ham.. and stuff and realise we had to pay 12 euro each ! that turn out to be 72 euro for 3 days. Come on i can easily go out and have a great breakfast and still not have to pay 24 euro. Sorry i am just puzzled how things work. The manager tried to waive off half so i have to say thanks for trying but i hope the hotel can provide free breakfast, i dont even mind them adding in the package.. everytime i think about that, i still feel sored. ...

Reviews.Title: “Jardin de L'Odeon was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: novicetraveler88
Reviews.Content: My 6 night stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon was really outstanding! The room was beautiful, comfortable and well appointed and the service by all of the staff was exemplary. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Latin Quarter (the location is fantastic and if you are a tourist, this is by far the best if you want to see the main Paris attractions).

Reviews.Title: “Jardin L'Odeon - a gem”
Reviews.Author: AuroraOnt
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Great little hotel, friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are small, but nice (no smaller than anything you would find in a boutique hotel in downtown Manhattan). The shower is a bit of an issue - hard not to get water everywhere, but this is the same of most European hotels. We stayed 3 great nights and would definitely go back. We opted to not get the breakfast and find different cafes to grab something in each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service staff, but one problem”
Reviews.Author: SG_Travelbugs
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 nights in Jardin de L'Odeon hotel. I must say the service level of the hotel staff is excellent. They were very polite, attentive and went out of the way to help us wherever possible. I would have given "Excellent" rating except that the air-conditioning was not working well. This last week in Paris was very sunny and thus very hot. For some reason, the coolness of air-conditioning could not be controlled from the room, and I was informed by the hotel staff that it is at this time controlled centrally. It was so hot that we had to open the windows every night, and had no choice but to put up with cooking smell and smoke. Although I suppose some people may find the smell ok. Otherwise, everything else about the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Jardin”
Reviews.Author: MartyCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel. Great location on a quiet street but very near all the sights and bustle. Easy to get to from CDG airport. Quiet room, upgraded to a lovely terrace. Very friendly staff. Will definately recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Jardin le L'Odeon: Well Located, Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: evera003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at the Jardin de L’Odeon Hotel. Great location, on a quiet street near to shop’s and restaurants. The room (01) is lovely and beautiful decorated, little patio with 2 chears and table. In the morning you can hear the birds singing. Very clean and every day clean towels and sheets. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: JAVALBU
Reviews.Content: I have been in and out of this hotel several times during the last months. I have to say that in all ocasions the experience was more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Jardin de L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Violet20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin de L'Odeon Hotel for three nights with our 17 year old daughter. We had two classic rooms, which were not very big but big enough , and with views out on to the street, able to see the Theatre de L'Odeon. The rooms were very clean and one had a bath with overhead shower and the other had a shower room. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Generally we felt happy in the hotel and it had a good atmosphere. amd nice decor. We only had the hotel breakfast once, but thought it was quite good. On other days we had breakfast in local cafes. This hotel is in a very nice area and is also walking distance from many tourist attractions. The main aim of our trip was to go to Art Museums and it took us about 30 minutes to walk to the Louvre or the Musee D'Orsay. You can also easily walk into the main Latin Quarter and to Notre Dame. In the other direction, we also enjoyed walking around the Jardin de Luxembourg and into the area of Montparnasse, where we visited the Musee Zadkine, which has a little sculpture garden. I would certainly return to this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohmyGOSH
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel that is very French, on a narrow side street in a fabulous neighborhood. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The location for experiencing Paris can't be beat. Easy access to Metro, and 2 blocks from the Luxemborg Gardens, the Senate, the Pantheon, and great boulevards filled with cafes and shops. A short walk to the Notre Dame. Our room was small but very clean - and, as we spent most of our time enjoying the wonderful city, all we did was sleep there. The bath was modern and clean. We had a little balcony off our room but didn't use it. I had breakfast one morning and it was fine. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: canuckpump
Reviews.Content: Just to repeat what other people say...fantastic location, we love this area of Paris. Great staff, clean room and decent breakfast. But.......if you want a U.S. size room....stay home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBuddha
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. It is an ideal quiet location and we will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jardin de L'Odeon - well recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Pensioner99
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful little hotel just behind The Odeon - very central and within walking distance of many of the 'must see' sights. The hotel is clean, comfortable and elegant - all the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was beautifully decorated and furnished and overlooked a small garden courtyard. The bathroom, while small, was also well decorated and everything worked! The shower was instantly hot and quite powerful. Breakfast was well worth taking - a good spread which set you up for the day. We would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone and perhaps we will be able to revist it ourselves someday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: jkaufman14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location! Close to the main streets and metro, also Notre Dame was a 5 minute walk. The hotel is nicely decorated and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and reccommend to anyone. The price was just right for Paris, in fact a possible bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly welcome at Le Jardin”
Reviews.Author: AndrewWarr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from three nights at the Jardin. The hotel was perfect for our stay. We had a little business and a lot of shopping to do (she is 16 years old, nuff said). Jardin is situated in a central, safe, swanky (it seems, from the Parisians whom we told) and relatively quiet part of town, just off a quaint shopping area and close to the Seine. The hotel is small but very well appointed and perfectly clean. It's best asset is the staff, always welcoming, friendly and helpful, very sensitive to our particular needs. The room is a little noisy if you are there while the other rooms are being cleaned but then who wants to be in during the day (only shopping-exhaustion kept us in one day). One slight comment to the staff: please be realistic about taxi travel times and fares. I booked a taxi to the bus station (for Paris Beauvais) at 18.15 and when I asked, was assured that it would not cost more than €15 and there would be not traffic problem, I would be there by 18.40 latest. The taxi meter already had € 10 when I climbed in and I had to bail out of the taxi at 19.20 with all my luggage ten minutes from the bus station to make a mad dash to the last possible bus I could catch so as not to miss my flight!!! The taxi trip cost €42 and did not even get me there! Not Jardin staff's fault of course but a little realism would help. Paris rush hour traffic is insane, as was our taxi driver who valiantly tried everything short of river-surfing to get us there on time... Paris we found to be very friendly, easy to get around by Metro and a beautiful, airy city with a distinct French flair. A great holiday all round.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Left Bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgtoronto
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time considering the reviews on TripAdvisor and finally chose Jardin de l'Odeon. We were a party of 6 and all of us were satisfied with our least expensive rooms on the first two floors...all slightly different but all comfortable and clean. There was a little trouble with the heat, but an open window helped, and we certainly didn't mind hearing the birds in the morning. The courtyard was a pleasure to look out at....all green vines and spring flowers! The breakfast was ample, fresh and reasonable. The staff was obliging and helpful with suggestions for restaurants. All the previous good reviews are well deserved. Great value if you get one of the internet rates a month or two in advance. They seem to change during the day. We got the best rates when we booked in the morning and watched how the prices went up during the day. The hotel is in a terrific location....right in the middle of everything, yet quiet, which is quite unusual in this area. The streets here are filled with 3 star hotels, all of which look ok, but the Jardin looks a little more upscale. To go up another star or move to the Right Bank costs hundreds of dollars more per day, yet I cannot imagine anything being any more comfortable and accommodating. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: JJTwice
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this delightful hotel in mid-March. The rooms, though small, are well appointed and thoughtfully serviced; the staff is friendly and knowledgable and all speak English well and willingly. The location is ideal, with great cafes and all the sights within easy range - Notre Dame, the Louvre, Orsay and Luxemburg Gardens less than 15 minutes on foot. This is a splendid hotel and a great value. JJtwice, Fountain Hills, AZ, USA

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: APPCheshire
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a quiet street just off Place de l'Odeon. Excellent location -- very central but not too touristic. Good restaurants, bars, shops and Metro station all within walking distance. Rooms nicely decorated and equipped, a bit on the small side but not a problem if you're just using it as a base. Attractive lobby/lounge and breakfast areas -- breakfast buffet highly recommended. Free Wi-fi throughout the hotel. Staff couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful. All in all, an excellent and relatively inexpensive base for a few days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: barcelona_citizen
Reviews.Content: The experience at the Jardin de L'Odeon was absolutely fantastic. The personnel is extremely kind, all of them speak English, and they helped us in every aspect. The location of the hotel is at the heart of Paris, just in the St Germain area, perhaps the nicest part of Paris in my opinion. Our room was a small one, but very clean, with a nice view of the Odean theatre. It was very warm (which was appreciated, since outside was almost freezing). The bathroom was again extremely clean, very functional and with sufficient espace. In summary, one of the best hotels I've been in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent short stay”
Reviews.Author: UK-Lloyd
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay in a clean, friendly and tasteful hotel with interesting tasteful decor. Conveniently situated for exploration of the main Parisienne attractions. Hotel recommendations of local restaurants were good. All the staff were courteous and very helpful. All our needs were catered for. Booking by telephone and over the Internet was very efficient with the option of negotiating a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2008 for 6 nights. Average price per night was 153 Euro. We took the RER in from the airport 8.20 Euro and walked to the hotel from the Luxembourg station (less than 10 minute walk) We were immediately welcomed to the hotel and were checked into room 35. This was a double room facing the street. Small but comfortable. The staff at the hotel was very accomodating and friendly. They all spoke English fluently and were very helpful in confirming and calling for restaurant reservations. The hotel is a short walk to the Odeon metro station. Also nearby is the Monoprix which is a department/convenient store to pick up drinks, snacks and anything you forgot to bring from home. It is open late and prices were reasonable. Would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Changes-In-Longitude
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by Googling "non-smoking hotels-Paris". What a pleasure to stay in Paris again--no smoking in the restaurants and now a hotel where you don't have to worry about rooms with that telltale smoky odor! We had a standard double, which was small, but well-decorated, clean and functional. Our room overlooked the garden courtyard at the back of the hotel, which was extremely quiet. The courtyard was very pretty, even in February, with a fountain nestled in an ivy-covered wall decorated with tiny white lights. The courtyard is adjacent to the breakfast room and there are a few tables outside for guests' use in good weather. The location is good--on a very quiet one-way street (so street-facing rooms are quiet as well), only one block from the Luxembourg Gardens. Plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff were very helpful with recommendations, reservations etc. Some suggestions: bedside lighting was very dim--this could easily be improved with brighter lightbulbs. The bed was a little stiff, a foam pad would work wonders. Additionally, doors to the room had a tendency to slam shut noisily. Some padding around the frame would be an easy way to quiet this. We could hear some noise from adjacent rooms (loud conversations, TV). Overall, a small, charming hotel with good clean facilities and a warm, helpful staff--and smoke free!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel; Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: RedMangoLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Jardin de L'Odeon and we really enjoyed our stay; I always try to book this area when I am in Paris since it is a nice, quiet street in a really interesting neighborhood. A special note must be made for the unending courtesy of the staff, particularly the night Manager, who became something of a friend by the end of our stay. The room was immaculate and the bathroom was actually pretty large though the bedroom was one of the smaller ones I have stayed in even for Paris (but small rooms don't bother me, if they bother you, I would ask for a larger room, perhaps a suite if offered). It was outstanding value for the price and I would certainly not mind staying there again, or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: COLINREdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for Valentine's Day in Paris and it was great! It is in a really quiet location and the rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. We never ate breakfast there as there were so many lovely cafes to try. The front desk staff were really friendly and eager to help. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and family! It was also near to the Metro and withing walking distance of the seine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: Shibbyj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend of the 8th February 2008 as we were attending the Ireland V France match of the Rugby 6 Nations. The hotel is ideally located near to the Odéon metro stop (2 minute walk) up a lovely quiet street with the Odéon Théatre right across the square. It is within a 5-10 minute stroll to Rue Princesse which is a street ideal for the visiting Irish (full of pubs!). The staff were very pleasant, switching to english immediately on spotting the green jerseys (great as our french left a lot to be desired!) and what followed was a swift check-in process. The hotel is very small but in Parisien standards I'm sure it's pretty normal. The decor is fresh and modern and very cleverly done overall. They have made the best use of space and the result is an elegant hotel. There are about 6 rooms on each floor and the rooms are fairly small. Saying that, they do manage to fit in a dresser, mini-bar, chair and stool. The 2 single beds (pushed together and dressed as a double) in our room were actually shorter than a standard bed so my husbands feet did stick out the bottom considerably! I have no idea if this is the case in all rooms. The en-suite was spotlessly clean and well equipped with toiletries, but again my husbands 6 foot height became an issue in the shower as the roof is very low. Our only complaint was that on the second night the maid had removed the extra blankets from the room so I did wake with the cold and slept with my coat over me! I'm not sure why they were removed and I'm afraid I didn't question it or complain. I was just happy to get back to sleep after a long day! The breakfast was lovely with a selection of boiled eggs, cereal, breads, ham, cheese, yogurt and fruit to choose from, along with juice, tea, coffee etc served by a friendly lady happy to help. Overall, I would well recommend this hotel and would be more than happy to stay again, although this time I would request an extra blanket or two.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Screenprint
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival as it was our wedding anniversary we were informed that we had been upgraded to a superior room which was a nice touch. The room was excellent and the staff friendly. The location is the key and this Hotel is ideally placed in the latin quarter. As such it is central to most sites and surrounded by a great variety of cafes and restaurants to cater for all tastes. Yet tucked down a side road it is quiet for a good nights sleep. Highly recommended by John and Emma

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful tme in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Charles8
Reviews.Content: We had a thoroughly enjoyable time at the Jardin de L'Odeon. The hotel is ideally situated in a quiet street in St Germain de Pres. Our room had a lovely balcony with a a view of the Odeon Theatre. It was small but very clean and beautifully appointed. The bed was comfortable. Our stay was made more enjoyable because the staff were all so obliging and helped us with restaurant bookings and information about tours and shopping etc. We would certainly choose to stay at the same hotel next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Charming and Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Ace318
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over New Year's eve and the first week of January. This was my first trip to Paris and this hotel was perfect. It is located on a quiet street just outside of the main tourist area in the Latin Quarter, which is exactly what we wanted. The hotel is a very short walk to the Odeon metro station and all the sites can be accessed easily. The area around the hotel is also quiet nice to walk around. We had room 21 (classic double), which was quiet large compared to Paris standards. The room had a double/queen bed (not 2 singles pushed together as seen in other photos), which was very nice. The room was nicely decorated with tasteful wallpaper and paintings. The view from the bedroom was into the hotel's outdoor courtyard and breakfast area. Not the best view but again quiet, and in the morning you woke up to birds singing. The bathroom was also large and clean. Plenty of hot water and good pressure. The staff were excellent, spoke perfect english, and were very helpful. Also they provided us with a bottle of champagne as a New Year's gift, which was a very nice touch!! The only area in which I would say that this hotel is lacking is in the food provided. There is no restaurant or bar attached, but breakfast is provided in a cafe area. Breakfast is very expensive at 12Euros/person. Breakfast consisted of breads, cheese, coffee/teas/juice, cold cuts and fruits. However, this is not a problem as there are plenty of cafes and bakeries very close to the hotel. We had breakfast outside of the hotel everyday for much less approx. 4-8euros/person. Overall, I would rate this hotel very highly, and would recommend it to anyone. Particularily to couples who are looking for a quiet, romantic, french getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JNCU
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its location - proximity to many of the tourist attractions such as Jardin du Luxembourg, St Sulpice, St Germain des Pre, Notre-Dame, etc. and to transportation (Odeon: Metro 4 and 10, Luxembourg: RER-B, and the stop for Batobus, the Seine river boat) to get anywhere including Charles de Gaulle airport (about 35min ride for 8.20 euros). We ("relatively" fit in our 30's) were able to walk from the hotel to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, and Musee d'Orangerie. We also walked to the market on rue Mouftard and to the old Le Bon Marche. All the designer brand shops like Louis Vuitton and Cartier as well as numerous boutiques that carry fancy stuff are within walking distance too. Although the hotel is in the central location, it's on a safe, well lit, and quiet side street just a few blocks from the main streets and Metro. There are many places to eat nearby ranging from some unassuming Cafes, Brasseries and Bistros that serve great food, to some of the posh neo-French restaurants that you want to dress up to go to (we had the hotel staff make reservations for us), not to mention many of the international cuisine like Greek, Italian, Belgian, Japanese, Lebanese, Chinese, etc. If you have a sweet tooth, you might want to treat yourself to cakes at this amazing patisserie, Gerard Mulot, down the street. You can also walk to grocery stores (Champion, and basement of Monoprix) to get fruit, snacks, drinking water, etc. for consumption at your hotel room. As everyone else mentions in their reviews, all the hotel staff are extremely friendly and speak perfect English (if that is your concern). Rooms may be small under American standards, but no smaller than anything you see in Europe and Asia; they are really clean, nicely decorated, and well-equipped (though maybe no Wi-Fi or high-speed internet?, we were on vacation so didn't check). We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Paris for pleasure and will definitely go back for our next visit there.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in one of the best areas of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travelfrenzied
Reviews.Content: The Jardin de L'Odeon is perfectly positioned within easy walking distance of many varied restaurants and also within easy reach of the city. Although served by the metro service we used it only once to travel from the Gare du Nord to Luxembourg from were we walked to the hotel. The only way to experience Paris properly is to walk so be sure to pack comfortable shoes and foot cream. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but clean and comfortable. It is always good on a short break to find a hotel that has safety deposit box facilities in the room and a hair dryer. The only difficulty we experienced was in finding the Rue Casimir Delavigne on our first map as being a small road it does not feature. The booking agents dealing with this hotel might be advised to produce a small map to accompany their booking information.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RedhenUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second visit to this hotel and have had another great stay. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris and find this one to be the best for this price range. The hotel is immaculately kept and clean and well decorated throughout, the bedrooms are a decent size and also have proper showers or bath/showers (not always a guarantee in other Parisian hotels). The breakfast area is pleasant with a conservatory and patio area and breakfast itself is very good. Other good points are the pleasant staff and the location - the side street where the hotel is is quiet yet very near the metro, RER, Notre Dame and Jardins Luxembourg,.The hotel also has free WIFI. This is an excellent hotel, we can't wait for our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flygirl70
Reviews.Content: One of the nicer hotels we've stayed in in Paris. Reception very welcoming, in fact all the staff were very nice. The room smallish, but nothing smaller than you'd expect for central Paris. Exceptionally clean. Breakfast lovely, really helpful girl serving. Location excellent, we only used the Metro once to go to the Gare du Nord to travel home on the Eurostar.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located little gem of a hotel, with minor caveats”
Reviews.Author: MinisterOfCulture
Reviews.Content: Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay at the Jardin de l'Odeon. I would like to point out first the minuses, small though they may be. Room sizes are small, and storage for clothing can vary widely - my room had a small closet and some shelf space - no drawer space, though other rooms I did see had much more storage than my own, depending on the room layout. If you are two people sharing a room, and are "packing heavy", this may not be the hotel for you. However, beyond that, the rooms are quite comfortable, and are attractively decorated, with sparkling and modern bath facilities. Rooms facing the back of the hotel are very quiet - those facing the street will get some street noise, but, save for one bar down Rue Casimir Delavigne, there is little commercial activity or traffic on the road in front of the hotel. The hotel is a block away from the Odeon Metro stop at the Blvd. St. Germain, and is within easy walking distance of any number of restaurants, boutiques and entertainment venues (lots of cinemas nearby, on the Blvd. St. Germain). It is about a 15 minute stroll to the Seine, and not much further across the Pont des Arts to the Louvre. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and there is a small elevator, though, for descending, you may wish to opt for the stairs (I did most days, from the 3rd floor - a useful bit of exercise). I did not eat breakfast at the hotel, opting instead for breakfast at Les Editeurs in the Carrefour de l'Odeon, just before the entrance to the Metro. In the other direction, the hotel is about two blocks away from the Luxembourg RER station, which has a direct connection to both the Gare du Nord (for the Eurostar train) and Charles de Gaulle airport (8.20 euros one-way from the airport, with a large number of express trains direct from airport to Gare du Nord - Luxembourg is about four stops further south from the train station). For the price, I was delighted with the accommodations, and the convenience of the location cannot be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet hotel in the heart of the Odeon”
Reviews.Author: LouiseMechelen
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a quiet street in the heart of the Left Bank. The staff here are warm and helpful and the rooms, although small, are very nicely decorated, extremely clean and well equipped. I stay here everytime I come to Paris now. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ScottM-01
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place from which to see Paris! The hotel is located about 3 blocks up from the Metro stop at Odeon, and just down from the Odeon Theatre. The hotel is quite nice,the staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. We asked on evening for some help in finding a true, high quality French dinner and they provided an excellent recommendation, booked the table for us and provided a map with walking directions to get there. We were not disappointed. The room (#27) was a good size considering Paris standards, with two double beds pushed together, a TV, closet, desk and a full, recently reno'd bathroom complete with tub and shower. The room was very clean and quiet, and had excellent AC. We were there in the heart of summer and it was quite warm, but the room was perfect. The streets are perhaps a little noisy if you are not used to hustle and bustle, but if you're from a big city it is nothing to worry about. The room was cleaned every day including the weekends and was well appointed. They require you to leave your key at the front desk when you are not in your room, but this is quite typical at European hotels. Also, your key is inserted into the light switch to activate the room lighting, which took me a few minutes to figure out. There are numerous restaurants on the various streets that run right by the hotel, including a very good Indian place (Indian, Paris?). There are also several cafe's and a fantastic bistro on the corner by the Metro. It is called Le Comptoir and is a very busy but excellent place to dine. Be prepared to wait for a table though depending on what time you get there, as there was a lineup each night to get in If you are a couple or travelling alone, the hotel is fabulous. Right on the border of the Latin Quarter and St. Germain des Pres, there is a lot going on very close, shopping, food (very lose to Les Deux Maggots) and worth the stay. We will stay here again on our next Paris trip. I contacted the hotel directly to book, but ended up using the online websites as they beat the hotel's direct pricing by quite a bit. We paid $1,500 CAD for 6 nights. A bargain by Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChaShu
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The staff were fabulous and while we tried to speak to them in French, they were also very acommodating in English as well. The rooms were a very decent size, even for Europe and very clean and well kept. Our only complaint was that, for October, the rooms were too warm, but then, while we weren't even using our spring jackets, the Parisians were already breaking out the cold weather clothing, so it may have been a Canadian thing. Most of the things that need seeing in paris are either a wonderful stroll away or a quick trip on the Metro. For a great meal, try Les Editeurs or La Cambuse close by or Coupe Chou a ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fullmetal
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location. Clean and comfy. Close to Opera Metro Station. Not bad size (though US people will think it's small) Staff are friendly. Negatives: Room too hot in November, had to leave the window open a crack all night. Recommendations: For breakfast go to Les Editeurs (it's on your way to the Opera Metro) for a petit dejeuner - 8.50 euros. For supper there's an excellent restaurant on the opposite side of the road (with chairs and tables outside) - sorry can't remember the name but it's highly recommended, though a little pricey. It's almost always full so you may need to impulsively have a meal there if there's space. For desserts or lunch head for "Paul", the lemon tartlet is to die for and they do a good crepe. It's a bit further away than the above 2 cafes/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: bluebell25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic area, yet the hotel's street is quiet and residential. I booked a superior room with a private terrace. If you can do this do, as you get a fabulous view of the Odeon, and you have a table and chair set, perfect for sitting outside if weather permits. I looked at a few other rooms, which were all nicely decorated, just a little smaller and without the view. The room was nicely decorated, and had some nice furniture pieces and yet did not feel overcorwded. The toilet and bathroom were separate, and in good condition,m and of a reasobable. Both were spotless. I have stayed in many hotels in Paris and I would strongly receommend this one. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but at Cafe Danton opposite the Metro, it is cheaper than the hotel and I thought it was good. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, modern and friendly hotel in an excellent location (once you find it!)”
Reviews.Author: douliou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jardin de l'Odeon for 4 nights towards the end of August. We managed to find great deal (approx £80 per night room only) and there were good reviews on Tripadvisor. We really stuggled to find the hotel from the metro station (Luxembourg I think) - the map we had wasn't detailed enough to show all the tiny little streets in the area so it was difficult to work out where we were. We finally gave up on the map and phoned the hotel - and the lady there was extremely helpful, gave us very clear directions and we arrived within minutes. Check in was quick and efficient. The staff were very friendly and polite every time we spoke with them, and fortunately they spoke great English! The hotel looked lovely, and was very stylishly decorated. Our room was on the first floor. The lift is very small so if you are travelling as a family, you'd probably need a few trips! Our room was a bit on the small side but not too cramped and the furniture made the best use of the space available. The bathroom was a good size, with a bath and shower. It was all kept extremely clean throughout our stay. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast i.e. pastries, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, toast, cereal, cold meats etc. It cost 12 euros, which we felt was a bit expensive for what it was but it was always presented very well and as always, the staff were very polite and attentive. The hotel is lovely in its own right, but the best thing about it is its location - St Chapelle, Notre Dame, the Louvre and more all within a very short walk; we didn't need to use the metro that often. There's some lovely bars and restaurants close by, the whole area has a great vibe - really lively but also safe. It always seemed to be really bustling no matter what time of day. We had a truly lovely stay and a fabulous trip to Paris, and I have no hesitation in recommending the Jardin de l'Odeon (as long as you have a good detailed map!).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: PBSJ
Reviews.Content: This was our very first visit to Paris and this hotel was recommended by our booking agent, as they had personally stayed there. It is a first class hotel, very comfortable, excellent decor, spotlessly clean, and very friendly staff. The room and en-suite were what you would expect from a good 3 star hotel in Britain, with the exception of no tea/coffe making facilities, which we were told in advance was the norm in 3 star hotels in Paris. It did no present a problem as there were plenty of cafe's & bars only yards away. The breakfast fully met our expectations and you were not restricted to the amount available. The location of this hotel is ideal. It is within an easy 10 min walk to the River, 15 min to The Louvre or Notre Dame. The Odeon Metro station is a three minute walk. We will return to Paris in the future and will make this hotel our first choice. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone else. Paul & Bev Cotton Staffordshire, England

Reviews.Title: “We will come back next year!”
Reviews.Author: Falcone77
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Jardin de L'Odeon. The location is perfect, close by the metro Odeon and some nice restaurants. The street where the hotel is located is quiet, but close to the busy Boulevard Saint-Germain (with nice shops!). The district St-Germain-des-Prés and Quartier Latin offer a lot of nice shops and restaurants. The Jardin du Luxembourg is romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Diana32
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights here and loved it. The room was tiny but beautifully furnished. Staff is very friendly. Location is perfect --- lively Left Bank neighborhood full of cafes and bookstores. Walked everywhere including Notre Dame, Louvre, Jardin de Luxembourg, Pantheon. Easy Metro access. Got a great rate on Priceline. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BobL1958
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent from start to finish. From the friendly, bilingual staff to the chilled champagne awaiting our arrival, we found everything just as advertised. When we needed a question answered, the desk people were prompt, friendly and right on the money. I've been to Paris several times and this was the nicest and most spacious hotel I've visited. We had a top floor room with a balcony which provided our oasis from the city rush. It's in a great location, with nice restaurants and city sights (the Jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay and Louvre are within easy walking distance). Metro stop Odeon is about a block away. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: U.K.Moose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon was selected for my husband's birthday weekend in Paris - October 6th date of the Nuit Blanche and the rugby quarter finals. The St Germain area was incredibly busy, noisy and difficult to get around on foot. Because I'm not too keen on lifts I requested a first or second floor room and after correspondance by email with the hotel was given a very nice double room on the first floor. It was small but immaculately decorated, very clean, nice window opening on a small flowery internal courtyard and very quiet. This was a godsend because Paris was packed with people and traffic. We are not, by nature, city people but the peace of the room, the hotel's location near the Odeon theatre and very good restaurants all in a very short distance made the hectic pace of life around St Germain and near the Seine much more bearable. The Cambuse (opposite the hotel) and Chez Maitre Paul (round the corner at Rue Monsieur Le Prince) are to be commended on their excellent food and friendly service and the Luxembourg Gardens at a short walk from the hotel were an absolute delight to the senses and a haven of relaxation. What was most impressive were the very friendy hotel staff - I have to say that I didn't encounter one unfriendly character in the whole of my three days in the city - everyone appeared to be in a good mood (especially when France beat the All Blacks), but having smiling faces on the front desk when you walk into an alien environment is a real positive for me. Breakfast was perfectly reasonable at 12 euros. My only criticism would be that with no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms and no bar, you have to go out for a hot drink and after a particularly unpleasant fall, having got back to the hotel, I really needed a hot cup of tea to steady my nerves and my husband had to go to the nearest snack bar to get one and bring it back. My advice - make room in your rucksack or suitcase for a travel kettle if you need your caffeine. (Tea and coffee are not in any case cheap as you might expect!) All in all though a very comfortable hotel and very well suited to those who like a bit of a retreat from city street life at the end of long days of sight seeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “A sparkling jewel of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: Map-It
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a very pleasant stay at this hotel. We were initially concerned when shown to the room adjacent to the breakfasting area as we had read reviews mentioning how noisy it could be - however we immediately liked the room so didn't ask for a change. Given our stay was in October, the outside terrace was not being used and therefore the room was quiet. The room was of a good size and the hotel spotlessly clean. We thought breakfast was good value at 12 euros each. If there was a downside , it was that the breakfast room staff were not particularly pleasant although they frequently replenished the buffet table and quickly re-set breakfast tables. The location is excellent for getting around and for good cafes and restaurants....in all directions! Reception staff were the best I have come across - a particular thanks to them. Nothing was too much trouble. I would recommend booking the airport shuttle for your return journey through them - the rate is good and they handle the calls from/to the shuttle company. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the 3 star medium range, very well located”
Reviews.Author: veteranworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Jardin for 6 days with 2 rooms in late sept. it was a very pleasant experience and we had no complaints. first of all it should be said that it's certainly not in the deluxe category, but they don't pretend to be. it's a solid mid range 3 star hotel, and the shocking thing is just how much even this type of property now costs in paris. we are frankly used to staying in deluxe properties, and with our daughter with us and needing two rooms this time, no way were we prepared to pay the $700-1000 that truly deluxe hotels in paris command now. so, mostly guided by comments at this site, we booked the Jardin at their website. the rooms are typically small european size, and the bathrooms perhaps even a bit smaller. however, as others have said, they are kept perfectly clean, nice, plentiful towels and soaps etc. the free wireless was most appreciated since many european hotels are grabbing an extra $15-20 per day for it now. the decor is very attractive, each room has a different motif, with tasteful paintings, curtains, drapes etc. all reflecting quality and good taste. we did not have breakfast at the hotel, since they charge extra, which wasn't an issue... we were simply getting over jet lag the first few days and too busy getting out to sightsee the others. the staff were quite friendly, helpful and professional... especially the lady who spent quite a while on the phone getting my wife some emergency dental care on a saturday.. no easy task in paris! certainly the location of the hotel is superb... you can walk down to the seine and the rest of the city in a leisurely 15-20 minutes, and yes, there is a great selection of cafes, bakeries, and restaurants all around the hotel. in summary, we would certainly recommend this hotel, keeping in mind its category and being realistic about what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Comfortable Left Bank Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancy05
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in Paris, especially on the left bank. This hotel was a delight. Our room was bright and the bed and pillows were comfortable, although on the smallish side. But then, that's Paris. We still had plenty of room for our belongings. The lobby was bright and inviting and everyone was as helpful as possible. Before we book a hotel I always try to find reviews on traveltips and have yet to be disappointment. You could say it is my bible. The location was great and it was no more than a five minute walk to the metro so you could travel all over the city easily. We took the metro from Orly and then back to Gare to Nord without any difficulty. Would definitely recommend to others and will return next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Jardin de L'Odeon - Wonderful hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: moi27
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 11days at the Jardin de L'Odeon. The hotel is wonderful, the service was excellent. The room was very nice and clean - new bathroom, minibar, safe and TV. The Staff went out of it's way to help and make me fill good. The location is great - many attractions and restaurants within walking distance, many bus lines and a Metro station nearby. I get to Paris at list once a year, that was one of the best hotels I've ever been to. I will definitely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: KKSStLouis
Reviews.Content: This is the sixth hotel I've stayed in during visits to Paris, and the second in the St Germain area near the Odeon theater. It is by far the best of the six. The location is great--the Rue Delavigne is a quiet street, yet you're only a block or two from the Luxembourg Gardens in one direction, and the busy Odeon area on Blvd St Germain in the other. The Latin Quarter, Ile Cite, St Sulpice, and the Louvre are all within easy walking distance. The staff was exceptionally helpful and spoke very good English. The rooms were small--typical in this area if you want to stay under 200 Euros, but were immaculate, very comfortable, and appeared to have been recently renovated. The bed was firm, the bathroom a nice size, and best of all, it was air conditioned with individual room digital thermostats. A lot of little things add up: room safes, minibars, turndown service, etc. The public areas were also very clean and fresh, and stylishly decorated.. I highly recommend this hotel--it is a great value in a great area--and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: missmay
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for my honeymoon and agonized over where to stay. We wanted someplace nice, but couldn't afford anything too luxurious. My sister's recommendation was already booked. I finally decided on Jardin l'Odeon based on TripAdvisor reviews and ended up being very happy with my choice. Location is great - just as everyone has said. Close to multiple metro stations, walking distance to most big sites, and tucked away on a quieter street. Hotel staff alternated from being a bit snotty to very helpful. I generally found the evening/night staff to be kind and wonderful; day staff not as much. I wonder if it's becuase they have to deal with all the checkin/checkout? Room was small and cozy, tastefully decorated. We got #42 and had no problems. The view was none to speak of, and when the window was open on Saturday night, I heard tons of noise from people walking on the street. But, I expect you'd get that from just about any hotel in Paris. All the other nights I had no problems. I'd recommend this hotel without question to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, staff, and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bjneal
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 night stay in this fine little hotel--great location on a safe, quiet street, 3 blocks from Metro, easy walking distance to Blvd. St. Michele and Luxemborg Gardens and the Seine. Desk staff was superb-- helping us with everything from maps to museum hours to booking train tickets. Newspapers in several languages available in lovely art deco lobby. Breakfast very ample for Paris--more like a German breakfast with variety of breads, cheese, meats, cereals, and juices. Small but tidy room offset by great location and helpful staff. Of six trips to Paris, this hotel is our pick.

Reviews.Title: “Near subway, nice room with terrace (Room 64), NOISY internally”
Reviews.Author: Alias73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the Odean subway (use machine to get 10 tickets for your stay) so easy to get everywhere from here. The staff are really polite and helpful, printing off maps to help you find anywhere you want to go. We had Room 64 - with a terrace, great decor, clean and lovely. Breakfast (optional extra) was great. Only problem is that internally it's noisy, the corridors are narrow so the rooms opposite are very close (you don't feel very private). We were awoken EARLY by toilets flushing, shower noise and doors slamming closed, guests leaving etc. If you don't mind this noise (rare to find a hotel where you don't get it) it's a great little hotel. EAT at Sorza on Ile St Louis, and Les Bouquinistes at 53, quai des Grands-Augustins (www.lesbouquinistes.com), both great for meat eaters and vegetarians.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bucordant
Reviews.Content: Situated at a very desirable, high standing location in Paris, the remodeled hotel offers charming accomodations and superb services complementing the "Paris feeling", at an affordable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Jardin de L'Odeon - excellent place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: TheGalwaygirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon a couple of times now and I think it is a great place to stay in Paris. I use it for business purposes when I go to visit clients in Paris and I usually stay one extra night for pleasure. I am always assured to get the best and very compeditive rates. The people who work at the hotel are very accomodating and very good at their jobs. The location is perfect as it is walking distance to most sight seeing places. There are some fabulous restaurants closeby. The hotel bedrooms are very nicely decorated. your sleep will not be interrupted by any late night traffic as it is a 1 way street and there is not much traffic going by at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and Lovely Stay at L'Odeon, Paris”
Reviews.Author: chadkat
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed two night in Paris at the L'Odeon Hotel. We were looking for a nice place close to everything that was metro accessible and also affordable. This hotel is easy to find right off of the metro stop and close to tons of little restaurants and bars to eat at during the day or at night. This is located close to the Latin Quarter and an easy walk to St. Michel or Notre Dame. The rooms are VERY small; however also very modern and clean. We both agreed that we would stay here again if we went back to Paris. There is an extremely nice restaurant right around the corner called something like Le Mediterrean. It is a very typical french restaurant, a little pricey, but well worth it if you are looking for a real place to eat rather than a brasserie. Don't bother getting the breakfast included in your stay at L'Odean since it's 12 euros and there are plenty of little places around the Hotel to eat and lots of Boulangeries to buy breakfast. Overall the room was cozy and a big bathroom that was very clean. The rooms all have hair dryers, safes, air conditioning. Also, consult the website on the Hotel when booking. We went on the site and found that it was much cheaper than the normal sites like Expedia, Orbitz, etc. We booked more than 6 months in advance and got a cheaper booking rate, so make sure to check all of them out. The front desk staff was VERY nice and helpful. We were rushed to catch a flight to another area in France and the lady at the desk helped us call a service to take us to the Hotel. Service to and from the Hotel is a van that will take other people with you, but it's only about 34 euros (total for anyone in your party) direct to the airport, so much cheaper than a taxi. Enjoy your stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at this very reasonably priced and centrally placed hotel for four nights in August 2007. The staff are very friendly and helpful and answered queries by Email immediately prior to arriving. Their luggage room facility meant that we could leave our luggage and effectively spend an extra day in Paris without being hampered by carrying luggage around. The breakfast is 12 Euros - a bit expensive but lots of choice. The location of the hotel is excellent. Near to the Luxembourg Gardens and Pantheon. In the middle of the St Germain area and Latin Quarter and an easy walk to the Seine. Very close to St Michel for the RER directly to the airport. Lots of fabulous bistros, markets and bookshops to explore. The road is quiet at night but still in the heart of things. Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBY2005
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay. Great service by many of the staff which was amazing (hope some of the staff can learn from their wonderful colleagues). By many of the staff the sevice was personal and great. Rooms wer very clean and comfortable. Unfortunately we also experience a small theft of personal hygiene products from our room (cleaning person)? Also it would be adviseable to put a better location map on their web site. It waould be wonderful should they be able to provide a shared ride taxi service or assistance to getting from the airport to the hotel. Overall a great hotel at a good location with very helpful staff (well beyond the standard in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JM_Bushwick
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon. It was in a great location and the room was a good size. I only have two complaints: 1) the walls to the hotel are thin, you can hear everything that goes on in the hallway. I'm a heavy sleeper, so this did not bother me. 2) I had read that the shower was not covered so the whole bathroom got wet, did not believe this...my friends it is true. There is half a glass door in the shower, so water get all over the sink and the floor. Regardless, I would stay there again. The hotel is located just a block away from the Jardin du Luxembourg, 3 or so blocks from Blulevard Saint Germain and you can walk to Notre Dame (its like a 20 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, modern, great staff - very helpful, comfortable bed, nice”
Reviews.Author: SusanChicagoarea
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location - easy walking distance to the Seine and all the sights along there. Odean metro nearby. Great restaurants, cafes in the area. Fun, busy area, always something going on, though hotel is on quiet street - did not have too much noise at any time. Room was clean, modern, sufficient space (for a European hotel) - same with bathroom, though hairdryer is slow and not powerful so may want to bring your own. Not many outlets - none in bathroom so blow drying my hair was a challenge as there was only one outlet by the TV and no mirror. (Reflection in the TV doubles as mirror!) Good to know also that key card to room turns on electricity in the room and when turning off wall switches for lights, it also turns off the outlets (couldn't figure out at first why my camera battery wasn't charging overnight!). Comfortable bed, nice pillows. Staff was great - helpful, knowledgeable,accomodating. Breakfast was also very nice - typical European fare, not just continental, though 12 euros seems a bit much. Depends on what you want - there is a good selection of things to eat and you can get several cups of coffee which is a plus. I have been to Europe many times and have stayed in many different types of accomodations. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: umejohe
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Friendly personnel and very good service. I was there in business and what normally is very difficult in Paris is to find a Taxi in the morning but they were able to reserve taxi in advance. Nice and clean room at a fair price and the area is also very quiet. I can really recommend this hotel. /Johan Hellström

Reviews.Title: “A lovely small hotel in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: AthensLia_Kos
Reviews.Content: Jardin de l´Odeon is a small lovely hotel next to the metro and in the middle of the heart of Paris. You can go everywhere without a problem. The hotel is very clean and the people very kind and ready to help you. We would strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: DingDongSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located just a block from the Luxembourg Gardens and a few blocks from the Seine in the St Germain district. Our room was small, but it had been refurbished recently and was beautifully appointed. Very good value. The staff were all exceptionally helpful, making dinner reservations, arranging taxis and satisfactorily answering all our queries. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Jardin de L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: TravelkiwiDunedin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Jardin de L'Odeon was better than I had come to expect from Paris hotels. The standard room we had although not spacious was adequate and well furnished. The bathroom was clean and modern and had everything we needed. The staff were very helpful and spoke very good English. We only had two nights as we were on our way home to New Zealand after five weeks away but really enjoyed our stay and would use the hotel again. Close to all the must sees in the Latin/St Germain area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,quirky room!!”
Reviews.Author: Soundtraveller63
