Reviews.Content: What a great location-good travel networks, within easy walking of some major sites not to mention some great cafes and brasseries; yet set in a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle. The room was extraordinarily quirky. It was set right at the top of the hotel and was on two floors!! You entered in to a long narrow room with a settee and TV. The shower room was off this(great shower, by the way). There was a flight of stairs up in to the roof space. This had a three piece suite and an extremely comfortable bed. External electric shutters on the skylights ensured no early morning light sneaked in to wake you up. Overall the hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable, simple but not sumptuous. The staff were all helpful and courteous. The only disappointment was the view of the rear of other buildings and the chimney pots but I think that is fairly common in this tight packed area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, incredible staff, cute rooms”
Reviews.Author: Duluthian57
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Jardin de L'Odeon in four years, and we absolutely love it. The rooms are small, yes, but there's a warmth to the hotel that is priceless. The staff is always courteous and eager to help (and their English is terrific). The breakfasts are yummy. The fountain is soothing. (We prefer rooms that face in so we can hear the fountain, as opposed to those facing the street.) The location couldn't be better, close as it is to St. Germain, the Luxembourg Gardens, the traditional tourist sites around Notre Dame, etc. There's also a lovely little restaurant right across the street, La Cambuse, which seats 30 and no more. All in all, it's a really wonderful hotel, complete with many, many charms.

Reviews.Title: “good value at Jardin de l'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: mairead egan
Reviews.Content: Having spent five nights recently at the Jardin de l' Odeon, I want to compliment the management on a very well-run establishment! The reception desk was always manned by a polite and efficient person who was always helpful and pleasant. The rooms, while small, are immaculately maintained and quiet. This was my second time at this hotel - touches I really like are the availability of Newspapers in the seating area for guests, and also the availability of coffee there - but if they are going to charge €2 per cup, perhaps they could have a look at making it better coffee>? And hot! Above all , what willl bring me back to this hotel is the management's attention to detail: I feel I got value for my money and they are to be commended for their management style.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Left Bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeeJM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in early June 2007. The hotel is located on a quiet street steps from the Odeon Theatre. Plenty of shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk. Convenient to both St. Germain/St. Michel and Latin Quarter. Easy access from CDG via the RER B train to the Luxembourg stop. The hotel itself is small and personable. There is someone on duty at the front desk at all times. The hotel asks that you drop your key off at the front desk when leaving the hotel - a practice that works well at a small hotel. The staff members were friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. We had a minor problem in our room at check in (a toilet that kept running on) which was fixed in a matter of minutes. The hotel was quiet and comfortable. Our room had a window facing the tiny courtyard in the back. The room itself was small but comfortable and quiet. Our room had a quiet, efficient climate control unit that worked very well. We did not take the e12 breakfast option but noticed the guests who chose the breakfast option seemed to enjoy it. The hotel has free WiFi, minibar in room, cable TV, and a telephone. I booked this room (and two others during my trip) via venere.com. I contacted the hotel directly via e-mail before arrival to verify my reservation and received a prompt response from the hotel confirming my stay. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not much for the price”
Reviews.Author: Gladtobethere
Reviews.Content: The small room is well kept up and the bathroom is immaculate. The room safe is convenient and the closet, while not large, is adequate. Stowing bags could be a problem if you have many. Breakfast is the usual bread, cheese, meat and yoghurt. No internet access. The closest internet cafe is five blocks and very hot; no apparent ventilation for the 40 or so machines running. If you like Japanese food, you're in heaven; there must be 10 Japanese restaurants within a block. Many other food choices on Blvd. St. Michel, an easy walk. There is a lounge/ lobby with newspapers and you can have coffee in there in the morning if you wish. Three blocks to metro. If you stay here, download the map from the website. It will help your cabbie especially if you are coming from the Gare du Nord. You can easily roll your luggage to the taxi stand at the Odeon Metro stop. It's slightly downhill. Room key fits in a slot to keep the lights on. Wall outlets are not affected so you can leave, take the key with you and still charge your batteries. Hall lights are on a motion sensor, so there is momentary darkness when you leave your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhilmacdonald
Reviews.Content: Thoroghly enjoyed our weekend stay in this spotless comfortable hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good. it is in a wonderful location in a quiet small side street but only a couple of minutes walk from The Luxembourg Gardens and the lovely shops of Saint Germain. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LuciaHoneychurch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for our anniversary and it is very clean and fresh. It has all the conveniences -- climate control in your room, a small bathroom with new fixtures and had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. There was a closet with a place to hang clothes and many shelves to put away clothes and a desk and chair. We had TV, two channels were English speaking - CNN and BBC. It was quiet for Paris -- we were on the back side of the hotel so no street sounds and even on the front side, the street is a relatively small quiet one with little traffic. The hotel has rooms that are larger than the one we had, but this particular room had a large balcony with a table and chairs that served as an extra room on nice evenings. The staff was overall very friendly and cooperative. They spoke good english and went out of their way to accommodate some of our unusual requests. The location of the hotel is excellent, near Metro Odeon, close to Luxembourg Gardens, Place St. Michel and St. Germain Des Pres. The dollar was weak at the time of our visit (1.40 to the euro) so the the room was $285 - $308 depending upon the night we were there. A continental breakfast was extra at 12 euros per person. This was not such a good deal (came to $32 for us at the time) We only did it once and then did the nearby Odeon Starbucks and neighborhood patisseries which we preferred. We would definitely recommend this hotel to people traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “NIce little hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Jasminrose
Reviews.Content: Paris: Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon : nice hotel at reasonable price. Reviewer: widowed female traveller from Boston area. I stayed at the Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon for eight nights in May 2007. My room appeared to have been recently renovated and was attractive and comfortable although it was the typically small Paris hotel room (I have stayed in smaller Paris hotel rooms). The bathroom (with tub) was a good size, immaculate, and furnished with modern fixtures. The staff were very friendly and helpful in booking both bus tours and a very reasonable shuttle to the airport. I wish I could remember the name of the woman who made my bookings (Stephanie?). I know she dealt with numerous hotel guests everyday, but she even remembered my booking for Versailles when I passed her on the sidewalk as she was leaving work for the day. She asked me how I had enjoyed it, and I was impressed by her kindness. All in all, this is a very nice place to stay if you are looking for something both well-located and reasonable in price (not so easy to find these days with the weak dollar versus the euro). The breakfast buffet at 12 euros may seem pricey, but you get a lot for your money (cold meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, juices, croissants, rolls, refills if you want on the hot beverage of choice). You would spend a lot more than 12 euros for all this at a Paris cafe. The hotel also offers a selection of complimentary newspapers to its guests; a nice touch in such a reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SHM_MLCD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find! It is tucked away a few blocks from the center of the Latin Quarter. The lobby is lovely, the staff is very helpful, and though small--the rooms are charming (and quiet!). Cindee at the front desk was especially helpful when we missed our dinner cruise by just a few minutes. She was very proactive and was able to reschedule our cruise while we meandered around Paris! We couldn't have been more appreciative! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! P.S. Make sure you find the street on a map before you go! The map on the hotel website is missing too many streets to easily navigate getting there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JosephineD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jardin de L'Odeon for 4 nights midweek in mid-March. We got a special rate on the hotel's own website. The thing we liked best about the hotel was the location - the Latin Quarter is very pretty and there is lots to do and see nearby. We walked everywhere although the Metro and RER stations are within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were small but clean and functional and nicely decorated. Our room was on the street side. We didn't find that too noisy. One night we were disturbed by noise in the corridor (doors banging as people went in and out of their rooms) - the soundproofing through the doors is not very good. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. We chose instead to sample the croissants at nearby cafes which we enjoyed very much. I would recommend this hotel based on the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbreton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and loved the location and the hotel itself. We certainly lucked out with this one! Having stayed in chain hotels in the past in Paris, we decided to try a boutique hotel and couldn't be more pleased with this one. The rooms were tastefully decorated, staff was very friendly and helpful (and spoke english), the location couldn't be nicer - plenty of restaurants nearby, coffee shops and shopping as well. Very close to markets, also. We just loved this hotel. The only negative comment was the elevator died on the last day of our stay so we had to bring our luggage down the narrow stairs. We didn't have breakfast (we find that most hotels breakfasts are too expensive for what you get) but there was a nice little garden patio that would have been lovely for a cafe in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheriS
Reviews.Content: Dates: April 24 - 28, 2007 Reviewer: Sanfords, Baltimore, Maryland USA We have been to Paris several times and have stayed in several different hotels. Jardin de L'Odeon has been our favorite, and we will definitely stay there again. The hotel is charming and beautiful and has only 41 rooms. We sprung for a superior class room, and it was definitely worth it. The room was a very nice size and had a private balcony. The staff was most helpful and very friendly. The location on the left bank is our favorite. There is a wonderful restaurant around the corner, Chez Paul. We don't usually submit reviews, but TripAdvisor was a Godsend on our recent 17-day trip to Italy and Paris, so we thought it was important to share our sentiments. With that said, we hope you enjoy Jardin de L'Odeon as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cozy, but slightly noisy”
Reviews.Author: FCMEX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Jardin de l'Odeon for seven nights in early April. Location is great, very close to Metro, RER and St. Germain. Rooms are definitely on the small side, but they have all that's needed for a very comfortable stay (including, very important, a shower with great pressure). Walls are very thin so you can definitely hear when someone is showering or flushing water in an adjacent room. We were on the second floor, so we got a little bit of street noise. In general, very good value for the price. Would stay here again, but would ask for a room on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephAustralian
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel with friendly staff. We will certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: hiart
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely lovely, unpretentious hotel in one of the most beautiful sections of Paris. Our window looked out toward the facade of the Odeon Theater, the Luxembourg Gardens are right behind. The location is so central that you can walk anywhere in the city from here, but because the hotel is tucked away on a tiny, quiet street, you barely realize you're in the middle of everything. The beds were beautifully made up every day; for some reason the housekeepers didn't see fit to replenish bathroom supplies and organize the sink area. Can't figure that one out. But the reception staff is extraordinary -- helpful and charming -- and the hotel provides free wifi as well as a very inexpensive international phone service -- a tremendous boon to those of us who have work to do while in the City of Light. A+

Reviews.Title: “Loved it there, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Katiekirby
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, a great choice for my first visit to Paris. We had a beautiful room with a private terrace. Unfortunately horrible weather while we were there, so we didn't get to enjoy it. We found the location to be central, and were able to walk to the main historical sites that we wanted to see. The room appeared to be recently redone, and was extremely clean and comfortable. The free wireless internet service would have been nice, had it not been so unbearably sluggish.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Anne288
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor and your reviews helped us make an excellent choice staying at Jardin de l'Odeon. The room was small ,as are all rooms in Paris under $300, but it was nicely decorated with a great parisian view out the window and a great bed with cozy bedding. Very quiet with all the amenities you would expect from a 3 star hotel. Great shower head etc...Breakfast was an additional 12 Euro so we chose to bring yougurt, bread, cheese and fruit up to the room and felt it was a good choice. A small refrigerator in the room helped out. The location is very close to the Luximburg Gardens and the Cluney museum. Great shopping and cafes near by ,even a Starbucks for the hard core, gotta have my big cup of coffee drinkers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellababy
Reviews.Content: We we are the Jardin de L'Odeon for 5 nights in March. It is a very nice small hotel, decent location, very clean, friendly front desk. The hotel room was very small but we expected that. The bed was very, very hard. The hotel itself did not have much character. We were not in our hotel room that much so it served it's purpose I just think we might have been able to do better for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and a great location”
Reviews.Author: 007Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely two night stay in Paris at the Jardin de L'Odeon. Our stay at the hotel was very good. The hotel is on a pretty street, about 5 minutes from the Odeon Metro stop. Our room was nicely decorated and the staff were friendly and helpful. The area in which the hotel is located is fabulous; full of art galleries and little shops and bars and restaurants. We booked via Venere and got an excellent rate (€120 per night). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: rocqchick
Reviews.Content: i booked 5 rooms recently for my mothers 60th birthday party. all of the rooms were well appointed, clean and fresh. the hotel is perfectly located to enjoy the jardin d'luxembourg, avenue st germain and surrounding sights. i found the rooms quite pricey, but on the whole we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManByTheLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jardin de L'Odeon for three nights in February. The hotel is in a great location with many nearby shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk. It is very clean and rooms were well presented. The rooms were small, but this did not really matter as small rooms are normal in Parisian hotels. The breakfast was fantastic with a selection of fresh fruit, breads, croissants, yogurts, ham, cheese, coffee........ The hotel is really easy to get to if you fly into Charles De Gaulle. Take the RER line B to Luxembourg station and it is a five minute walk to the Odeon Theatre. The hotel is on one of the little streets opposite the theatre. The nearest Metro station (Odeon) is only a few minutes away. We will definitely stay there again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the 6ieme”
Reviews.Author: lizgar
Reviews.Content: Really liked the hotel but glad that we booked on the hotel website as we paid half price for our last minute trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a couple of issues though.”
Reviews.Author: urbanchef
Reviews.Content: All was nice about the hotel (location, staff, breakfast, room) the only thing about our room #11, was no English television signals available. And the phone would not allow us to call Canada, even after getting the reception to try for us. Also, despite the charm of the room, do be prepared for a much smaller size room than imagined.

Reviews.Title: “A Quintessential Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gregarious
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for? The hotel has a friendly and helpful staff, a great location, nice rooms (not overly large but large enough with nice bathrooms), wi-fi, and an easy on-line reservation sysem. We have also stayed at the Hotel du Pantheon - we like this hotel group!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Jardin de L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Me&Ha
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to Boulevard St Germain with helpful staff. Many areas you would wish to visit are within easy walking distance and is also very close to the Luxenburg Gardens. I will have no hesitation using this hotel during my next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in quiet area but close to main boulevard”
Reviews.Author: MaciekSz
Reviews.Content: We've been there for 4 nights. We loved the hotel. Our room was quite small but comfortable, very clean with nice, stylish furnishing (very good shape). The building was renovated last time. Room was cleaned daily and even 2 times a day. Once we've back to take a shower at noon, when room was after cleaning. When we back on evening the bathroom was done again. The staff speak English and is helpful. Only houskeeping staff smashed the other rooms doors on morning - that's a minus. We had view on street side (Odeon Theatre) - but the street is very quiet - we could sleep at open window. It is hard to believe that heart of St. Germain Boulevard is 300 m from the hotel. We ate breakfast out of the hotel. Very good location, very good hotel. We will book it next time! Maciek & Kasia Poland 14.02 - 18.02.2007 in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Odeon”
Reviews.Author: Coralville
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located central to the most of tourist sites in Paris. Hotel rooms though compact were kept clean and the room service was good. Hotel staff especially the Manager was very helpful. Enjoyed the breakfast service. Keep up with the good work. Merci!!!!! Raj

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, small room - Where is the romance?”
Reviews.Author: Cantravel18
Reviews.Content: Not a romantic experience for us as you will see, but the hotel people were wonderful... My wife was sick at Valentine's Day when we stayed at the hotel, and the staff was very concerned, offering to help with extra towels, etc. We did not check out until 5PM because my wife was not feeling well, and the hotel charged what I thought was a reasonable compromise between the regular rate and free, considering the hotel was well booked. Bathroom was a little tired, with uncleanable spots that probably need a little more than a coat of paint, but the overall impression was clean and pleasant. The sheets were amazingly rough at first, but we got used to them, and will likely go back to the hotel in a couple of months. Of course, the location in Paris could hardly be better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S A
Reviews.Content: I know the area well following several rugby trips to Paris and it is my favourite part of the city. First time at this hotel and was happy overall. The room was a little small but in truth you spend very little time in your room when in Paris. I could see from the floor plan that we had the smallest room on the floor but there were upgrade options available on check in which I did not take. The bathroom was fairly large by Paris standards and the shower had enough power to help with the heaviest hangover. The room was very warm though and hard as I tried I could not get the A/C to kick in. I see from other reviews that it must be off for the winter. Opening the windows did the trick and even though we were facing the street it was not too noisy. Staff were always friendly and cheerful. I would and probably will stay here again. SA & KK, Skerries, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel on Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: anniecancan
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a quiet street just round the corner from Odeon & rue St Germain de Pres. The room wasn't the biggest, but was decorated nicely, was very comfortable and had everything one would need. We travel to Paris every month so would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: berksquat
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through a Eurostar package available to Brits. Great deal if you have someone in the UK who can book for you and you're coming to Paris from London. Picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and the location. Character of hotel is fine, nothing spectacular - there's a real attempt to be interesting, not quite sure it works, but not tacky in any way. The room was clean, small, quiet and an excellent shower - a real surprise for a Paris hotel. We basically spent all our time walking Paris and just slept in the room, so it met our needs. Only complaint, and it's minor; the heat seemed to be set at one temperature. We prefer to sleep in a cool room but the a/c was off for the winter (this was Feb. after-all). If you read other TripAdvisor reviews you'll see that New Yorkers like us tend to be more picky than most other travelers. When you read multiple reviews, keep that in mind as you evaluate. And another piece of advice for any traveler; don't let ANYTHING ruin your vacation! Messed up reservations, crappy rooms, getting lost, etc, etc. Things happen, many other cultures have different standards when it comes to accommodating your needs. Don't you hate to read reviews where people say, "my whole vacation was ruined because the check in clerk put is in the wrong room". And then conversely, don't you love when something goes not according to plan and you find that something unexpected leads to a great story and more times than not, a serendipitous journey. -MB

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location at a nice price point”
Reviews.Author: trbj
Reviews.Content: Excellent left Bank location, easy to walk to from the Luxembourg RER/train station (direct train from CDG airport). Very competent and helpful staff. Clean, nicely furnished rooms, while small, are good value for the money (in Paris). We liked our comfortable double bed and beddings. While conveniently close to Boulevard St Michel the hotel is on a quiet, short, side street (make sure you get directions it is not on every map!) and we heard no street or traffic noise. On line booking, check-in and check-out all smooth. We were happy with our stay at Jardin de l"Odeon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: PL2
Reviews.Content: We really liked it, our room was on the small side but this is Paris after all! Nice bathroom, clean, has an elevator, and really friendly staff. In the heart of St Germain. Check out their winter offers, we got our room for less than half the listed price!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!! little gem”
Reviews.Author: lindsey87
Reviews.Content: Hotel was more than we expected. Staff were brilliant and really helpful. Rooms were extremely clean and it was in a perfect location. About 5minutes from Notre Dame and 10 mins from the Louvre. Lovely restrautrants near by and the metro was at the bottom of the street. Definately recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. Easy to get to and in the centre. If you're going on the bus tour the bus stop is right at the end of the street and that way you get to see all of Paris. Little gem up a little Paris street. PERFECT - WOULD DEFINATELY GO BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Daneshavemorefun
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice area, helpful service, rather smal but nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: HYPERballadry
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here from 7 - 10 December, in a twin room. Room was lovely, small but perfectly formed, and a nice view down the street from the window (which you can fully open). bathroom was really compact, but again, it worked, and the shower was fantastic after a day of trekking all round Paris. Bedding nice and clean, fresh, all furniture and fitments very nice, no wear or tear, all lovely. definitely would go back to again, the location is superb. at night, there is so much to see and do around the area, gorgeous restaurants (esp. Les Editeurs), nice shops, and transport is at the bottom of the street (Odeon metro stop). if coming from CDG, get the RER line B to luxembourg and walk, its 10 minutes if that. superb. didnt have breakfast, but it smelt fantastic. staff very nice, one was a bit haughty, but hey, its Paris, everyone is haughty.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilioLargo
Reviews.Content: Staryed at the Jardin de L'Odeon in March 2006. The hotel is located in a quiet street near to the Odeon theatre and it is easy to catch the metro nearby. Rooms are tiny as they are with most Parisian hotels and the bathroom was cramped. But when you go to Paris you need to explore the city and not stay in the hotel room so this was not a problem. There are several bars nearby that also sell breakfast for about half the price the hotel charges. If you have not been to Paris before you should do some homework before you go as there is so much to see. I would highly recommend the Arc de Triomphe in the evening where you can see the sights lit up at night. The Eiffel Tower was disappointing (it is like visiting ride at a theme park but with more waiting in a queue) and the Louvre was good but far too large and most people will want to see the most famous pieces in half a day and then go and look at something else. Be careful with the prices in the bars. These seem to bear no resemblance to the location or the standard of the decor inside. After a long walk we went into one place where they wanted 15 euros for a large beer. We sipped small beers and then left without giving a tip and got a gallic snarl from the waiter!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: DruryS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in front of the Odeon theater, but in a quite street. Turn right from the entrance, walk 5 minutes then you'll arrive in the heart of St. Germain des Pres. The room is small and nicely decorated. I didn't experience any noise like the other reviewers did, maybe because it wasn't summer season. There are many restaurants around in this area. I was very hungry at 4.30 pm but most of restaurants open at 6:30pm so I bought food at Japanese/Asian carry-outs "traiteurs" as they call it there (rue de l'Ancienne Comedie). This street is so easy too find from the hotel (less than 5 minutes walk) The shopkeepers speak English and the menu are in English too. Good selections of food. I asked them to heat the food up and brought the food to the hotel. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base To Enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: lindad3052
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 11-16 2006. We found it a delightful spot. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the little breakfast room off the lobby where we enjoyed fresh fruit breads, cheeses and good coffee every morning. It also has a cute little courtyard garden area at the rear of the hotel where we enjoyed a glass of wine in the evenings. Our room was small (found out from others that this is the norm in Paris) but very clean and well decorated. There was a fridge and safe available in the room but we found luggage space a bit of an issue. The location was perfect for us as we were so close to everything. We also felt quite safe at night going out for walks and returning from our adventures. One thing we really enjoyed was the collection of Botero canvas prints outside our room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at L'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: bonb88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights there in September. The room is typically smallish, but is nicely decorated. The bed is pretty comfortable, and the sheets are clean. Bathroom is clean as well. The location is nice, but then again, Paris is pretty compact so it's hard to find a hotel that is not "close to everything". I do love the 6'eme arrondisement as they have all these great little bookstores on every little street. It's also not as touristy as other arr's. It is located on a street that you would think is quiet, but I do not consider that to be the case. Every night I could hear people (we were on the 5th floor) walking pass our hotel, obviously walking home drunk. 2 out of the 3 nights the loud people passing by were done by about 1am, but one night I was woken up around 4am from someone on the streets. If you don't mind sleeping with the window shut, you'll probably be fine. I do prefer to have fresh air in the room so I'd like to leave a crack. But then again, all this is not the hotel's fault. Yes, when we were there the construction was happening. It usually starts about 8am. I guess it's not necessarily a bad thing since it kind of forces you to get up and start the day early. Did not have breakfast at the hotel as it's pretty expensive. There are so many cafes in Paris for breakfast, why eat at the hotel?? Got a recommendation from the front desk, Resturant Christine, which was great. It's not necessarily cheap, but the food is great. There's nothing terribly fancy about the hotel, but overall I don't have anything bad to say about it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: realvacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for the price. Great location! We had our 2 1/2 year old with us and they provided a baby crib at no charge. The room was very clean. The room was a decent size by European standards. The bathroom was itty bitty, though....one person at a time please, even to walk in. We had purchased metro passes to get around the city, but later realized we probably could have walked just about everywhere we went. This hotel is about a 3 minute walk to a metro stop. Make sure you know where you are going if you do arrive by metro....the street is not very well known and it took us about 2 hours to find it! Next time I'll have better directions. =) I'd definitely stay at this hotel again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location at Quite a Value”
Reviews.Author: kingen
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is simply perfect. Backing up to Luxembourg Gardens, a stone's throw from St. Germain and the Latin Quarter, a short walk to Notre Dame, Ile St. Louis, and within walking distance of both the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre, many of Paris' sights are within reach. This nice little hotel is on a quiet street, and for those of you who require a bit of home, a Starbuck's is about 4 blocks away. This is a typical Paris hotel in many ways. Specifically, the rooms are small (though very comfortable). But then how much time do you spend in your room while in Paris? I would highly recommend this hotel to travellers who know that it's all about location, but are working on a budget as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: japhycakes
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel nestled in the Latin Quarter of Paris. The staff was extremely helpful. The rooms were immaculate, although tiny. Superb location, on a quiet street close to pretty much eveything. Would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marble_girl
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Paris for his birthday and wanted to fit in lots to do in the two days we were there. Location was therefore high on my list. Jardin de L'Odeon fit the description perfectly - in walking distance of the Jardin de Luxembourg, the river Seine, Eiffel tower (about 20-25min stroll), Notre Dame, Rue Mouffetartd (where the food market is) and the buzzing streets of rue la Huchette made it ideal. When we arrived at 12.45pm although there were signs that said check-in was from 1pm we were advised that our room wouldn't be ready for about 1-1.5hrs. We wasn't too fussed by this as we came by Eurostar from London and the journey was only 2hrs and 35mins, so we left our bags in a room downstairs and went to explore the city. When we came back to the hotel later that night we were given our keycard and located our room on the 6th floor. It was a decent size by European standards and very clean too. The only problem we had was when we had a shower the angle of the shower head couldn't be altered so we had to hold the shower head to wash which was annoying. Also the hairdryer was extremely loud (we were woken early the next morning by another room's hairdryer). The staff were really friendly and helpful though and I would definitely recommend this as a starting point to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor0413
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, it's location is perfect, the hotel is lovely and the staff were very helpful. We stayed in a room directly on the breakfast courtyard, the windows kept the noise of people eating out incredibly well! There was also air conditioning which was great because the windows being open allowed for no privacy. We did not mind this, others might. Booked this based on reviews here and wanted to warn that there is VERY LOUD construction going on adjacent to the hotel. The banging and jackhammering was only on the weekdays and it started at 8 a.m. (promptly!). Unsure of how late it went, as we were out all day after our loud awakening! I can't imagine any room in the place was safe from the noise and the construction project looked like a gut reno that was just starting around the corner. If you plan to be up and out by 8, and gone all day, as we were, it would be okay. Otherwise, call or e-mail to see if it's still going. We were there Sunday Sept. 3 and left this past Friday, the 8th. Paris is beautiful, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boston_empty_nesters
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of Tripadvisor reviews, we booked a short stay in the Jardin de L'Odean in July 2006. The location is absolutely wonderful, just 3 blocks from St Germain/San Michele and the metro, yet tucked into the small side streets where it's quiet. Apparently recently remodeled, it was immaculately cared for, had great A/C, comfortable beds and linens, and probably the largest bathroom in the city! We have been to Paris many times, and have always stayed in smaller European hotels, but this was the best we've seen. Highly recommended, best hotel for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Jardin de l'Odeon, St. Germain, Paris”
Reviews.Author: annarbortraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 8 night stay at the Jardin de l'Odeon in August, 2006. Here are some general comments about the location, rooms, bathrooms, facilities, etc. 1) The most fantastic thing about the hotel was its location. The hotel is on an extremely quiet street but in a very convenient location. It's about 1 block from the street St. Germain in the heart of St. Germain de pres, 1/2 a block from the Odeon theater (which we could see from our window), maybe 1 1/2 blocks from the Jardin du Luxembourg and the Luxembourg Palace, and a very close distance to an RER station and a metro station. There were excellent restaurants all around. You can walk to virtually any tourist site in Paris. Notre Dame is a short walk. We also walked to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Montparnasse, Champs Elysee, everywhere. Shopping at St. Germain de Pres, with all the designer boutiques mixed in with cute and unique shops of all kinds was amaizng. 2) The hotel rooms were small but not cramped, and well-designed (our room had a desk tucked into a corner, a small hallway to the bathroom, a decent-sized closet where we tucked in our suitcases, and large French windows that made the room seem more spacious). They were recently remodeled and very clean. We did not feel crowded after 8 days, and the room was well-taken care of during our stay. 3) The bathroom was virtually new, with an excellent shower (our room had a nice deep tub but some rooms had only showers), large white tiles. 4) For people who care, there was shampoo, bath/shower gel, shower cap, mending kit, and soap in the room; there were ironing facilities in the basement and you could send out your laundry if you wanted to pay 4 euros to get underwear washed, and a steep 32 euros for an evening dress :). 5) The lobby was lovely, the breakfast room was nice with a small sunroom (2 tables). The courtyard looks beautiful in the pictures and IS lovely, but very small (2-3 small tables). 6) Breakfast was nice, and included croissants (quite delicious), bread, orange and grapefruit juice, coffee (kind of lame), tea, hot milk, cereal, pain de chocolat (I gained weight), sliced meats (excellent quality), yoghurt (very delicious), cheeses (also very good). If it comes with your room, it is fine. If not, 12 euros is steep given that you could get a full hot breakfast for that price virtually anywhere around, and pastries and such for amazingly cheap all over. 7) Of restaurants nearby, we ate at Polidor (a well-known historical brasserie) which was pretty good but not amazing, Le Petite Hostellerie (not very good but cheap), lots of small sandwich shops and creperies, Le Canton (a Chinese restaurant which was pretty good), and Indonesia (good appetizers and dessert but the main course wasn't so great). Still, Le Canton and Indonesia were excellent deals. We ate at one fancy seafood place that was EXCELLENT near Montparnasse called La Cagouille which had a pretty decent fixed price menu (but with wine our dinner for 2 was about 85 Euros, not cheap certainly but actually a good price for the several courses of amazing food). 8) Hotel employees were uniformly helpful, and all spoke English well. 9) We paid $103 Euros a night for our room including breakfast for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, immaculate and contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: holagente
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! First time in Paris, and traveling alone, decided to stay here based on reviews on this site. I couldnt' have been more satisfied: the hotel is so clean, room was extremely clean and well maintained with a contemporary decor. Breakfast service was top notch, with courteous staff and excellent presentation. Air conditioning worked perfectly in the very HOT summer days that I was there. Location is perfect, a block away from the main shopping strip. I will definitely return, will not consider staying anywhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean place for a comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: chrislleida
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, friendly staff, abundant tasty breakfast, air conditioning (it was 35 degrees outside when we were there). We had a room on the first floor with a terrace which more than made up for the slightly tight room. Shower a bit low for a 6 foot plus. The corridor was rather narrow, but everything was in good repair and very clean. Breakfast in the patio was a treat, the usual fare plus abundant fresh fruit. A good way to start the day. It's only a few minutes from Metro and bus a very near the Jardins de Luxemburg for a quiet stroll. Nice place for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in June and loved it. The location is perfect and we were able to walk to all attractions in the city. If you travel lightly you can even use the RER Luxembourg to get to and from the airport. We did this going home which for 8 euros per person is a great deal. Also, don't miss the jardin de luxembourg which is 2 blocks from the hotel. It is a fantastic place to relax and take in the paris cutlure. The hotel room was immaculate and the bed had 2 pillows each which is a luxury for european hotels. The bathroom was super clean. We would stay at this hotel again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a small, but comfortable room overlooking the courtyard. The staff were friendly and our room was immaculate. The location cannot be beat - we walked or took the Metro all over Paris. Hotel is between the Luxembourg gardens and the main street of Saint Germain - you have both worlds within a block of the hotel. There are many cafes, restaurants, bakeries, fast food within short blocks. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisean Gem...”
Reviews.Author: Ande G.
Reviews.Content: Booked here based on recommendations at this site. Loved everything about this hotel, from the clean, atrractive rooms, to the fabulous location and the tres helpful young staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place - great value!”
Reviews.Author: monaos
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel - three days in May. It has a perfect location if you want to stay within walking distance to all the major sights, the Latin Quarter and great shopping. The rooms are not big, but they are lovely decorated and spotless. Shower/bath also very clean, always enough hot water. Also very quiet although right in the middle of everthing. We stayed in a standard double facing the courtyard, our friends facing the street, but no noise in either rooms. We even had our room next to the elevator and had no problems with that. Helpful staff, and breakfast was also good value. We also had breakfast outside the hotel. Only thing I could wish for was eggs. But all in all - fantastic value for money. We booked early and payed only 113 Euros per night. Walkin rate was 195!

Reviews.Title: “Between Party and Peace”
Reviews.Author: LuxembourgHoney
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly through their website, which has numerous offers. We drove into Paris and was a liitle concerned about the car park situation, especially since the Hotel does not have a private one. However, we parked in a public car park on rue de l'école de Medicine - only 100metres from the hotel. Expect to pay around 25 Euros per 24 hours. The hotel staff were friendly and we had no problems with the facilities. The Classic double room was the normal small size for Paris, but was comfortable enough for 2 people. They provided toiletries of shampoo, bath gel, even a tiny manicure kit and cotton buds - which was a nice touch. The long windows were a lovely feature. Although the view was only of the courtyard and an empty building opposite - it did provide us with the quiet needed for a good night's sleep. We didn't have the breakfast, so cannot comment on it. However, there are many places nearby where you can eat any meal of the day. For dinner, we can recommend the little restaurant opposite, who accomodated us without a reservation - go early in the evening if you haven't reserved. This restaurant felt like you were sitting in the family's dining room and the food and the staff were very nice. Maybe not recommended for vegetarians though. The location was fantastic - on the one side was the start of the Latin Quarter with its bars, cafes and resataurants. On the other side was the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg with its peaceful, relaxing landscaped gardens, water features, an area for playing chess and the gardens' Palace. If this is too quiet, you can also find tennis courts, children's play areas, cafes, pony riding and a pathway for jogging. So, being at the Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon enables you to enjoy more than one side of Central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved and Impressed”
Reviews.Author: SmilingTexas
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Europe before so were very unsure of what to expect after booking on the internet a half world away! Staff - very nice & accomodating. Spoke English and were patient with our limited French! Called to order our taxi for the airport the next day and it was early! No nail biting wondering if it was going to show and miss a flight and all that fun stuff! Room - double beds with a room overlooking the small patio area; nice, clean room. Half shower door that allowed splashing of the sink area...didn't really like that part but everything else was fine. Area - felt safe. Locals very nice & helpful. Never met one of the stereotypical Rude French. We were looking at a map on the corner outside the hotel one morning and a local French woman in a mink stopped to help us find our way! We were within walking distance to a few well known sites. Also within walking distance of the Metro which my traveling friend quickly figured out all the ins and outs of metro travel ( it confused me so I let her do it!). One Metro ticket will last you all day! Would I stay there again? Yes. Would I recommend it to another traveler? Already have...she said they are going to stay at all the places we did since we didn't have any problems! Thanks for a great website! Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value without sacrificing location or comfort”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromKS
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on the Trip Advisor website and when I checked for rates, we ended up with one from Venere that was so inexpensive for the location that I was a little worried it might not be a very nice place. Judging from the other reviews, though, we figured it was worth a try. We would only be there for two nights, so we gave it a go. It was a perfectly delightful place, beginning with the neighborhood and the exterior and continuing through to the lobby, the staff, the little garden area behind the breakfast area (which was also very inviting), the 1st floor (European - 2nd floor American) hallway, and then our room. The new decorating has been done very tastefully. Our room was quite small, as expected, but very well laid out and very, very pleasant. We were amazed that they had squeezed in a wardrobe, a desk, a minibar and two endtables without making it feel cramped. (They should probably figure out a way to get some circulation behind/above the minibar, which created quite a bit of heat). It was nice being on the first floor because there were plants outside our streetside window that weren't on the upper floors. The shower had excellent pressure, as mentioned in other reviews, and the bed was very comfortable. We did open the windows for fresh air and did not find it noisy. We were very pleased they had free wi-fi access, as well. The location was superb on several levels. We prefer to use public transportation to get into and out of a city so it was terrific that the hotel was a couple blocks from the Luxembourg RER station, with direct service to both Orly and Charles DeGaulle airports. We also prefer to walk, so it was wonderful to be close to so many excellent restaurants and such nice shops, not to mention the museums and the grand boulevards, etc., etc. On our last day in Paris we were asking ourselves why we don't get there more often since we love it so much, and we resolved to do just that, even for a few days, in the coming years. We'll definitely return to the Jardin de L'Odeon on those return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: lhs624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week at the end of April. It was our first visit to Paris so we didn't know what to expect. The hotel is in a superb location. 2 blocks to the metro and so many restaurants that were walking distance. We also walked to many of the major tourist attractions so even though the metro was right there, we didnt use it often. The hotel is in great shape. Our room (45) was small but immaculate. It looks like the bathrooms had been updated recently as well. We asked for a bath when I reserved and had been promised one but when we checked in there werent any rooms with baths available. oh well. The shower was very good and had real doors so our bathroom stayed dry. I took some photos of the room so you could see the condition and how small it was. But there was a good closet so we could unpack and put our bags (small ones) away. And we didnt spend much time in the room so it was fine for us. Also, we didn't have the noise problems some other people posted. Yes, the doors to the rooms had a tendency to slam but we never heard anyone in the next room. The front desk was nice. Spoke great English and helped us when we asked for help (making a dinner reservation, directions to an internet cafe) We never ate in the hotel so I can't comment on the breakfast. We walked down to near the metro every morning and grabbed a croissant and juice. I would definitely recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Really Imressed!”
Reviews.Author: schnau-mom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a total of 3 nights and were truly impressed. I am amazed by all of the people on this site who complain about the rooms being small--how big of a room do you need? All we did was sleep there and spent the rest of the time enjoying Paris! The room was clean and decorated nicely. The hotel staff spoke English and were friendly. The hotel has a room in which you can leave your luggage as need be. We left our luggage there the day we left and had no problems. We felt like it was in a great location. We consistently used the Odeon Metro stop to get to our hotel. We felt like that worked best. There were several tasty restaurants in the area. Just ask the desk for a recommendation. My only word of caution...On the hotel information sheet found in the room, it said, "Minibar: At your disposal." I took that literally! I drank several small bottles of water (I was parched after the flight!) When we checked out they asked us if we had used the minibar and I told them I drank some water. They charged me 3 Euros per SMALL bottle of water! You live and learn, huh? There was a small grocery store nearby at which I bought a liter of Evian for 1.50 Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: dceditor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in March. The hotel was great -- a fantastic location, extremely helpful and pleasant staff, very comfortable beds, immaculately maintained. The front desk staff were particularly accommodating, recommending restaurants and making reservations for us. Our only complaints were that the walls are VERY thin (you can hear everything going on), the bathroom in the classic room was miniscule, and it tended to get rather hot and stuffy in the room, so much so that we opened the windows most every time we were there. But I don't think you can get a better deal in the city! And, did I mention the bed was super comfortable? I would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Spottless and well managed small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: m320au
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 star hotel around the corner, but thanks to an overbooking fiasco was moved here instead. I didn't arrive in the best frame of mind, but what a great little place it turned out to be. Professionally run, spotlessly clean, good water pressure, friendly staff, good location, great price. What more could you want in a european hotel? Yes, some people might complain that the rooms or the elevator are too small - and yes - when someone turns the tap on upstairs you can hear it if you really listen. But if you're not paying a fortune these are facts of life in just about every european hotel - I feel pretty lucky to have discovered this one by accident. Next time I come to Paris I will stay here by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gary_MO
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here are generally very useful. The hotel is superbly situated, being just minutes from Odeon metro and easy walking distance to the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Pompidou etc. The hotel itself is very elegant - nicely decorated (albeit small) rooms that were cleaned every day to a high standard. Reception staff were very polite and helpful. A number of people have mentioned the noise in their reviews and unfortunately I'd have to agree. There seems to be absolutely no sound insulation between rooms. For light sleepers, this will be a problem. I also noted that the air conditioning didn't work in my room - as it wasn't great weather this wasn't a problem. In summer though? Overall I think this is a nice hotel for a good price in a great location. Just be aware that if you want a quiet hotel - this hotel won't be for you - it is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended for the price!”
Reviews.Author: StreetFighter666
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews before choosing this cute lil' hotel and me and my partner weren't disappointed. The rooms are small but immaculate (cloth covered walls?) and the location is excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful, even at 2.00am. Try 'Le Pint' bar at the end of the street for a quiet drink, and Dantons restaurant on the corner does an excellent onion soup. A taxi right across town, recommended at night for the views, is only around 9 euros to the Moulin Rouge. The tour round town on the open top bus is pricy though at 25 euros a head. Really good for shopping too, with non of the usual chain stores evident.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely 3-star in the right area!”
Reviews.Author: grenille
Reviews.Content: I got an incredible price for this hotel from their website. I wouldn't have stayed there for the rack rate (190 Euro for our room). I knew we would have the worst room in the place because of the low price they gave us, but it was still wonderful. A tiny room, but large enough, and luxurious, with small (French) but comfortable beds, spotlessly clean, with a miniature bathroom (also spotlessly clean). Wonderful staff, unbeatable location. But 12 Euros for breakfast... are you insane???? I don't think so. Hit one of the snack bars at Odeon for take-out coffee (please, no Starbucks, this is Paris people) and the fabulous bakery a few blocks downhill for awesome croissants, pain au chocolat, etc. Also -- heed the other commenters' warnings about the noise. The walls are covered with fabric, but it is still loud in there. I will definitely return for the same price!! Otherwise, I'll check out another of the 3 dozen 3-star hotels in the quartier! Thanks Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon!

Reviews.Title: “Take ear plugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: brockset
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at Jardin de l'odeon. Couldn't ask for a better location, 3 minute walk to odeon metro station, jardin de luxembourg round the corner. Very quiet street. A few problems however. Noise from banging doors at all times of the day and night. Our floor had a family of Americans that seemed to think the hall was a continuation of their room! Even though the room was tiny, there was no electrical outlet near the mirror for my hairdryer/straighteners! Luckily the cleaning lady helped out with an extension. Didn't try the breakfast, 12 euro seems a bit steep when there are small cafes and a starbucks about 3 minutes walk away. While staying here you must visit Rue Saints Andre des Artes. Wonderful restaurants and creperies and the cosmopolitan atmosphere that people mention when talking about the Latin quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the hotel. My husband and I spent 8 nights here in March 2006. I agree with much of the positive feedback. The hotel is extremely very well located, staff is polite and will speak English, and the room and bathroom were spotless. It was almost a perfect find. There is a small elevator that can hold two normal sized adults with bags. Our room was on the first floor (second american). The hall was tiny - you would not be able to extend both hands at all. It would only be a problem if you were very overweight. The lobby was very nice and the staff were helpful when asked. They called a taxi for us and made us reservations as well. They nicely tolerated my terrible tourist french. They ask that you leave the key at the desk when you leave. This is one of those keys that you slide into a slot in the room and it turns on the electricity. Common in Paris and not an incovenience. They are at the desk all the time so its not a problem. Our room (#16) was a double and small but probably typical for Paris. There was a little alcove at the beginning of the room that had a table and a useful closet. We had received an unbelievably favorable rate of 120 euro/nite on venere. There rates are usually much higher than that and I would be reluctant to pay more for a few reasons: I found the bed to be torturous. The mattress was about 6 inches thick with no padding and extremely uncomfortable. I woke up with red spots on my shoulders and hips everymorning and terrible back pain. When standing next to the bed, it didnt even reach my knees which shows how thin it was. My whole body was sore for the week. Additionally, the towels and sheets were very rough. Even my non-picky husband notices his skin was all irritated from the sheets. Like too much bleach or starch. The blanket thing was weird. When we first obtained the room, there was a quilted cover on the bed that looked like a placemat for a bed. That disappeared after the first day. The blanket consisted of a fairly think blanket between two scratchy sheets. Oh how I longed for a quilted blanket or a soft blanket. Thankfully, the pillows (4) were very comfortable. It was not as quiet as I prefer. The double pane windows did a good job when closed from most street noise at night. However, only the suites are air conditioned so if you stayed in the summer and needed to open the windows, you lose the benefit of the windows. I could hear the TV of my neighbor through the wall, water running in the pipes, and the slam of every door. The maids get going around 9 am and its really noisy. If you bring a white noise machine, it might help. The bathroom was large and all tiled with white ceramic tile. It was spotlessly cleaned every day. We had a tub with a mounted shower and one of those half glass shower doors. The floor still got wet despite this. There was a fairly good hairdryer but it didnt reach the mirror so you kind of had to bob back and forth to see how you were doing. There was no plug in the bathroom for a shaver or hairdryer. Sorry to say, i would not stay again mostly due to the discomfort of the room. Its a shame because there were so many nice things about the place but the lack of a comfortable cushy place to sleep was a big drawback. I would have been really disappointed had I paid more. Lastly, the best pictures of this hotel are found at Parisby. They are accurate and comprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in a charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thatgirldina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Jardin de L'Odeon from March 2-10, 2006. My decision was based on reviews from this website. Jardin de L'Odeon is located on a quiet street in the 6th, just a few minute walk from Blvd. St. Germain and the Odeon metro station. This hotel is also just a block away from the lovely Jardin du Luxembourg. There are many restaurants, movie theatres and shops in the area. Prior to arrival I had many email conversations with Alexandre which were both helpful and friendly. I was assured that all my requests would be taken care of and they were. Everyone from the desk staff, to the housekeepers, and the breakfast servers were pleasant, professional and efficient. I stayed in room 41, which overlooked the small courtyard and was next to the elevator. The room was small, but I expected as much, especially since I was travelling alone. 2 people could have stayed somewhat comfortably, but cramped in the double bed. Although tiny, the room was immaculately clean, with pleasant decor. The bathroom was a good size with a wonderful, deep tub for soaking, as well as a shower. Behind the door was a small desk, equipped with a directory of services and letterhead/envelopes from the hotel. The room also included a good sized wardrobe for hanging clothes, with shelves, a safe and a mini-bar. I did not notice much noise the first few nights of my stay, which may have been due to the hotel not being fully booked or my being tired and jet-lagged, but on Friday and Saturday nights, there was some noise from guests returning late in the night. Even though I was in a room next to the elevator, I was not disturbed by it. Although the posted rate in the room was 195 euro, I paid substanially less than that amount by booking through Expedia. I do believe 195 euro was a bit high for this hotel. The hotel breakfast is 12 euro and was not included in my rate. It was substanital and delicious. Guests could choose to either eat in the breakfast room overlooking the lobby and courtyard, or order up to their room. Overall, I was pleased with my stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “There is better value for money elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: sprinkles21
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading all the reviews on this website. This hotel is close to the main strip in Saint Germain. It is in a good location and close to restaurants and the metro. However, there are a number of 3 star hotels similar to this one (three next door) that would be better value for money. The walls were paper thin and you could hear everything - the elevator doors opening and closing, people talking in adjoining rooms, doors slamming. The room was way too hot and being unable to change the temperature and getting no help from the front desk, we resorted to opening the windows during the middle of winter. Our room had orange and red striped wall paper and if that isn't enough to make you run in the other direction, then this actual size of the room including the bathroom should. We had to stand in the shower to dry ourselves. The room was tiny - we had double beds that touched because there was literally no room around them. Everytime we left the building we had to hand in our room key to the manager on duty. I also had a problem with one of the managers - who was incredibly rude over a tour that I had booked. I felt it unneccesary for him to have behaved this way- not only to myself, but to the tour operator who collected me from the hotel. I would never stay at this hotel again although I would stay in the vicinity of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vkcampi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this super clean very friendly and centrally located little Paris hotel for a 6 day visit to Paris. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They offered to make dinner reservations and call us a cab without us even having to ask. The rooms have been recently renovated and are very nattily attired. The bathrooms were impeccable and the shower although small was powerful and not the usual weak stream often found in Europe. Although the rooms are small this is common in Paris. The location was close to everything and we walked to most attractions. The Metro and RER are nearby for anyone using Paris's very good mass transit system. La Camus the little restaurant across the road was a bargain and a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pblackwell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekender and left Paris very relaxed. Room decor was lovely. Street was quiet. Rear rooms back onto a courtyard which has a water feature for some added ambiance. Young staff seemed ready to help and didn't seemed too phased being woken in the wee hours to let us in. Short walking distance to Seine / Lourve, great position.
